Reviews.Title: “Dependable and Predictable”
Reviews.Author: nowine
Reviews.Content: always good here. only complaint is the start time of breakfast on weekends. not customer friendly.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel especially for families”
Reviews.Author: M33star
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay., The suite was very comfortable for two adults. This is a great hotel for families with its very large breakfast and its reception/happy hour in the evening with snacks and drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: MarjiTraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at this hotel and we will definitely return. Great location in the middle of downtown and walking distance from all the attractions. Rooms are very clean and very spacious. The service is excellent, free breakfast and evening cocktails give a plus to this hotel. Very nice staff and concierge. The WiFi is not free but there is free access in the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Will Return...”
Reviews.Author: spartantraveler4112
Reviews.Content: This hotel was excellent! The service from the very beginning was great! The woman who checked us in was awesome. She was so nice and warm. Room was great! View was not (parking garage) but I guess I really wasn't concerned. The rest of the suite made up. The breakfast was really good; anything you want on an omelet, scrambled eggs, french toast, waffles, oatmeal, fruits. Excellent selection. Popular spot, but never had any line or table issues. Hotel is located right by red line, across the street from a Jewel-Osco, on top of a Subway/Starbucks. Mag Mile within a few blocks, Gino's East was excellent, 1 block north then a couple west on Ontario and Wells (bring a marker and write on wall, table, chairs)!! Get a CTA pass at a CVS (1-day $7 - 3-day $14). Chicago's public transit is so easy to catch on to and very reliable. The city is Huge and this was a great way for us to get to Lakeview, Science Museum, Bulls game, Lincoln Park/DePaul, back to Lakeview to see a show at ComedySportz Chicago (awesome!!), Shedds Aquarium (we were there for 4 days). I will be back. This hotel was not only in a great location, but had an excellent FREE breakfast and the entire staff was very pleasant!!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Summer45_10
Reviews.Content: Check in and amenities were good. Free breakfast and evening cocktails a bonus. Room was good, but we needed to request extra towels for our family sized room. However, towels were provided pool side for swimming and hot tub. Overall it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to the Magnificent Mile”
Reviews.Author: JLK41811
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in walking distance of the Magnificent Mile. There are some local shops and restaurants nearby as well, including Pinkberry (yum). I shared a room with my mother, aunt, cousin and my 5 month old son. I slept out in the living area on the pull out couch with my son. It was not as comfortable as the regular beds but I was able to sleep. The standard suite with 2 beds and the pullout couch was spacious enough for the 5 of us. Nice flat screen tv in both rooms. Microwave and fridge available for use. Seperate sink/kitchen area. Nice to have since traveling with a baby. Breakfast is complimentary. Long lines for the made to order omelets but you can surpass the line and grab other hot items, cereal, bagels, etc... There is a pool which I did not use. It is enclosed by glass and other guests sitting in the lounge area can see in the pool area. I don't care to have people gawking at me...especially since there is a free cocktail hour nightly (manager's reception) and this is located right next to the pool area. The cocktail hour was decent, some free apps like chips and cheese. Your allowed to have as many drinks as you want during the cocktail hour. You may order only one drink at a time. They do not limit how many times you go up for another though. They will card you, so bring your ID with you. Goood way to save some money before heading out on the town. Room was clean, housekeeping was efficient. I've stayed at nicer hotels in Chicago (and paid a lot more) but this was a good room at a decent rate.

Reviews.Title: “I will be BACK...”
Reviews.Author: SoleSurvivor_14
Reviews.Content: You must stay at this hotel. It is in a great location in downtown Chicago. Concierge was great! I had done a lot of research before I arrived in Chicago. He helped me pull all of my ideas together. The computer system crashed. So he gave me an idea for lunch. When I returned he had everything worked out for me for the weekend. Excellent service! Breakfast was really good. The only suggestion I have is to have better directions for going through the line. It was not clear what line to be in when you wanted an omelet and when you didn't want one??? Manager's Reception: Very good selection on food! Location: This hotel is in a great location. I walked to most places...I really lucked out on the warm weather in February. I know it could have easily been snowing. Bell Hop: All were very attentive. Haling cabs for me when I needed one. This hotel does not have free wifi. Also suggestion to the hotel is to have a recycling container in the room for those who recycle.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Downtown Chicago Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OmMay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel in downtown Chicago for 1 night. Our daughter attended a conference in Chicago and stayed here for 4 nights. All of us really enjoyed our stay. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and affordable. The hotel staff were all very friendly and the location was convenient to both restaurants and shopping. A 2 hour happy hour was offered each day. The breakfast was exceptional. Everything you could want was offered from made to order omlettes, pancakes, fruits, yogurts, oatmeal, bacon, cereal, bakery items and much more. And all was complimentary! We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Starting to Like this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 2ManySuitcases
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at this hotel nearly once-a-month on business for a while and I've never had a problem. Its location is close by numerous restaurants and, although I'm not a shopper, I can point out it's just a couple of easy blocks from North Michigan Avenue and all those stores. There's a pretty good evening "manager's reception" at least on the weekdays when I'm there consisting of light snacks with wine, pop, and other drinks - all free and very convenient and not at all bad. You get a perfectly fine breakfast with the room served in the atrium, making it a niceway to start off the day. The area, by the way, is perfectly safe. Parking is in a garage under the hotel. The door to parking is right off N. State Street at the front of the hotel, but the door can be a little hard to find if you're not used to it. The parking valets are great. No real waiting for your car. Starbuck's is right on the south side of the building, if you -like me - need real coffee in the a.m.

Reviews.Title: “Great for special occasion”
Reviews.Author: annegulyaswood
Reviews.Content: Can't beat the location, right downtown, but you do pay for it. Valet parking is $49 which was a bit unexpected, but nice to have the car in a secure location. Hotel provides complementary drinks/snacks from 5.30-7.30, the line was long but the drinks were good and STRONG. Breakfast in the morning is included and was pretty good; made to order omelets, hot and cold breakfast buffet, drinks, etc. The line initially seems LONG but in reality you're waiting 10 -15 minutes for a great breakfast. My only complaint is that during busy times the elevators were SUPER SLOW, don't try to go anywhere in a hurry!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: brizzeyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 4 nights and cant fault the hotel. The Suites are very big and have everything you will need , comfortable beds and 2 big tv's with plenty if channels . I had a very good rate and this includes a full breakfast , eggs any style cooked to order , suasage bacon biscuits n gravy toasts cereals etc etc Also the managers reception which I did not attend but includes drinks and snacks 5.30pm until 7.30pm every night. Locatiopn is great near a nice supermarket that also has beer and wine and 3 blocks from Michigan Ave. I would say that some of the front desk staff could vertainly be friendlier however that aside I would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Good location for a winter weekend visit.”
Reviews.Author: the1015club
Reviews.Content: I was pleasantly surprised by how much I enjoyed our recent weekend in Chicago at the Embassy Suites. A short cab ride (25 minutes with no traffic in the evening) from O'Hare and a couple blocks from Michigan Avenue. A convenient market at the corner where I could pick up a giftbag that I needed but where you could also get a nice bottle of wine or something fresh and delicious to eat.(which was open 6am to 12 midnight) . Breakfast was wonderful with lots of fresh fruit and omelettes to order. We ordered a late night pizza which was a crispy, thin crust delicious surprise, since we were too tired to go out but expected to be underwhelmed. Our room was very clean and perfect for the two of us. We enjoyed the short walk to all the restaurants and shops, even on a winter weekend. The only negative was the hot tub in the pool area was closed for cleaning and that seemed odd for a weekend. That was our only disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “I expect more from Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Tripp F
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed at the quality of this hotel for several reasons. First, when I arrived, I was put in a room that did not conform to my Diamond preferences. The TV in the entrance room did not turn on (with either remote). The remotes themselves had all the numbers and information rubbed off, I assume from frequent use. They should have been replaced. The drain in the shower was partially clogged resulting in a slow running drain. My wake-up call came a ridiculous 15+ minutes before the time I requested (using the automated system). I didn't want to get up that early. The room temperature was difficult to control and it was either too hot or cold, even shifting the thermostat one degree. The outlets in the room are poorly placed. I want to charge my iPhone on the nightstand (where it is also my back-up alarm-so it requires power to avoid draining the battery) but there was no place close to plug it in. So I complained about these items in the morning. The front desk person acted as if she could not care less. No apologies and no offer for compensation (it seems they have some sort of service guarantee). Will I give them a second chance? Yes. But I hope they see this and make corrections...

Reviews.Title: “Xcellent stay at Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: Danimals
Reviews.Content: I have to tell you that w/a family of 5 (a couple of teenagers too) we either have to stay at Embassy Suites, Homewood Suites, or a Marriott. Luckily, I had the foresight to stay at the downtown (State St.) Embassy location. Thankfully, the hotel wasn't very busy for my Dad's 75th b-day celebration. Everything from dinner at Maggiano's to the suite/hotel experience was smooth. Breakfast at Embassy was also appreciated as we enjoyed the free breakfast and were able to have the kids come down in shifts as they woke up to take advantage.

Reviews.Title: “Cocktail hour and free breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: robinita2
Reviews.Content: We made it in time for the free cocktails in the atrium. Just what we needed. The room has a living room and bedroom both with big TV's and lots of appliances: microwave, fridge, coffee maker, hair drier and iron and ironing board! All the rooms have a view of the atrium. Bed and bedding were heavenly. Breakfast has almost anything you could ask for and you can eat all you want. I'd go again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: braindoc2414
Reviews.Content: What a find. Near the subway, magnificent mile, and great restaurants, this hotel is the place to stay in a suite while in chi town. Room was clean and quite large with comfortable beds. The breakfast bar had madetr to order omlettes and the atrium provided a wonderful view. Most of all the staff was helpful and they took good care of our bags after we checked out. Just a great place to stay with warm people on a cold Chicago weekend.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful convenient hotel”
Reviews.Author: TLCRN90
Reviews.Content: We were in Chicago for business but this was also a vacation staying at the Embassy on State. We were in a all suite hotel exceptional room size refrig., coffee maker, microwave,2 sinks excluding the one in the restroom. Great location close to everything. 2 blocks from Michigan. Great breakfast, full not continental. Appetisers & drinks 2 hours 530p to 730p. We did not have intention to move our auto so we parked for less at a convenient parking garage right on the next corner. Safe. I believe 38 or 40 per night, One night we were exhaused decided to go to Bock Bottom restraunt. The Hamburger with gorgonzola cheexe & Bourbon sause is the best burger we have ever had. Wonderful ask also tor the lettuce & tomato if u like because unless u ask for the extras they do not serve it. No additional cost. Other restraunts we have tried before are one of the best Bistros Bijons, Keefers for steak, Grand Lux, Chop House, Bandera,Volera ( Italian, )The Purple Pig. Great hotel & great dining & business made into fun. The hotel is great for a girls weekend or for families also. Have fun we did 5 nights

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving get away”
Reviews.Author: nana3fromindiana
Reviews.Content: We decided to take my 9 year old granddaughter to Chicago for the Thanksgiving parade. We called Embassy Suites to make reservations. We were given rates and availability. I told them I wanted a room with a view of downtown Chicago. On our way to Chicago,I called and spoke with a very nice young lady who works the afternoon shift. She told me she would try to reserve us a nice room with a view. When we got to Embassy Suites,I again spoke with this nice lady who did,indeed, get us a beautiful room with a great view of downtown Chicago. Our mini vacation was wonderful and the staff was extremely helpful and friendly. Thanks for making our trip great !!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Clean Room”
Reviews.Author: penguinslide
Reviews.Content: We(2 adults,1 8 year old) stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel over Christmas weekend. It was a great location to explore the city by foot and metro. The rooms were spacious and clean. The staff was very friendly. The breakfast was plentiful. The evening happy hour was a nice extra. Our son liked the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Not really Free”
Reviews.Author: Wbgb
Reviews.Content: Wife won a free overnight stay from work .Not being familiar with downtown Chicago we were like deer in headlights Gps barking out orders -.Traffic & pedristrians everywhere and this was a thursday evening at 6pm .Seeing that we were clearly out of towners The bell man came right over to help {we were in the cab stand area }.Took our bags advised where parking was and walked us thru the check in area procedure Everyone was REALLY overly helpful and everone was super friendly Hotel room was very nice ,roomy and quiet We could have driven to Greek Islands restaurant but chose to take a cab . I realize that it`s downtown but all and all with $49.00 for parking ,12 dollars each way to the restauant and misc tips to the hotel staff ,Our free overnight cost almost an extra $ 100.00 Freebee cocktails -Managers reception - and excellant cook to order free breakfast probaby evened things out The location is ideal for people wanting to see the city as it is in the heart of Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MrandMrs5
Reviews.Content: This hotel has the total package! Not many hotels in downtown Chicago offer you a wonderful breakfast buffet as well as an evening reception. You are usually fortunate to get a coffee maker in your room. But, this hotel has it all. The pool are is very nice, as is the work-out room. The Business Center has 4 large screen computers. The rooms are immaculate, comfortable, and very stylish. With many restaurants near by, it makes a perfect place for a get-away.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TSP1973
Reviews.Content: We stayed their this month and it was one of the best stays we had in any Downtown Chicago Hotels. The staff was excellent, kind and very helpful. The Managers Reception that had free Alcohol and snacks was very nice. The Bartender was one of the nicest people I met in awhile. They had three different dips for their vegetables and chips that were very good! The pool hours were excellent, it open at 5:00am and closed at 12:00pm, which was very nice because we had a late arrival! Pool was well heated, except the depth of the pool was only 4 feet at the deepest, so not the greatest for tall people like my family. The Jacuzzi was just the right temp, not to hot and not to cool! The free breakfast buffet was very nice and the food was very good, a lot better than other free breakfast at other hotels I have been to!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Choice in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: bohste
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed downtown to take in a show at the Chicago Theater. The Embassy Suites was located nearby so we stayed here and we're happy we did. It all started with the lady at the front desk who was friendly, smiled constantly and made us feel like family. The rooms were clean and comfortable, their signature breakfast was outstanding, but the thing that really struck us was how courteous their entire staff was. They actually made us feel like they were glad we were there! How strange is that in today's travel world?! They also have a wonderful Italian restaurant onsite that serves great food from an innovative menu and terrfic service. Next time we go to downtown Chicago - this is where we will stay.

Reviews.Title: “great location, upgraded rooms--not your typical Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: go4elk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Embassy Suites a couple of times, for both business and pleasure. It's conveniently located near the Metro (1 block from the underground entrance), so getting there from O'Hare is not difficult at all. Both times, I've stayed in a corner room, and on my most recent trip (Nov. 2011), I noticed that the room had been upgraded: new, darker (read: more modern) furniture and decor. There wasn't a lot of LIGHT in the room, but it was also cloudy outside, so maybe that played a factor as well. Certainly not the fanciest hotel in the world, but plenty spacious and comfortable enough for a couple of days visit. You're right on State Street, and just a couple of blocks away from Michigan Avenue--you couldn't be in a better location. The Chicago Tribune is a few blocks away, and when I was there, that big Marilyn Monroe statue was still out front--very neat. Plenty of restaurants and stores are nearby as well (there's a Jewel/Osco store just down the block, and a Walgreens a couple of blocks away). Directly across the street from the hotel is a restaurant called "Grahamwich," which has unbelievable sandwiches; their grilled cheese is stuffed with cheese curds (!!!), and was recently rated one of the top 10 grilled cheeses in the country. It has limited opening hours, so be sure to go there when you can. It's so worth it (and very reasonably priced). The hotel has the great manager's reception (read: free happy hour) every night, so it's a great way to start out your evening. And the morning breakfast buffet is another great bonus for staying there. I would recommend staying at this hotel for both business and pleasure, and I will be staying there again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: CubsFan-TA
Reviews.Content: My family and I had the pleasure to spend the MLK weekend at the Embassy Suites, Downtown Chicago. A wonderful weekend from a smooth check in, cooked to order breakfast and complimentary cocktails a the managers reception. This is one of our favorite hotels in Chicago. The staff is wonderful, and caters to your every need. You are just a short walk from the fantastic restaurants and shops of the Magnificent Mile. I was especially impressed with the comfort of their beds. Great nights sleep. A very good value for all you get.

Reviews.Title: “typical embassy suites; great location”
Reviews.Author: FAMILY44444
Reviews.Content: a typical embassy suites: a two room suite around an atrium. furniture darker and rooms a little darker than some others but generally OK. Breakfast cooked to order, evening reception better on drinks (including mixed drinks) than snacks (basically pretzels and pita chips) -- residence inns much better on afternoon food. location is a short block from the red line grand stop and a short block from the 22 bus. we did all the tourist stuff with the 7 day unlimited pass and it worked out well. mag mile is 3 blocks. a lot of retail (including pizza, whole foods, trader joes, burders, mcdonald's, nice estauarnts) withing 4 blocks. decent size pool. business center has security software on the computers that caused it to crash a few times -- (and 2 of the 4 were malfunctioning) if your doing work better to do it on a laptop

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: WiscDoll
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Hotel Chicago Downtown this past weekend (MLK weekend) for a girlfriends' getaway weekend to do some shopping and sightseeing in Chicago. Check in was smooth and the front desk staff were welcoming and pleasant. We were given two double-bed suites on the fifth floor. Not adjoining rooms, but it was nice to be right next door to each other. Rooms were spacious enough for us and all the shopping we did! The beds themselves were comfortable, although the sofa sleeper in one room sagged in some and, since I was relegated to that one night, my night's sleep wasn't the best. Not awful, but not as comfortable as in an actual bed (which I had slept in the night before). Both of our rooms did overlook the adjacent parking garage, but since we weren't in the rooms that often, it didn't bother us too much. We could hear some noise from the atrium/waterfalls and during the cocktail hour, but nothing too loud. The nightly manager's reception was great and not as packed as the one I've been too when staying at the Embassy Suites Chicago Downtown/Lakefront. The bartenders were friendly and efficient at keeping the line moving, but the sangria tasted as if it had been sitting for too long. The hummus, veggies, and other assorted snacks were tasty after a day of shopping and sightseeing! Hotel is in a great location if you're looking for lots of restaurants! Weber Grill was across the street, Starbucks and Subway in the same building, PF Chang's was close, Lawry's was down the street, etc. Also extremely convenient to Michigan Avenue. We didn't park at the hotel or use the pool or fitness facility, so I can't comment on those aspects. Overall, no complaints about this hotel. I used to really like the Embassy Suites Downtown/Lakefront, but think I like this Embassy Suites better for the location and the fact that it's a little smaller, and therefore was not as crowded over the long weekend! We'll be back, hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Perfect and What a Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: NorthWoodsWanderer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference the weekend before last. Much to say about this hotel, almost all positive. The rooms are spacious, and of course being a suite it is rooms, not room. Although I was traveling alone on this trip it would have been perfect had my family been with me. You could put the kids to sleep in one room and stay up a bit in the other with a flatscreen TV, desk, and couch. Beds were clean and comfortable. All amenities as they should be, and having a frig in the room always a plus. The breakfast included with the room is on an entirely different scale from your typical chain hotel free breakfast. This wasn't some cereal and a wafflemaker. They had a large grill going and made eggs and three egg omelets to order. You just want egg whites? No problem. Your choice of fresh ingredients in your omelet. There was also french toast, pancakes, scrambled eggs, breakfast meats, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit, coffee, tea, juice, cocoa, oatmeal, cereal, toast. The only thing I didn't see was a wafflemaker, which I didn't miss. Even though it was busy, lines were not excessive for both of my breakfasts. I didn't have to eat until dinner after this breakfast, which rivaled a breakfast from Perkins for free. Speaking of dinner, every night the hotel had a free reception from for two hours with some appetizers (taco chips and salsa, etc.) and drinks - as in free drinks. Soft drinks, beer, wine, cocktails were all available to guests at no charge. This again was something I'd never seen before in a chain at this price point. The location is very good, walking distance to Michigan Avenue in a central River north location, lots of restaurants nearby. The building shows no signs of wear. Nice place. Only flaw, the exercise room adjacent to the pool was closed. Not sure why. They had moved three or four pieces of equipment to another room as a temporary workout area, but this was inadequate. I assume whatever the problem was in the original room, which looked like a nice workout area, will be rectified shortly. All in all an excellent stay. I would not hesitate to stay here again if the price was reasonable. I should add that I had a conference rate that was under $100 which was a fantastic value for this hotel, icing on the cake.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service excellent Long lines”
Reviews.Author: tedandlisa90
Reviews.Content: This ES was in a good location and close to the central area of Chicago a quick drive over to the Navy Pier although I suppose you could walk if you like. Â We were lucky enough to stay in the Presidential suite on the top floor which was a great choice for our family of 5. One bedroom had 2 double beds and the other had a king bed and there were 2 full baths. Â There was also an ample living room with a large L shaped couch and a very nice wet bar with a large dining area. 3 total flat screens. Â Nice space. Â The service there was also very good. Â Their daily breakfast area would get crazy busy everyday we were there. As would the afternoon happy hour. Be there early or you'll have to fight in the lines or miss out. Â I would recommend this hotel for families.Â

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: explore with more
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at the Embassy Suites while attending a conference. The hotel was centrally located downtown on State Street - lots of restaurants and shopping nearby. And with the subway just a block away we were able to take the subway to/from O'Hare. The room was a two-room suite - clean and nicely-equipped with a small refrigerator, microwave, and coffee/tea maker, etc. The bed was very comfortable -- although the pillows could be a bit larger! -- and it was quiet. Overnight there wasn't much noise coming from the street outside. The only thing about the room that could be improved is updating the bathroom. The shower was excellent - great water pressure and good hot water, but the tub is old, and hence it was not sparkling as it should be. Indeed it looked a bit stained/darkened from years of use. But on other positive notes: in the Atrium, there is a nice "manager's reception" each evening which is free and includes light snacks and drinks (non-alcholic and alcholic This was a good place to mingle with other conference participants. And the free breakfast in the morning (also in the Atrium) is excellent - plentiful, and lots of good fresh options. There is an indoor pool which we didn't have time to use, but it looked quite nice. There is a small business center which we both used. It was nice to be able to print documents from the computer for free. A comfortable, very good choice for Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: GoBoilers823
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel over New Year's with my husband and some friends. The rooms were very clean and spacious. Our room was right across from the elevators which was quite noisy, day and night. The happy hour was a nice bonus, and the breakfast each morning was quite good. The hotel's location is very close to Michigan Avenue, restaurants and shopping. I would definitely stay here again next time I'm in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Funonewi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Embassy Suites 5 times now and love the layout and the location of this hotel. The rooms have recently been redone and it is a beautiful hotel. We enjoy the morning breakfast and the nightly drinks and snacks.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Nice Stay :)”
Reviews.Author: dovertechgrad
Reviews.Content: Our family of four recently stayed at the Embassy Suites in Chicago...Downtown for a few days of shopping, dining, and Blackhawk hockey. We have stayed at many Embassy's and this rates right up there with the rest. Great free breakfast and excellent free cocktails and snacks. Concierge was a big help in finding additional dining choices and shopping ideas!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service, value, breakfast and facilities”
Reviews.Author: Melissa A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for New Year's weekend and really enjoyed our stay. Every staff member we interacted with was very helpful and pleasant. The facilities were clean, comfortable and updated. They let us check in early and stored our luggage after we checked out since our flight wasn't until 7pm. The breakfast was excellent and served until 10:30 on the weekends. The hotel was organized and had a plan in place to keep New Year's celebrations to an appropriate level, and security measures to make sure only hotel guests came in to the hotel. We will definitely stay here again. Would recommend just using cabs and leaving the car at home. Cabs are always available and it was cheaper to use cabs rather than parking car at the hotel or the various locations we visited around Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great location, good rooms, a little pushy about turning over”
Reviews.Author: braneout
Reviews.Content: Friendly enough, room was ready a bit early but that's probably because they come knocking at 9am to see if you're gone yet. There is cheaper parking across the street (to the south) if you don't want to pay the $46 for under the hotel. Starbucks and Chili's within one block, and there's a grocery/drugstore across the street. Good base to explore from.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy stay”
Reviews.Author: Lisandro T
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay at the Embassy Suites. The rooms were spacious and were recently remodeled. The staff was nice and friendly. There is free breakfast and evening reception, however it get really crowded during the weekends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel especially for Chicago marathon!”
Reviews.Author: Runnermom3
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Everything wonderful that you would expect from an Embassy Suites. This hotel went above and beyond for runners in the Chicago marathon. Of course the breakfast was absolutely flawless. Was expecting to have to wait in line for a long time at breakfast and the managers reception since the hotel was packed; however, this hotel and staff were well prepared and ready for everyone! The cook at breakfast even made my children "special" pancakes. To add to the spectacular service, the hotel had pasta and bread (along with their regular managers reception food) the night before the race! FREE! Race morning they had early breakfast service pre-race that was amazing. Food on every floor! Walking distance to start... but a bit far post race. Hotel is in excellent location to downtown attractions. This will be where I stay on all future trips to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: brian d
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a night in Chicago. Blocks away from the Navy Pier and michigan avenue. Spacious, great location, lots of restaurants by walking and the staff is very professional. Will come back on next visit on May 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with good features”
Reviews.Author: DanC-in-USA
Reviews.Content: I like the Embassy Suites chain. It offers a consistent standard across all of the various Embassy Suites I've stayed at. This hotel was no different. Very good comfortable bed, good bathroom facilities with plenty of space. The room was very clean and very tidy. The hotel offers an excellent breakfast which includes a cooked-to-order area. The hotel also offers a "Manager's reception" which makes for a great start to the night! This hotel is well situated for various tourist areas in Chicago so makes it easy to get around. It is probably also well positioned for the business traveller as it is downtown. As always, a good, clean, comfortable place to stay. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in-town hotel”
Reviews.Author: theatregoernap
Reviews.Content: For a vacation in the city this hotel is tops. Complimentary breakfast with made-to-order omelets and complimentary evening Manager's Reception with beer, wine, cocktails and light hors douvres. Comforatable rooms with sitting area including comforatable couch and separate bedroom area. A block away from subway stop which can take you to Chicago's loop or other areas of the city. Also a couple of blocks from the Michigan Ave. shopping area and several CTA bus routes which will take you to museums. Several fine restaurants within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy - everything you would expect.”
Reviews.Author: messro
Reviews.Content: Great location. You can't beat a suite at an Embassy, clean, spacious (4 adults, 1 teen), free breakfast & reception, helpful, knowledgeable staff.

Reviews.Title: “Thanksgiving in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: gyar27
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights, stay and park package, very economical, two huge rooms with mini kitchen, excellent room service for lunch and dinner, free breakfast, and mangers reception at 5. Highly rrecommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Visit”
Reviews.Author: Scotland2010
Reviews.Content: We met up with our family at this hotel in Chicago, it met all our requirements, it was clean, lovely beds, good food, the Managers Happy Hour was fun. The downside - there is no complentary car parking, it was $41 for 24 hours regular parking and $48 for velet parking. We did not know this until we were parked, so it added another expense to our vacation. Otherwise it was a superb place to stay, walking distance to shopping and the Lake. The Science and Industry Museum is well worth a visit for all ages, we spent the whole day there, BUT is closes at 4.00pm and the eating places close before then. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: goin2
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice and great location. Check in was fast and friendly. We had a suite and it was very nice and large - will definitely stay here again. The breakfast was also very good, somewhat long lines but they moved thru quickly and the food was hot and fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family get-away.”
Reviews.Author: MItravels
Reviews.Content: We decided to take a last-minute trip for Thanksgiving, and wanted to be comfortable for our family of 5 without spending too much. With the suites, free breakfast, and manager's reception (free drinks!) nightly this place covered it all. The location is perfect--walking distance to shopping, restaurants, and Navy Pier and one block from the subway for a quick ride to the museums. We packed a ton into 3 days. Highly recommend the city pass if planning to visit museums and attractions. Don't hesitate to stay here. Very clean, newer rooms. Part of the reason we chose to stay here was for the pool, but we never used it. It looked pretty small, but I didn't expect much more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Huge Rooms”
Reviews.Author: GalwayGirl2010_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with family in March this year and this is a fab hotel with a fab location walking distance to Michigan Avenue and the loop. The hotel itself has huge rooms with separate bedroom and living room. We had a room with 2 double beds so plenty of room and large flat screen TVs in both rooms for the price great value. The also include free breakfast which included hot food, omlettes, sausages and then muffins, waffles everything you could ask for and all included in the price of your room and every evening they had a happy hour between 5-7 this included snacks and free drinks including beer, wine and spirits it can get very busy and the cues would be quiet but a great meeting point before you go for dinner. There was also an Italian restaurant attached to the hotel and the food was fantastic, we had booked a table but we were an hour waiting to be seated we didn mind as there was about 8 of us and we were enjoying our drinks for the inconvenience the provided us with free appetizers and there was so much we barely needed a main course. so would definitely recommend the restaurant. The hotel also had a swimming pool, the only downside was you would have to walk from your room across the lobby and the small bar area in your swimming gear if you were going for a swim, so i never tried it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in a Great City”
Reviews.Author: lyon4uk
Reviews.Content: We booked through hotels.com about a month in advance and paid US$376/3 nights. When combined with a discounted Porter airfare out of Toronto, it was a great weekend getaway. Main likes for this hotel are its location just off the 'Maginificent Mile', huge guest rooms, comfortable bed, free Internet access in the business centre and complimentray hot breakfast. Dislikes are the 'impossible to access' manager's cocktail reception, dark sitting area, poorly-designed TV system and generally 'tired' decor. There is an overhead walkway that connects to Michigan Ave. right outside. Walking distance to Navy Pier and Architectual Boat Tours: we took the Chicago Line tour which was in a heritage boat with an exceptional guide. Try Andy's for great jazz/standard food and Carmine's on Rush Street for a wonderful Italian night out. Great value in a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomma73
Reviews.Content: My friend and I switched hotels during our trip as her points at the other hotel only gave us so many nights. Since we had to pay, I wanted to stay at the Embassy. This was the best decision we could have made! We had a corner room with a small view of Lake Michigan. Our room was smaller than other corner rooms I've had at an Embassy, but it was clean and served our purposed well. The mattress and pillows were some of the best I've had at a hotel in a long time. The front desk staff and concierge were very friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The valet attendants were helpful as well and we didn't even have a car! The breakfast buffett was good as well. This hotel is situated in Downtown Chicago off of State and Ohio Streets and since we didn't have a car, it allowed us easy walking access to several spots. There's a Trader Joes around the corner and well as the Grand Lux Cafe as well as the red line train being a block away. This was my first time in Chicago and my stay at this Embassy made my trip worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Not perfect, but VERY NICE downtown Chicago hotel”
Reviews.Author: noduffys
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the 600 State Street Embassy Suites Hotel two nights, November 19th and 20th. Very nice 7th floor suite that was super clean and comfortable. Two in-room big screens TVs let me catch college football after dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: calicogobye
Reviews.Content: My 2 friends and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for 3 nights, arriving on Thurs. and leaving on Sunday, during one of the busiest weekends in Chicago. The Bears were playing in town on Sunday, and the Michigan Avenue lights parade was Saturday evening. But, the staff was great. While waiting in line briefly for breakfast Sunday AM, I heard the Chef thanking people for their patience; they were cooking for 1,200 guests. The buffet was quite adequate: from omelets to pancakes. On Thurs. AM, they offered specially-made chocolate chip pancakes for the children, and there was a make-it-yourself waffle station for adults. In the evenings, the Manager's Reception consisted of free beer, wine, and cocktails as well as veggies with dip and some other snacks. There was plenty of seating for both events. Our room was a good-sized suite with two beds in one room and a pull-out sofa in the living room. A foam pad would have been nice for the pull-out, but instead an blanket was used for added padding against the bed frame. There was only 1 minor problem with the room which occurred on the first night. The room was a bit stuffy, and there was a strong odor of fresh cigarette smoke in our non-smoking room. The desk manager responded to our call and explained that the air conditioning had been turned off for the season and somehow the smoke came through the vents and they couldn't tell which room it was coming from. An air purifier was set up in in our room and we never smelled anymore smoke. Our experience in the restaurant was also quite enjoyable. Both the food and the staff were excellent. We will probably stay there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal for the price”
Reviews.Author: Granolamama
Reviews.Content: I stayed there over Halloween weekend with girlfriends and thought the hotel was fine. It was a large hotel and very busy due to its location. I liked that they had coctails for the guests from 5-7, that was a nice touch, it was a small area that was packed, but it still was a bonus. The rooms weren't fancy, but they weren't bad. They were suites and big enough with a table. We ordered carry out from the resturant downstairs which worked out really well because we just wanted easy snacking and sharing and didn't have to buy drinks this way. The breakfast was not up to my standard. It too was crowded, and I may be a food snob, but after attempting a completley dried out omlet, cooked for 10 minutes! I went for oatmeal, and that was terrible. I liked the coffee and had a banana. I understand food for the masses can be hard, but maybe Less is More would bring up the quality. The lobby was pretty for the fall, the people at the front desk were nice. The other thing was the garbage. Because it seemed to be a party hotel, there were pizza boxes and garbage bags everywhere, and all night and then next morning they were still there... Maybe a few more on the overnite cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in Chicago, perfect breakfast and early evening snacks!!!”
Reviews.Author: litsa92
Reviews.Content: I've been there with my husband for five nights.This hotel was a big surprise for both of us. The suite was very clean. Two rooms en suite with kitchenette, coffee maker, fridge, dining area, sofa. The buffet breakfast was excellent .In the afternoon, at the atrium they offered snacks and coctails. The Magnificent Mile is very close and there are many restaurants and blues clubs nearby. I enjoyed my stay. Embassy Suites hotel was the best choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in downtown Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: cmurray942
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites with husband and two daughters. Fantastic location. We were walking distance for everything the Magnificent Mile had to offer. The room was large and clean. The breakfast buffet was fantastic and the evening reception was good. Although the food wasn't the best, my daughters liked the snack before going out for the evening. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice suites, beautiful atrium...”
Reviews.Author: Nance5612
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice recently remodeled Embassy Suites on the north end of the business and shopping area right off Michigan Ave. The suites are very nice, with coffee makers, mini fridge, microwave, wet bar. The atrium is really nice and serves complimentary full breakfast, and early evening snacks and cocktails. The only negatives were that we went in summer and it was packed with families, kids running around, and they do not offer free WI-FI all the time, they put it on special periodically. It is very near Water Tower and north Michigan Ave shopping. Restaurant choices are unlimited. Would think twice about staying here when school is out.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: advocateonwheels
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for just one night but I really liked its feel. I must be very old-fashioned because I see that other travelers call the decor "dated" but in my estimation it is very modern! There were a few cracks around the edges in the room, but they were very minor. (Why do hotels allow the caulk around the edges of the tub to get moldy?) The first room I was given had a strange echo sound through the vents, so I asked for the front desk for another one and it was cordially and quickly provided. The Embassy Suites happy hour with chips and dip and a free pour and the included breakfast buffet were dandy. The line chefs will cook your eggs to order or you can serve yourself from the buffet if you are in a hurry or just want a quick toast or cereal breakfast. I love the "suite" aspect of Embassy Suite hotels, and how the rooms open on the big atrium. I have also stayed at the Embassy Suite near Ground Zero in NYC and it has the same feel as this hotel. Embassy Suites Chicago downtown location is very central to shopping on Michigan Avenue and the riverfront. And the price I got through Orbitz was very reasonable compared to other downtown Chi-town hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Clos to everything, nice staff, room blah...”
Reviews.Author: exotik
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff at front desk was super, the only reason why I did not lower the score more. Xavier, was pleasant & cordial both days. The lobby with the big pumpkins...lovely. They offer free breakfast, but I didn't try it. It is a close enough walk to magnificent mile, close enough walk to the Gold Coast, and Wacker Drive. Down side, the little guy with the glasses the worked in the bar, I observed him being rude & snotty to everyone. Poor customer relations. My room, it was big, roomy, the living room area was nice, however the bathroom...uuhh the tub needed to be recoated, the toilet paper holder was stuck in a hole in a wall, with a piece of soap wrapper to keep it place, the view...a parking garage and I guess dumpsters. Oh and if you need to go to the airport in the morning....CONTACT A SEDAN CAR SERVICE!!!! The under 20 miles to Chicago O'hare took 1 hour 20 minutes...and that is after the actual 10 minutes it took to get a cab to agree to take us, they would stop and ask, "airport?" We say yes and they just drive off, really? I was afraid I was going to miss my flight. We had to hide our luggage behind the planters for the cabs to even pull over. The nice door guy tried so hard too! So what happened? I arrived at the airport (I was checked in online) slightly under the 45 minutes to drop off my one checked bag, so I had to reschedule my flight to 3:30pm or beg to see if my bag would make it then hustle to my gate. I have been to Chi 4 times. It is a lot of work and nothing to do but eat, shop, and go to museums. Just be prepared...it is not as simple as NYC or LA. IMO

Reviews.Title: “Good for downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: AvidTraveller2011
Reviews.Content: I thought that the decor of my hotel was a little dated, but when I walked into some of the other downtown Hotels in Chicago, I realized that this hotel was not bad at all. The hotel rooms are built around a large atrium so that from every floor (I was on the top floor, the 17th), you can look down into the atrium. As the name implies, every room is a suite and comes with a fridge, a microwave, two flat screen TVs, a settee (which I believe is a pull out bed too). Our bedroom was a little small, but had king size bed with very comfortable mattress and pillows. As to the value--well, decide for yourself--there is a manager's special happy hour every evening and a hot breakfast buffet with made to order omelette station. I quite liked their breakfast. I admit my price might have been a little low, because I stayed there as a part of a conference, but I thought it was reasonable value for money. Would I stay there for the price I was quoted outside of the conference? Probably not. Or I would try to find a bargain price on one of the discount websites. The hotel does not have a restaurant, but there is an excellent restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel and there are several good restaurants around the area. A drugstore right across the street is also convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Solid choice; location is superb”
Reviews.Author: jrleonardfl
Reviews.Content: Everything was perfect with my stay at this hotel. Admittedly, I had a 12th story corner room with two windows facing east to Lake Michigan. The Embassy Suite "signature" living room with separate bedroom always makes for a good business choice. As mentioned in other posts, the location is perfect and a short walk to the Miracle Mile or up to some great Rush St restaurants. This is a big hotel and there were typically 60 patrons every morning for breakfast; nevertheless there was never much of a wait for "made to order" omelettes or more than adequate sides. I found the hotel staff very helpful with a few minor requests. Yes, I'd absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, free made to order omelets, great price”
Reviews.Author: yesiwearshoes
Reviews.Content: Nice large room with seperate seating or kids room with pull out bed. Better than average free breakfast. All at a spectacular price for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel. Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: goochave
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights while on business in Chicago. We had never stayed here before but have stayed at many other hotels in the city. The rate was reasonable considering we had a 1 bedroom suite. The view was good. The room clean and spacious. Their breakfast, which is included, was excellent. We had omlets made to order every morning with bacon and all the fixings. The cocktail reception is very popular and we took advantage of it one night. Low grade liquors and poor beer selection, but what do you want for nothing. Overall a great place to stay. Would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location with a pool”
Reviews.Author: phdhonda
Reviews.Content: One block away of the red line metro, with regular bus line in front (North State st.) and 3 blocks away of the Magnificent Mile (Michigan Ave.) turns this hotel in a great option for your stay in Chicago. There's a large market just across the street (Ohio st.) to help you. A heated internal pool at 2nd. floor connected to the fitting room and a business room with free internet and printers, are available. Breakfast is OK: Omelet as you wish, tea, coffee and juices from concentrate (if you wanna real juice, got to the market across the street), few choices of bread, waffles, muffins and some fruits (watermelon, banana) with yogurt. My favorite: a big room (actually two rooms, with two flat TVs), with safe, fridge and bathroom with bathtub. Even a microwave is included.

Reviews.Title: “embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: Mz_travelqueen
Reviews.Content: OMG it was sooooo amazing i went for my birthday we were just a block from the rain forest cafe and the BEST SHOPPING STRIP EVERRR michigan ave the family loved it so did i can't wait 2 go back....

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: artygrlQcy
Reviews.Content: Great location for a walking experience in Chicago shopping, theatre, and dining. Great service, inside restaurant for a nightcap, pool for families, comfortable setting.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay. Great breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: dr_j_now
Reviews.Content: We booked a package that included parking. Hotel was great overall and a great value. Rooms were very comfortable and well-kept. Breakfast was great, but there wasn't really enough seating available for everyone on the days we were there. Pool was quite small, but was clean and not many people were in there anyway. The location of this hotel is excellent and it made accessing the sights in Chicago a breeze by foot.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, Convenient to Transit”
Reviews.Author: pacostewart
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights. Location only 2 blocks to transit, $2.25 subway rail fare to O'Hare airport. Walking distance to Hard Rock Cafe in Chicago, free trolley to Navy Pier. Free managers cocktails reception at night and free breakfast in mornings a definite plus.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mwelchtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed in July 2011. You can walk anywhere downtown--Michigan Avenue, Navy Pier, etc. Great Manager's Reception!! Great Breakfast!! Super fast elevators with great views from glass exterior elevators! Suites are very comfortable!! Perfect place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1005
Reviews.Content: I stayed here September 2011. This hotel is in a great location downtown. So many things are in walking distance. Hubby and I walked to dinner at Big Bowl and then to Starbucks for an espresso (which is right on the corner). The manager's reception was really nice. Free cocktails from 5pm-7pm. Snacks were also provided. I loved the cooked to order eggs. Breakfast also included french toast, pancakes, bacon, sausage, cereals, bagels, coffee, juice, etc. The staff was friendly. The 2 room suites are very spacious. The beds were divine. Like other Embassy Suites the lobby is decorated with water features and lots of foliage. Very nice. Valet parking was $42. It was a very nice weekend getaway. We are staying again in January 2012 for an overnight stay after a comedy show.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. enjoyed the complimentary cocktail hour”
Reviews.Author: RahulRellin
Reviews.Content: Great Staff, Nice breakfast and great rooms. Stayed with some friends and enjoyed ourselves. great location and a decent price

Reviews.Title: “Great room 1141, Great staff”
Reviews.Author: xterrared
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay with the staff playing a big part. I was traveling with a staff member, my younger son and was meeting my older son and a friend. We needed lots of advice on touring, store locations, restaurant locations and tourist tips. The gentleman who manned the concierges desk was patient, well informed on the local area, safety concerned with directing us to well populated streets, gave us discount coupons for several restaurants and was a delight. We were well taken care of with the front desk and bell men. We arrived early on Friday and had to store our bags for several hours, the bell service was quick and efficient. The front desk staff was friendly and accommodating. The reception and breakfast were good, but the lines were long with lots of football fans staying at the hotel. Our room had a slightly different configuration that worked great. We had a desk inside the door with the living area being slightly larger than the other rooms we saw. It is in the corner with windows on 2 sides of the building for great comparison views. It was very quiet with being off of the main central atrium. We had a great trip and really appreciated the staff and especially the concierges' desk.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: joanbosoxfn
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just OK. Typical Embassy Suites, but needs an update. My room was not very clean. The staff was nothing special, bordering on rude. I had to beg for free wifi even though I am a Diamond member. Then it only partially worked. We called the Concierge for a restaurant recommendation and they acted like we were a burden. For the rate I paid, I was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Great play to stay with lots of extras”
Reviews.Author: katlady1
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful, two room suite hotel. Plus, they have a great manager's reception every night with free drinks (no limit) and goodies. The breakfast in the morning includes custom omelets and all sorts of breakfast options. We stayed in a 'Pure' room and were very satisified with the cleanliness and clean air it offered. Cannot say enough nice things about the staff. We loved the man who stood outdoors every evening and hailed taxis and cleaned up the front entrance. He is a large man with a laugh and personality to match...he would welcome us 'home' everytime we returned from one of our adventures. Made us smile and the hug was a good thing. Also, the two lady bar tenders at the nighly manager's reception made it fun. This hotel is on State Street which is nearby to everything downtown and to the local subway. I wouldn't stay anywhere else when I visit Chicago...so satisfied were we on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: herold1961
Reviews.Content: Once you get past the front desk, this is a fantastic hotel. Front desk had terrible service and inefficient Hilton Honors service; however, the hotel is very nice and close to everything!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Jimmy J
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at thios hotel. It was a great place to relax and and a great place to shop. I t is located in a good area and i would recommend it to anyone. I have stayed at a lot of Embassy Suites all over the country and i must say this is my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great perks, a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: tmccullough
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel in terms of extra perks...I loved the hot breakfast in the morning and never encountered long lines. The manager's reception in evening with snacks and drinks was a huge bonus when I had to wait until late to go to a business dinner. The hotel is in a great location, within walking distance of great restaurants. The suite offered tons of room to get work done and relax. I ordered room service, it took about 40 minutes, but I enjoyed a hot and delicious meal. I utilized the valet parking in the basement, and was always able to get my car out quickly and easily. My only complaints were noise related. I was on the 3rd floor and the street below gets very busy and noisy early in the morning. I could also hear my neighbors through the walls. Despite these setbacks, I would still stay here again (but maybe request a higher room).

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing stay at a great location.”
Reviews.Author: LVTravelbug80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Embassy Suites on Columbus Day weekend with our 2 teenage daughters. We really appreciated the extra room that the two room suites in this hotel provided. We had an end room on the 10th floor which was very quiet. It was clean and the beds were comfortable (lots of pillows too!). The breakfasts were great - the staff was friendly and there was plenty to choose from. You can't beat this location, an easy walk to the subway and a bit further to the El. And great restaurants were in close proximity too. We will definitely look into staying here again on our next visit to Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location- rooms showing wear and tear”
Reviews.Author: BeckiW
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed with our two kids for three days. We visit the city from out of state every 18-24 months, and have stayed at this property the last three times we were in town. The reason to choose this property is its location and two room suites. The free breakfast is wonderful, and the breakfast staff went out of its way by making my kids chocolate chip pancakes. On our last stay, our room had a huge tear in the carpet-and no exhaust fan for the bathroom. The walls were stained around the trash cans in the room. It seems like some of the rooms need a little TLC.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: The M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Embassy Suites with my girlfriend in September and we checked several offers before we booked. The close look was a good idea as Embassy offered everything we were trying to find. It is located in the very center and surrounded by several restaurants and bars. Magnificent Mile is only a minute away and we had a comfortable and big suite. Staff was friendly and the concierge could help us with all sorts of things. The only things that didn't match our expectations were the beds, as we booked a king size but only had two single beds, the breakfast offer, which was big but didn't quite match European taste buds and the elevators that were too few in morning hours and made us waiting for several minutes especially at weekend. But all in all, we would immediately book again!

Reviews.Title: “Very large rooms & great breakfast!!”
Reviews.Author: swbkrun
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy suites during the Chicago marathon. The hotel & staff were VERY accomodating to the runners, offering a early morning breakfast of waters, bananas, granola bars, etc. The rooms were very large, the bed was comfortable, the showers nice. And the breakfast in the morning (complimentary) was absolutely wonderful - fresh made omelettes, eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, french toast, etc. Only shortfall was having to pay for internet access ($9.95 per day). The rooms are pretty noisy too. Other than that, no complaints at all and would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: islaforme
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a girls trip to Chicago, could not have asked for nicer accommodations. We had everything we needed (3 sinks? wow....perfect for 3 women!) The staff is very pleasant and accommodating, the conceriege was very helpful in setting us up for a specific tour. The hotel location is so convenient, the manager's reception and the breakfast were welcome perks. We will definitely stay here again! Many pluses and to be honest, no negatives. (And it was very busy....Chicago Marathon weekend)

Reviews.Title: “Staff”
Reviews.Author: Penny5004
Reviews.Content: Hi just wanted to say Dwayne was very helpful and did a great job. He helped with are luggage. He picked up from are room and stored it for us. He was very polite and helpful. Thanks the Omaha girls!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice - central location in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jcarpenter53
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in downtown Chicago close to nice restaurants. Traveling on business, this hotel is nicely set up with a desk and internet access (at $9.95 per day) to be able to work away from the office in comfort. The bed is quite comfortable for a good night sleep. The breakfast is excellent! Eggs fixed your way, sausage, bacon, fresh fruit, cereal, juices, fresh rolls and breads, Embassy provides the perfect way to start the day! I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: palrn
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned by others, this is an ideal location. I went with two kids and two adults. Room for all. Easy to access public transportation. Ideal for cubs games.

Reviews.Title: “I'd Definitely Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: DaveDworkin
Reviews.Content: From the friendly and sincere greeting from the doorman, to the bellhop handing off our luggage to our cab driver; we received good service from beginning to end. Because this property is in the heart of the downtown (North Loop) area, I expected and received a lot of street noise, but I had asked for a high floor when I made my reservation and they put us on the top (11th) floor. All the rooms are 2-room suites with a sofa bed in the â€œliving roomâ€� area and a TV for each room. The room had everything we needed, except the make-up mirror that my friend had requested. Thereâ€™s a mini-fridge, microwave, coffee maker, dining/work table with chairs. Until 10:30 in the morning you can get eggs cooked to order, but if thereâ€™s a line for that; you can get scrambled eggs, tater tots, bacon, sausage, pancakes, fruit, muffins, coffee, juice, and more without waiting in line. From 5:30-7:30 at night thereâ€™s a Managerâ€™s Reception with light snacks (pretzels, carrots, celery, nuts, and more pretzels) and complimentary cocktails. Thereâ€™s usually a line there, too; but my Jim Beam Manhattan was definitely NOT watered down. I tipped with a two-dollar bill and the bartender later came up to our table to ask about another round. We usually had no wait getting to use their computers for free Internet. And youâ€™re a short walk or cab ride to many major attractions. Downsides: Itâ€™s a bit pricey and the in-room coffee was very weak. But if I return to Chicago, itâ€™s likely that I will stay here. I'll just bring some instant coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ncypeacock
Reviews.Content: I having been staying in a different Embassy Suites for the last 5 weeks. I am impressed with this hotel. It was easy to get here on the L train and I felt safe being a single female. It is close to great shopping. Breakfast is good. They even had a decent evening snack. The last 4 hotels have just had pretzels and popcorn. This hotel had vegetables and warm snack.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect hotel for us!”
Reviews.Author: rebecca37
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a ladies trip from a Wed-Saturday. The room was great for three women to get ready in. three sinks and several mirrors!. Beds and furniture were very comfortable. All staff were very friendly. Concierge was very helpful online before the trip, and while we were there. the free happy hour and delicious cooked breakfast were fantastic and saved us lots of money. We would definitely stay there again. Within walking distance of many restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place great Hotel HUge rooms”
Reviews.Author: offwego4
Reviews.Content: That hotel is a great surprise for me. Have started my stay in the Marriott on block away, and after one night (which I booked through priceline) I got to this hotel for additional 4 days. You do not need anything more. Had also the free internet coupon from triadvsior (a great plus...). This place is close to everywhere: the loop, the mag mile area, Navy pier, and also the northen part (which is the fun area). Plenty of resurants around. Will defiantly come again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for us”
Reviews.Author: LorMo
Reviews.Content: Great location, great value. Rooms were clean and modern. Staff was friendly. Loved the breakfast - you just have to try to avoid the long line-ups at peak hours. With the fountain in the lobby, I always felt like I was somewhere tropical while eating my breakfast ... nice! The onsite restaurant (Pizzeria Via Stato) was very good. Room was a little noisy - seemed there was noise coming out of the vent in the sitting area, so I could hear people talking, arguing, etc. It would have been good to have complimentary wifi. Would definitely stay there again, it was perfect for us.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Sweet”
Reviews.Author: pooesq
Reviews.Content: great location and a great value. short walk to Navy Pier, North Western and good bars and restaurants. Loved PJ Clake's (a NY institution) in the lobby. Suite was great, particularly for the price. Breakfast was way too crowded, so much so that even though it was included I ate breakfast out instead. Would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites is a great value whether traveling for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: jeannetteoneil
Reviews.Content: We checked in and when we went to our room there were workers hanging on a scafolding right outside our window. They were grinding and clissling on the bricks and it was very loud. One of the workers waved to my husband and although they seemed very nice, we wanted a quieter room. We went to the front desk and they immediately moved us to the other side of the hotel. Our King Suite was very clean and modern and accomodated us and our two kids very well. Our room included a buffet and cook to order breakfast every morning and a two hour open bar cocktail party with appetizers for two hours every evening. The location is excellent, within walking distance to many attractions and close to bus stops and train/subway stations. We couldn't have been happier with our overall experience and will make it a point to stay at this hotel again on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: jy23
Reviews.Content: I was there with my family including a 7 yr old and 4 yr old for four nights visiting Chicago for the first time. We loved the city and we loved the hotel. It is in a great location. The kids enjoyed the elevator rides up to our floor looking out into the atrium. Rooms were very comfortable. It was nice having a separate bedroom with a sink in the room. We enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts and nightly reception with open bar. All of the employees were very nice. The pool was a little crowded but the kids had fun. No complaints at all. We would definitely return when we visit Chicago again.

Reviews.Title: “Centerpiece of a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Dave_S_Buffalo
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed here for six nights at the end of August 2011. We paid about $160 per night average from Expedia and were very pleased with the value we received from this terrific hotel in an awesome location in downtown Chicago. Suite was clean and large and the private bedroom was great for Mom and Dad while the kiddos slept on the large sleeper sofa. Fridge and microwave were basic but allowed us to store & reheat dinner leftovers, keep cold drinks, and cook dinner in the room on several nights (purchased from the very convenient grocery store across the street and also the Trader Joe's one block away!) We have had many free hotel breakfasts over the years, but this was sincerely the best we have ever experienced, both in terms of quality and quantity of food. The location was so nice! One block from the Red Line which connects you to everything! Public transit in Chicago is top notch. How awesome to get the Orange train at Midway, make an easy transfer to Red and end up only a block from the hotel, all for just $2.25 per person. You do NOT need to rent a car in Chicago. Evening manager's reception provided drinks and fun munchies. Small pool and hot tub, but perfect for the kids to fill time here and there. Pool area was clean with plentiful towels and did not reek from being over-chlorinated like so many enclosed hotel pool areas. Computers (with printer) in business center allowed us to research area attractions. I would add some negative comments but there really wasn't anything wrong, except that our bedroom door didn't really close all the way (the frame seemed to be warped). We had a great time in Chicago and this hotel contributed to a good vacation by providing everything we needed, and more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Love2TravelFreqently
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous. It is located in the heart of Chicago and close to shopping and restaurants and all the rooms are suites with refrigerators, safe, microwave and sink. The staff was very friendly and really worked hard. I especially appreciated the fact that the concierge was there all day and night and very helpful. The managers reception was nice because it gave us a chance to gather before dinner and have a drink and snack. The breakfast was extensive and included everything from omelets to cereal. I would highly recommend this hotel for families.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for a family trip”
Reviews.Author: Jess734
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 just stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. I booked 2 adjoining rooms on-line to the tune of $1500 charged up front. My online registration had instructions that I required adjoining rooms because of small children. Upon completing my registration, I then called the hotel and gave them my confirmation numbers and made sure they had my reservation for adjoining rooms. The man I spoke with confirmed that they had received the request and it would be honored. Of course, upon arrival, no such luck. Xavier at the front desk was curteous, but no help whatsoever. He kept repeating that they cannot guarantee such requests and he wanted to put us in rooms right next to each other. I finally asked to talk to the manager. She was helpful and fixed us right up. However, I was told repeatedly that they do not make those guarantees, and that had they been at capacity I would have been out of luck. I thought the customer service was somewhat lacking. Finally made it to the rooms and they were nice-- typical Embassy suites. Window faced parking garage, but I didnt mind-- I just wanted adjoining rooms! This was a very slow week in Chicago. There were few lines at the breakfast buffet. The food was fine. The people as usual, were rude. Just because food is free and in all you can eat quantities, people go crazy and all manners go out the window. So many guests at breakfast in their pajamas...wow. Room service food was good-- service was poor-- called three times for beverages and they never came. All in all, it was a fine hotel for a family vacation because of the large rooms and the breakfast buffet. The kids also very much enjoyed the pool. I would not stay here if I was travelling alone or as a couple with my husband-- there are much nicer hotels in the city.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: nosemedic
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went to Chicago for a short weekend trip before summer ended. I had been searching web sites trying to find a hotel close to the downtown area that offered most of the things we were looking for at a reasonable price. Found it. The hotel offers a free breakfast each morning and a nightly managers time were guests can come together for drinks and snacks in the evenings. A very pleasant surprise indeed. The hotel layout is straight forward and very attractive. Within walking (short) distance to all things we wanted to do while in the Windy City.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend visit to Chicago”
Reviews.Author: grj896
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel for a weekend getaway. They have a full breakfast and an afternoon happy hour that is included in the price of your stay. The happy hour is a limited on the selection of cheap booze, but no one seemed to mind. And, the breakfast line for omlettes takes forever. But, there is a Starbucks on the corner of the hotel. The hotel area itself is very spacious and the interior of the rooms also have a great amount of room. Everyone has a living room with kitchenette and then a bedroom. It was clean and comfortable. This is also a great location if you want to be close to all the nightlife and tourist areas. Great stay and pleasant staff.

Reviews.Title: “Million dollar renovation...BAD SERVICE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: traveller t
Reviews.Content: POSITIVES. 1. Rooms are really nice, really clean and really comfy....and really spacious. 2. Location is great. 3.complimentary breakfast and managers reception in the evening...great! 4. Workout equipment is state of the art. NEGATIVES. The SERVICE was the worst i've ever experienced. after standing in line for about 25 minutes for breakfast, I finally sat down to eat, i opened my yogurt and realised i forgot a spoon.... got up to get a spoon,...about 30 seconds later, my tray and all food i had lined up for was gone. When i mentioned it to the manager in the breakfast area, his response was "we are very busy and have to keep the tables clear"....NO APOLOGY! i was very disappointed that thats the response i get from a hotel of this calibre. i wasnt expecting anything grand, a simple apology and a word with the bussers would have been sufficient. Being a 2 room suite, there were 2 TV's, but only one remote...not a big deal........when we called for the remote, the phone rang about 40 times; it then took about another 30 minutes to get a remote. room was also missing an ironing board. when i called for a room service menu, the front desk transfered me to the restaurant, who transfered me back to the front desk, who placed me on hold for 5 minutes. I eventually went down to pick one up. The wifi did not work for my entire stay, the front desk response was "it should work" i asked if they had a support line they could connect me with.....the support centre said there was a problem with the hotel's wireless router....I understood, things happen....I mentioned it to desk staff after......" FYI, the wifi is down"...they didnt seem to really care! The general demeanour of the hotel staff was not very friendly!!! - no one really smiled. OVERALL, I would stay again because it was a good rate, great location and rooms are nice. BUT given the option of another hotel in the same area at a comprable rate, i will stay elsewhere. SERVICE MATTERS!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: seekingsun4
Reviews.Content: Great room, great pool, great breakfast = great stay! Love staying at this hotel. The rooms are great, the pool is wonderful for the kids and you just can't beat the breakfast buffet. We love the fact that it is walking distance to all of the great stores and Chicago landmarks. Had a great time and we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Business and 1st Timer”
Reviews.Author: KGoodrow
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this Embassy Suites on several different occasions. It was, however, my wife's first trip to Chicago. I was there for a three day conference, and she decided this time to tag along. The problem with that scenario is that she would be left to her own devices during the day. The hotel gets four stars from us for a few different reasons. The first is relative convenience. We flew in to Midway via Southwest, and opted to take the train in to the city. We had one changeover, and then the train dropped us about a block from the hotel. It cost us $5 instead of $40 if we had taken a cab. Secondly, the location. As I said my wife had never been to Chicago and was on her own during the day. This hotel is conveniently located to all the major shopping, there are a ton of good restaurants nearby, and you are a short walk to the train, and a free trolley to Navy Pier. Third, the rooms. Embassy Suites are nice because they are suites. The rooms are nice and spacious...and always clean. Fourth, breakfast. It is included in the price of the room and it is a great deal...especially if you are traveling with kids (which we weren't). It is a full breakfast, not just coffee, juice, and some danish that have just been removed from the wrapper. Bacon, sausage, eggs (scrambled or cooked to order omelets), home fries, french toast, pancakes, fruit. You easily save a bunch of money by eating a good breakfast here. I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty typical Embassy Suites, great location.”
Reviews.Author: toomanymileswithkids
