Reviews.Content: All Embassy Suites are pretty much the same... kid friendly, sweeping atrium, great free breakfast and so-so well drinks during the Manager's Reception (but hey, they're free so I'm not complaining). There is always something of a facade to it all; I think the construction and infrastructure are pretty cheap bordering on shoddy. We like the big rooms, but so do a lot of big families so it's really not the place for a romantic weekend. The rooms are drab and somewhat biege, showing a little wear probably due to all the kids. The staff was very friendly and quick to respond to some minor problems with the room. Would I stay here again? Probably, but there are a ton of other options nearby to check out. Best reasons for staying here: big double rooms, free breakfast, location, HH points.

Reviews.Title: “great amenities, great location - definitely will be back”
Reviews.Author: ivychick425
Reviews.Content: This location is amazing! I actually like it better than being on Michigan Avenue (and I've stayed at the Conrad). Its close to Michigan Ave- so easy walking distance, but the I like the restaurants and bars right around there, like Rainforest Cafe is fun for everyone of all ages. But I especially love Quartino's. (If you're in Chicago and dont go there, you are sincerely missing out - AND ITS RIGHT NEXT DOOR TO THE EMBASSY DOWNTOWN!) I was planning on going back to that restaurant anyway, because I loved it so much on a previous trip, and was quite pleasantly surprised by it being next to the hotel I was staying at. The suite is great- nice to have so much space in a downtown hotel, as well as a centralized atrium (many Chicago hotels have reaaaally long hallways since they just knocked down walls between 2 older buildings). Obviously Embassy atriums can have a bit of a noise issue, but I didnt have any when I was at this hotel, and I was near the elevator. Its nice having the bedroom further back so you dont hear anything! What can I say - Embassy's have amazing features - free breakfast, spacious suites, a lovely view when you walk out of your room, and a great view at lower levels while having a free cocktail in the lobby. Ahhhh I love Embassy Suites hotel :) The only downside was after hoofing it around Chicago for hours, I was really looking forward to having a nice soak in the hottub but there were a million kids in the pool playing nerf football (I think one NEARLY hit my head). Not the fault of the hotel, at all, it appeared to be a youth sports team or something....it happens! It was a nice pool and hot tub area, anyway. You have a view of it from the lobby, but it still feels a little tucked back so its not so creepy to feel like people are watching you :-p Ah well. I went back up to the privacy of my room and just took a nice bath :) When I go back to to Chicago, I'll be back for sure!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: BeachLvrs
Reviews.Content: Loved the location of this hotel -- walking distance to Magnificant Mile and Navy Pier. The free breakfast everyday was really good. The rooms were a bit on the small side, but that's to be expected for a downtown hotel. I was not thrilled that internet was an additional $15/day. On the down side our hotel room was really dusty -- air vents and furniture. And, the pool is really tiny. Other than that, it was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Second time staying, loved it, will be back”
Reviews.Author: Sam W
Reviews.Content: Great stay, everything went smoothly from check in to check out. A special thanks to Dinah at the front desk, she was the best and got me checked in 3 hours early in a room with a great view. The happy hour was legitimate also.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, rooms and overall hotel”
Reviews.Author: NYC_andyd
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel with great location in middle of downtown chicago, the concierge recommended a great river/lake boat tour, we walked to the Ohio street beach, the pool/hot tub were great and we are definitely staying here next time we go to Chicago. Of course, typical Embassy Suites happy hour and breakfast-- perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a family in a very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Emaitland
Reviews.Content: Despite a very tedious check in wait on arrival, the service and staff since then have been fantastic. The rooms are great for a family being clean and spacious. The children have thoroughly enjoyed the complimentary breakfasts, trying everything from the freshly cooked omlettes to the make your own waffles. My husband and I have also appreciated the complimentary drink and nibbles in the early evening. The hotel is very centrally located for shopping and transport links. I would recommend a high room away from the lifts to minimise on noise from the atrium. The pool is adequate if a little chilly and there is no changing room so you are required to traipse back to your room in your costume and towel. During our stay there was free Internet access which I understand is a summer special offer but this is extremely helpful. Overall great value for money and highly recommended. The staff are all delightful and happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel close to all must see's”
Reviews.Author: lisavivs
Reviews.Content: very smooth check in and parking was easy valet or park your self its simple . rooms have great views of city especially at night when lite up ! my room was large and clean had king bed and pull out if needed in living room. there was a separate door to bedroom so it could kept private if needed so the kids wont hear everything. the hotel was like three blocks to navy pier or 10mins tops lots of thingsthere to see and also steps from front door u could get on double decker bus and take a tour of the mag mile which is a good way to see it then get off and look around has lots of good food places and a stroll by the chicago river at midnight was so romantic its a big city with lots action and felt very safe oddly enough .. would go back in a chicago minute ..

Reviews.Title: “No Special Requests”
Reviews.Author: familytraveller1009
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through the central reservations (phone) because we were travelling with another family and wanted to ensure that we could be side by side or as close to it in the hotel. When we reserved the agent assured us that this was not an issue and went above and beyond to ask us if we had any other special requests that she could help us with to make our stay more enjoyable. When we checked in the lobby was packed and we were told that our room was not ready at 5:00 p.m. and that we should go for a walk and come back and it should be ready. After a "walk" we were able to check in ahead of our friends and again confirmed our request to stay together. We were told that this did not make it on the reservation as a request but that they would be able to accommodate us - Great! We went off to explore a bit and when our friends checked in they were put not close by, not on the same floor but 4 floors away. Not Good. The next morning I discussed this with the front desk and they told me that there was nothing they could do, I asked to speak to the manager as this was the reason we selected to stay at this hotel and it was important to us. The manager "Chip" came out and I carefully explained that this was arranged when we booked with the hotel through central reservations and then re arranged when we checked in. Chip told us that central reservations does not know this hotel and cannot arrange any special rooming. I said that we did confirm this with their staff when we checked in, he said that they consider that this was only a "special request"and that they cannot make any committments to us. It was concerning that he didn't make any apologies to us. Clearly we were getting no where with Chip. At the end of the discussion when I asked Chip what he could do to help us out as this was the only "special request" we had the reason we selected this hotel, he said that he would see if he could find a room that one of us could move to in the hotel for the duration of the stay and let us know. We never heard back from Chip or any other staff. It is really disappointing that such a simple request could not be handled and that their staff do not work together. For any other people considering this hotel chain I would be leary of putting forward any special requests, it seems as though central reservations will say what they can to get you to book but they have no connection with the hotels themselves and the hotel staff need training on customer service. The location is great and the rooms are perfect for families. Breakfast is good but it was very crowded and quite lined up. Unfortunately, they really let us down on their customer service and we were very disappointed that there was not follow-up

Reviews.Title: “Location, value, location”
Reviews.Author: FunTime46
Reviews.Content: Finding accomodations for a family of 6 on a budget is often impossible. ES allowed our family to stay together (2 queen/1 pullout) in a great location, offered free breakfast (head down early for best seating) and a managers reception (snack mix and a couple small drinks) before dinner. Although the lobby was pretty noisy, we were so tired from fun-filled days we didn't hear much. We brought food with us and shopped around the corner at a Jewel-Osco and by having a 2 room suite with the kitchenette, it allowed us to pack lunches for the day. Our room also had a great view facing Lake Michigan and we lucked out being able to watch the "air" portion of the air and water show. Most all of the "TOURISTY" attractions we hit were either within a 20-minute walk or an affordable method transportation was less than 6 blocks away. Free Trolley was awesome if you know where the stops are located. The only downsides were the small pool area and the slow elevators. But, we weren't there to swim and we didn't make very many trips to/from our room so we weren't really bothered by either. We would absolutely recommend this ES based on both location and family friendliness!

Reviews.Title: “We'll stay again ....... but”
Reviews.Author: DiDi2005
Reviews.Content: We pre-booked and got a great price. The location is perfect, close to the red line trains and other public transportation and easy to get to all of the tourist sites. Most of the people were friendly, especially the doormen and concierage were great. Breakfast is pretty good, but it was very crowded. While we were there Internet was free and even at free you could probably complain about the speed. You had to log on and re log on all of the time. So if it is not free, you should not pay the $9.95 per day! Every hotel has to do maintenance, and they were power washing the outside of the building and it was noisy. When I checked in, I asked about getting a room that would not be effected by this noise. My room reservation had been for a room with a "city view" and she told me that if I took a lower floor that we could get a quieter room. However, on day 4 of our stay, the power washing arrived at 8am. So I had the noise and no view. The hotel has laundry facilities, but beware they only have 1 washer and 1 of the 2 dryers was broken. Most of the people were great - really all of Chicago were helpful and friendly - however at the hotel, the desk attendance Jennifer was rude. When I went to the desk for help, she said just a moment, she was "busy" and she proceeded to finish up her check in paperwork, stapling and shuffling papers for quite a while. A person working a customer service desk should really deal with the person there - not with paperwork. When I mentioned that I had lost money in a dryer, she did not apologize, offer refund, or anything, her response was without eye contact and she said "Maintenance will know." and then she went back to paperwork. When I went back to desk later, I avoided her, but I did watch her work and never saw a smile or any sense of friendliness at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: Marcandfamgreenbay
Reviews.Content: Visited Chicago with two other couples. We loved the closeness of this hotel to the downtown area. We could walk everywhere! Clean, neat, friendly staff and great value!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: MsWrightWright
Reviews.Content: As everyone has said this hotel is close to good restaurants and area attractions. Navy Pier was about 25 minutes away on foot. The hotel was clean and the staff was helpful and polite. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ocionmist
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a work conference. I like the location and it is easy walking distance to many restautants and shopping on the Miracle Mile. The service was very good for as busy as they are. Plus i sat in gum in the taxi rixe from the airport on a new pair of silk slacks and their laundry service got it all off & looking like new for only $7.00. Someone may think that is alot but for me it was worth it since the slacks cost $79.00. The only disappointment i experienced was the french fries that came with my burger from room service were cold & hard. But the burger was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not great, but not bad”
Reviews.Author: lsabjazz
Reviews.Content: I was in Chicago with my daughter on a hot Sunday in July and needed a one-night stay downtown. So my wife booked this hotel online for us from home. She didn't have my AAA card number but was assured it could be taken care of at check-in. Well...at check-in I was told that nothing could be done about the rate and that I would have to pay the rack rate. Also, we were checking in at 5:00pm and our room still was not ready! We had to wait about an hour. The room was fine, although one of the remote controls was missing. Also, as with most Embassy Suites, it was pretty noisy, with children running around and looking over the balconies and such. But that was to be expected. So...although there really wasn't anything bad about our stay or about the hotel, I was entirely satisfied. I think there are better places to stay in Chicago, at least for me.

Reviews.Title: “So-So hotel in a great location but watch out for 'Clerk A'”
Reviews.Author: roadiecoastie
Reviews.Content: The building this hotel is in is old and dated but decent. The hotel is in the middle of downtown and close to a lot of things. Highly recommend the valet parking. Itâ€™s about $50/night but the security is worth it. The hotel was full all three nights we were there and the noise proved it. Thankfully, we were on the 6th floor so we were a little above the din. We were allowed to check in early (in the A.M.) which was great so we could put things in the room and go and catch a Cubs game (the best part of the trip!!) When we checked in the room was warm and there was no air coming out of the front air vent. I mentioned this to the desk clerk (Iâ€™ll call her â€˜Clerk Aâ€™) who said that she would call someone to look at it. She didnâ€™t. When we got back nothing had been done and I had to call maintenance. Turns out that previous occupants had closed the vent. Anyway, the room was dated and could have been cleaned better and the A/C could have worked better. The breakfast was standard but very crowded. After breakfast I had to discuss a bill problem with the desk. I was charged for two internet charges because, evidently, the internet access is charged per device. When will ES start giving free internet like everyone else?? I went down and talked with â€˜Clerk Aâ€™ and she said that she would remove one of the charges. Again, she didnâ€™t (although it was after I was gone that I found that this charge was not removed). Wow. I love the efficiency of these highly motivated employees!!! I had also discussed with â€˜Clerk Aâ€™ because that I had three different confirmation numbers for my stay. I discussed this with her because I didnâ€™t want to be locked out of my room. What a surprise: she didnâ€™t listen!!!! We came back from touristy stuff and found our keys didnâ€™t work. Why wasnâ€™t I surprised?? The rest of our time there I avoided â€˜Clerk Aâ€™ like the plague! The rest of our stay was pretty uneventful. We enjoyed the town and did about all the touristy stuff a family could possibly cram into 3 days. So who is â€˜Clerk Aâ€™?? I wish I knew. She didnâ€™t bother to wear a name tag like everyone else and she wasnâ€™t very nice. In fact I thought she was rude and curt with her answers. She might have been a new employee or a rebel, I donâ€™t know, she didnâ€™t say. All I know is I was less than impressed with her customer service. As I said earlier, the hotel is close to a lot of things: one block north of the Red Line El, two blocks from Hard Rock & Rain Forest CafÃ© and, most important, a Starbucks is in the corner of the building, just to the left of the entrance. The only reason I stayed here was because of the location and I had enough Hilton Honors points for one free night. But trying to find a cheap room in Chicago in late June at a cheap price is hard to do. Next time I will try to find someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites is a Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: cashelguy
Reviews.Content: Embassy Suites Downtown Chicago Hotel is a big hotel in a great location, just north of the Loop. It is within walking distance of many of Chicago's famous sites including the Wrigley Building, Holy Name Cathedral, the Water Tower and of course the Magnificent Mile. It is also on the L line that goes directly to Wrigley Field. Indeed, it seemed half the people in the hotel were there to see the Cubs. The other half seemed to be there for shopping. I lost track of how many little girls were running around carrying American Girl Dolls. One of them told me that on request the hotel furnishes special beds just for the dolls! The rooms are large, clean and comfortable. We were there on a near 100 degree day and the air conditioning was a relief to put it mildly The hotel staff had their hands full, but they were very helpful. The breakfast buffet is huge and very good. The happy hour was quite busy too. My only criticism is the seating area for the buffet is a little small. Many people take their breakfast back to their rooms as the dining area is inadequate.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago Stay”
Reviews.Author: ksm1985
Reviews.Content: We travel with two teenagers and always prefer the suite hotels. Our stay at the Embassy Suites Chicago Downtown was great. We arrived at 8:00 a.m. and were able to check into our room early and get started on our sightseeing. The buffet breakfast had enough variety for everyone and enabled us to get on our way quickly. The earlier you go the better as it does get crowded. We were able to find a table without too much trouble everyday. The best part about this hotel was that it is only 1 1/2 blocks from the 'L' red line and only 3 blocks from Michigan Avenue. Very centrally located for what we wanted to do and to get around. The Concierge desk was very helpful with directions and suggestions. Rooms were spotless. There is also a starbucks next door and a market is 1 block away which is helpful for snack runs. We also had to check out to attend a family function outside of Chicago and were able to check the luggage that we didn't need until we returned two days later and checked back into the hotel. This was really appreciated. I would recommend this hotel highly for anyone traveling with kids. It also has a nice size pool area which we saw but never had a chance to use.

Reviews.Title: “Location is Everything”
Reviews.Author: AppleCrisp
Reviews.Content: I just returned from my first visit to Chicago. Based on past experience with Embassy Suites (ES) and other reviewer comments, I headed to the Embassy Suites in Downtown Chicago. Note: there are 2 ES properties in Chicago (Downtown and Lakefront). This review is based on the downtown location. Like all ES, you get the standard setup of a two-room suite, full order breakfast and manager's cocktail event. However, unlike the ES in Washington, DC, this ES goes by the clock and shuts down service right on the dot (unless there are people still in line). I wish ES would extend the midweek breakfast time until 10:30am, but breakfast stops at 9:30AM on the dot. I even saw the cook there with a watch, waiting for the exact moment to turn off the lights for the cooked-to-order breakfast. However, you are able to get pre-cooked food from the warmer beyond the 9:30AM deadline. This is also true for the manager's cocktail session, which runs 5:00PM-7:30PM. Be there before the cut-off, because a grate is erected on the bar, and it is closed on time. So, beside these annoyances, the Downtown property is a most convenient location. You don't really need to ride in a taxi and may occassionally ride the bus. We found the restaurants all within a 2-block radius. No need to venture any further than that to eat. There is even a full grocery store (similar to the West Coast's Whole Foods) directly across the street. Just below the hotel on the side, is a little burger establishment called, "M-Burger." Don't miss out on a single burger for a mere $2.49. Much better, in my opinion, than any "In-&-out Burger." The staff are most friendly. Dine in or enjoy the summer weather outside. Just 2 blocks beyond this, is the famous Portillo's restaurant. Go there on an empty stomach. Across the street from Portillo's is the Hard Rock Cafe, and the bus stop for the Hop-on-Hop-Off stop. Get the 3-day pass for $31.50 for unlimited rides throughout the city. Down 1 block toward the grocery store (Jewel Osco at the corner of the 7-11), catch the free blue-colored Navy Pier trolley. You will be at Navy Pier in out 10 minutes. Really, everything you need is within walking distance, and if you need to ride the bus, the cost (as of July 2011) is $2.25 per passenger. Disabled passengers are free! Lastly, I took advantage of the Chicago Visitor's program. This is a 2-4 tour, hosted by the city of Chicago by Chicagoans. Just register at www.chicagogreeter.com and make your tour selections. The meeting point is on Magnificent Mile at the Cultural Center (directly across from Millennium Park). And it's FREE!! I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to Chicago, and I'm certain you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel that could accommodate a family of 5.”
Reviews.Author: rocksann
Reviews.Content: It's almost impossible to find hotels in downtown Chicago that can accommodate a family of 5. We did a guaranteed prepurchase for this visit after monitoring rates over several weeks. Overall the hotel worked for us. The separate living area with the pull-out sofa worked well for us to have a decent amount of room. Upon arrival at the hotel, we found that our car with the cartop luggage carrier could not fit in the garage for the hotel. The woman at the front desk was less than helpful all three times that I spoke to her. She called the guy in the valet area. When he didn't have an answer, she handed me the phone and I could not understand what he was saying. FINALLY a bellman had the solution to take the carrier off and store it for us so we could use the garage - bless him!! He was THE only one during check-in who was helpful. Our room was in good condition, however we did not have ample linens and the sheets and pillows with the pull-out sofa were DIRTY. They had not been changed and we had a difficult getting someone to find and bring us clean linens. Otherwise, the room was clean. The next day we still were not given ample linens. Both the happy hour and the breakfast didn't quite measure up to all the other Embassy's l've previously stayed in. On the upside, the ample space in the room, the location and the rate worked well for us. I would consider staying here again, but if the rates were similar would likely try a different hotel in the area that could accommodate our family.

Reviews.Title: “Very good home base in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: TeacherandDad
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and nice. The breakfast was outstanding, as was the manager's complementary reception each afternoon. Our suite was roomy enough for six of us to sleep and get ready each day comfortably. Tip: You absolutely do not need a car in downtown Chicago. Park in the suburbs and take the train in. The Red line subway station is one block away from the hotel. Purchase an unlimited CTA pass and you can easily transfer to the "El" trains or buses and get anywhere you would want to go much more efficiently and cheaply than trying to find and pay huge fees for parking. There are many great restaurants and stores within easy walking distance of the hotel and the River North neighborhood is very nice and safe (even at night) - lots happening. For sightseeing, I highly recommend the Art Institute and a walking tour of the loop - I bought a walking tour guidebook that was very helpful in our appreciation of Chicago's most important contribution to the world's art - its fabulous architecture.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: n756tk
Reviews.Content: It really specializes in the American Girl Store promotion. It was wonderful taking 3 granddaughters there. Breakfast was excellent, staff was friendly, and who had time in Chicago to come back for happy hour. Never tested that. Convenient location, close to transportation, stores, and especially the American Girl Store.

Reviews.Title: “What a treat”
Reviews.Author: catlover77
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights and having been on the amtrak train for two nights previously this was a huge treat! It was a huge suite with everything you could want for. Two huge comfy beds and a very comfortable living room. The room was quiet and the added free hot breakfast very good. We used the business centre for free internet access and really appreciated this as we needed to check out flights etc. We also could not believe the 2 hour managers reception every evening with free drinks and nibbles........yes free! The concierge was very helpful and arranged the city tour for us and gave us good advice. We had a meal in the pizza/italian retaurant which is part of the hotel and also found it to be excellent. We would definitley stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here before and will stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: andreanine
Reviews.Content: We brought our 3 sons to Chicago this time for the Auto Show, Museum and deep dish Chicago sytle pizza! We love the Embasssy Suites as the Suite type room is perfect for our family. The pool is great here and as always, gotta love the breakfast!! Perfect location as well. Thanks Embassy Suites for a great chain of Hotels including downtown Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: 8isenuff
Reviews.Content: First time at Embassy Suites. First time bringing the kids. This hotel is the best. The breakfast is the best. The breakfast staff have to be the hardest working people in that hotel. Minimal waiting for the amount of people they are serving. They are hustling for 4 hours straight just getting the food out, the dishes out, cleaning tables, etc. The hotel is in a great location. About two blocks from MI Ave., a 30 min walk to Navy Pier (or $6 taxi ride), a block from the subway (red line). The rooms are very clean. The beds are comfortable and staff are helpful and friendly. The kids loved the pool and used it everyday. The concierge was very knowledgable. When I needed an easy and stress free driving route to Shedd Aq, he knew exactly the route. When we wanted to take a taxi to Navy Pier he told us of the free shuttle (two blocks away) but also knew the taxi would cost $6 o/w. Very friendly, very approachable. I can't say enough good things about this hotel. It made our stay that much better. We will be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Not great for business travelers...Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: BusTraveler40
Reviews.Content: VERY busy hotel... packed with tons of families I have never seen a happy hour with so many families and children --- and long lines. There were lots of children running around the hotel in the evening, and in the morning. The hotel restaurant (food and service) were the highlight.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: TravelMouseSF
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in indeed very clean and the staff is very courteous and professional. They do have a good breakfast buffet with a wide variety of foods and an omelett station. I had a non-suite room and the only negative is the strange configuration of the room. It has very long hallway which leads to the sleeping and bathroom areas. As with all other Embassy Suites it is very much catered to families with children. Walking distance to Magnificent Mile and the Navy Pier.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ganas3240
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Embassy Suites during the 2011 NEA Representative Assembly, the staff and all the employees were courteous, helpful, and accommodating of all our delegation. The rooms were well kept, clean and spacious!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for our family's weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: KentuckyDerbygirl
Reviews.Content: We found the location of the Embassy Suites to be great for walking around downtown and Michigan Avenue. Our room was very clean and a great size for our family of 4. There was a starbucks that we used every morning right under the hotel because we were not impressed with the inroom coffee. The free breakfast was on par with most Embassy Suites but after one try at the very busy buffet we found other breakfast options for the rest of the trip. Likewise, the manager's reception seemed very crowded so we only visited it on the first evening of our trip. However, in Chicago why would we waste our effort on a crowded buffet we could get in any city when there were so many great options right out our door!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an even better location”
Reviews.Author: wardk30712
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a very nice hotel in one of the best locations in the city. We were only a block away from the red-line and bus stops which were very safe and cheap. The only downside is that the lobby and eating area need to be upgraded they were very 90s looking. Overall I would stay here again. P. S. There was barely no line at the free breakfast in the morning. So don't let that discorage you.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: MollyOrlando_Florida
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed here for weekend get away. The hotel was very nice and the rooms were very spacious and clean. The bed was very comfortable. Breakfast in the morning was delicious. It was a busy weekend in the city so the line did get long for breakfast at certain times, if you got down there early enough there was not a problem. The hotel staff was very helpful. The hotel is in a great location, there are so many restaurants and stores within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel , great location”
Reviews.Author: shaggie38
Reviews.Content: Spacious rooms, very comfortable bed , so good didn't get up breaky first day , would def stay again , breakfast was good , plenty of choice .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Keithgbernard
Reviews.Content: Great location on State Street in heart of downtown,within walking distance of the Loop and the Magnificent Mile. Free breakfast with made to order omelets, free drinks and snacks each nite. Spacious rooms. Very friendly and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great find - close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Mick11002
Reviews.Content: Great find - offers full service and ROOM. Two queen beds, a sep lounge section with large desk. Excellent set up as we were attending a major confrence and needed room to work. Buffet breakfast was good

Reviews.Title: “Great location with everything you need...”
Reviews.Author: GotTheTshirt_32
Reviews.Content: Do not get this confused with the other Embassy suites in Chicago which is "downtown lakefront". Passing by that hotel there did not seem to be as many amenities close by. This "downtown" hotel is only 5 min walk to North Michigan with heaps of restaurants close by and a great supermarket. The hotel has a lounge room and bedroom which gives you plenty of space. Also a small kitchen area with a fridge and coffee maker. Everything was clean and well maintained- any queries I had were promptly and happily dealt with. The free breakfast is fabulous- all the usual breakfast options. I did go early as it would get crowded as others have mentioned but that is the trade off I suppose. I did not go to the Managers reception. Staff were friendly but not overly so. Check in/out was very efficient. Cons were the price of wifi- $9.95 for 24hrs and the curtains in the bedroom which faced the street would not close. There were sheer curtains covering the windows which reception assured me no one could see through but the thick block out type curtains did not close. Being 3 floors up it is probably not an issue and not a deal breaker. A higher floor however would've made me feel more comfortable as I was a solo female traveller. It also would screen out a bit of street noise but, again a trade off for being so close to action.I also ate at the bar/ restaurant downstairs which was absolutely awful- the worst pasta I have ever had- there are so many options close by which would have to be better. The staff there were also very stand offish. Overall a great hotel which I would recommend. I would stay here again if I went back to Chicago which I hope to as it is fantastic city!

Reviews.Title: “Requested city view, got a view of the parking garage. Delightful.”
Reviews.Author: katiekat16
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Chicago for many years and have stayed in quite a few hotels downtown so I have a certain expectation level. I don't think it's unreasonable, but that's just me. I was coming to Chicago for a mini honeymoon since my husband and I are too swamped to take a big honeymoon right now, but we wanted to do something fun, and wanted to enjoy a few perks that usually come with being a Hilton Honor Gold member. So, we decided on the Embassy Suites Downtown. I should mention that our choices are limited since he is a smoker, but that is his choice so I'm not complaining about non smoking hotels, but it is much more difficult to find a nice hotel that allows smoking. I called the hotel several times to request a smoking city view suite. I explained that it was my honeymoon and I wanted things to be wonderful. I also informed the hotel several times that would would be arriving late (like 11:00 pm) so that they would not give our city view suite to someone else. Fat lot of good that did me. The gentleman who checked us in was not overly friendly, but that was okay. There is no bellhop to assist with luggage which was also okay. The front desk person asked for my husband's name to be put on the room info, which I gave him and asked that he change the name on the reservation to reflect me getting married. He said he couldn't do that due to the Hilton Honors points thing. Fine, no biggie. I was tired and just wanted to get upstairs. Got in the room and found the decor pleasant. Went over to the bedroom window to enjoy the scenery (one of my favorite things about Chicago) and was greeted with...a view a parking garage. How anti climatic. Two windows in the suite and the view was either the hallway or a parking garage. Horrible! Things just went down hill from there. The sheets were very scratchy, the bed and pillows were comfy. The bathroom was so so. Nice granite. The tv remote in the bedroom didn't work--very annoying. The atrium is loud with drunk people in the middle of the night and it echos terribly. My husband called down to the front desk to get a phone number for a restaurant and was greeted as Mr. and then MY maiden name, not the name on the room info. Then the front desk person offered to connect the call to the restaurant for us and we were charged a fee on our room bill for it. Also annoying. We were charged for a bottle of water ($4, 89 cents at the drugstore on the corner) that we didn't drink, the list goes on and on. I expected more from the hotel, given that it was my honeymoon, Gold status, the reviews on here, and the price. There are much better and friendlier hotels in the area. My favorite is the Wit but they don't allow smoking anymore so that's out. Spend your money somewhere else like the Wit or Park Hyatt! I gave it 3 stars due to the location and the great doorman who was working Friday and Saturday nights. It was raining and when he saw me walking down the block he ran over with an umbrella and said "Welcome home!" which was the nicest part of my experience BY FAR with the staff there. Also, thank God I get free wifi being a Gold member because if I had to pay for that service I would have been pissed since it hardly worked at all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Should be ranked higher!”
Reviews.Author: JABBY42
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at Embassy Suites. We were so bummed we couldnâ€™t get into the Homewood Suites by Hilton Chicago last minute so we stayed at another comparable Hilton Property. I read all of the reviews on Trip Advisor so I was a little leery choosing a hotel that is ranked #30 out of 166 hotels. The hotel was great! It was just as nice as Homewood Suites. We had a corner room that was large enough for the four of us. The rooms were clean, quiet and the beds were comfortable. The bathroom was a good size as well. We never felt cramped. The location was also pretty good. Because we were there during the non-stop rain, places like Water Tower and Michigan Ave. seemed a bit far. On a sunny day, Iâ€™m sure the walk wouldâ€™ve been nothing at all. Water Tower is about a 15 minute walk. The breakfast was also better than expected but was a bit crowded and a little chaotic on our first morning. They not only had made to order omelets and eggs, they had a wide variety of fresh fruit, not canned, breads, juices, and other pre-made hot breakfast items. The kids LOVED the pool, although it was a bit cold for me. They also have a managerâ€™s reception, I believe 7 days a week. We were surprised they had it on a Sunday â€“ most seem to be M â€“ TH. It was nice, some chips, a house wine, beer or soda for snacking. Our room didnâ€™t get cleaned until we called, which was close to 5:00 p.m., but that may be due to their check out policy at noon. Once we called, they were up in 5 minutes. Overall, the staff all seemed pretty nice. We will definitely be staying here again â€“ maybe once the rain goes away! Iâ€™m hoping this review will help move the rank of the Embassy Suites at least into the 20â€™s!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mom_of_3_WI
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took our children (ages 15, 12 & 10) on a quick get-away weekend. We spent one day/night in Milwaukee & one day/night in Chicago. I spent HOURS looking at the reviews and ratings for hotels in Chicago. I finally narrowed it down to 2 that seemed to meet the type of mini-vacation we were looking for. We ended up staying at the Embassey Suites - Downtown in Chicago and thoroughly enjoyed every minute of it. The 2 room suite was perfect for us with 2 queen beds & then a sofa sleeper in the other room. The beds were very comfortable. During the day, we visited the Shedd Aquarium (unfortunately had to wait 2 hours in line) and then came back to the hotel. We then walked to a nearby restaurant for supper and continued to explore by walking several blocks. For being in such a large city, we felt 100% safe at all times. We then came back to the hotel for the manager's reception. After having read the reviews, I knew that this was not to be taken as a "free supper" but more as a snack bar. The snacks consisted of hot pretzel bites (which were very good) & ranch or mustard, fried potato chips, and punch. My husband and I enjoyed FREE drinks (This was great because we didn't have to leave the hotel or spend money) while our kids went back to the room (and could look down on us from above - - which they thoroughly enjoyed). The kids then spent time in the pool (not huge - - medium rectangular shape, but was just fine for our kids). The pool was not overcrowded during our stay - - the kids were in the pool while the adults sat around the outside. My kids enjoyed the pool & hot tub while I worked out on the treadmill in the attached fitness room. On Easter morning, we went down for the FREE breakfast buffet which was EXCELLENT! We had made-to-order omelettes which were very good. Our kids enjoyed pancakes, cereal, sausage, bacon, potatoes, fruit, bagels/bread, etc. We did not have to eat again until supper time! Overall, we had a refreshing, relaxing, and very enjoyable mini-vacation. I had put in for a city view upgrade if available - - which we got. This provided us with 2 windows which looked out into the city as opposed to a window that looked into the center of the hotel. The only thing to remember is that when you stay in the city and are used to the country. . . it's a bit more difficult to sleep because of the constant sirens throughout the night. Make sure to use the inside curtain/shade which is a room darkener and barrier from the noise (I didn't notice this shade until 6:00 a.m.). This is the only reason I rated the "sleep quality" as a 4 instead of a 5. Despite this, we all noted that we would definitely go back in a heartbeat! I really can't imagine us, as a family, having a better time at a hotel than we had here. It was a perfect match for us!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great for young children”
Reviews.Author: hn0010
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights -- family of six with four kids under 6. The two separate rooms was GREAT as the little ones could go to bed early and the older ones wouldn't bother them. Breakfast was perfect as the kids had lots of choices. It WAS crowded and chaotic if you went later -- hard to find a place to sit. But since the kids get up early, we were there by 7:30 and had the place to ourselves. The pool was closed on the last day we were there, which was a disappointment... but there is plenty to do in Chicago without needing a pool. It's in a great area -- safe to walk around with the kids -- and close to the subway station. Cab ride out to museum campus only $15... Lots of other stuff within walking distance. Hotel service was great -- they allowed us to check in an hour early and check out an hour late. Staff was always super friendly and helpful. We will DEFINITELY stay here again the next time we're in chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Last time I will stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: RobHarley
Reviews.Content: Pool was closed and I was not told at check in. I had heard that you could go down the street and use another hotels. The weather was cold enough that was not possible. Organization as a whole was not good. Breakfast in the morning was total chaos. Happy hour was not happy we left after one drink. My stay was just not comfortable. One more thing- I am sick of the hotel over charging for WiFi. Give it to us!

Reviews.Title: “Such a great place”
Reviews.Author: mar07fla
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and absolutely Loved this hotel! The location is perfect. The staff is extremely helpful. The breakfast was really good.... Something for everyone. The rooms are spacious,comfortable and clean. We will stay here again the next time we visit Chicago. Kids loved the pool ..it isn't huge but as long as it wasn't too crowded it was nice. Managers reception appetizers seemed skimpy but people seemed to enjoy the free food. Looked like most nights were pretzel bites, crackers and chips. Restaurant attached to hotel had OK Italian ....pizza and salads. Overall the experience was one of the best family trips we've taken.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities for families and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: Augusttravel1125
Reviews.Content: Excellent location within a few blocks of North Michigan Ave shopping and tourist attractions like the Hard Rock Cafe and Rainforest Cafe. Includes full breakfast each morning and happy hour in the afternoon. Breakfast and happy hour can be busy, so expect a little wait. Our kids loved the indoor pool too. The rooms are a great size for families. There is a bedroom on one end and a living area with a pullout sofa and chair on the other separated by a wet bar area with a mini fridge and microwave. We felt it was a great value and a great location. Perfect for our family! We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Not to happy about my stay”
Reviews.Author: Raerae31
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on 4/2 an and was not able to check in unti after 6pm. all I was told was that they were booked and the customer that was in my room paid half of the room rate to check out late. There was no customer.service offered to me at all I wasnt offered to check out late since I had to check in so late. I really like staying at this hotel but after this I wont anymore I will not stay at anymore hilton family hotels after this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a perfect location”
Reviews.Author: ems1010
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites gave a welcome home stay as soon as the car door opened. The efficiency of the staff help get us settled fast.

Reviews.Title: “Did not recieve accomodations that were confirmed prior to arrival!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTrip89
Reviews.Content: Right now I'm sitting in my Embassy Suite room extremely upset with it's management and customer service. My colleague and myself made a room deposit and selected a room with two bed weeks before arriving. When we checked in we were informed that the hotel had no double bed rooms available. We provided our confirmation email that stated that we had a room with two beds, the manager said "sorry, but were all sold out, I don't know what to tell you; the couch has a pullout, or we could bring up a cot." He went on to say, "that's all we can do." I have never encountered a lack of respect for a customer like this before in the hotel industry. I will never stay at an embassy suite again and recommend to others to beware of this bait and switch tatic.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Mags200
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Embassy Suites for 4 nights over thanksgiving in November. We chose this hotel because of its ideal location, its perfectly located a few blocks from Michigan Ave, Macy's and the Theatre District and youâ€˜re close to the navy pier and millennium park. Thereâ€™s a star bucks next to the hotel, thereâ€™s a supermarket across the street from the hotel, thereâ€™s a McDonalds and Hard Rock CafÃ© is a few minutes walk. The complimentary breakfast was buffet style and includes almost every breakfast item that you can think of, it was fabulous but get there early the line was long and late arrivals end up waiting in a huge line that wraps around the hotel! The made to order omelets were great. There was always complementary apple cider in the lobby and in the evening thereâ€™s a free Manager's Reception with snacks chips and dips and drinks beer, wine, and rail drinks. Thereâ€™s a lovely waterfall/fountain in the lobby. We didnâ€™t eat in the restaurant so I canâ€™t comment on it there is a lot of lovely restaurants a few minutes walk from the hotel. We had a nice quiet room away from the elevators. There were t.v.'s in both the bedroom and living room area. The living room is large with a pullout couch, chair and desk. There is a door which separates the bedroom and the living room which is great if someone wants to sleep and the other wants to watch t.v. Thereâ€™s a kettle, microwave and fridge in the room. The room was extremely clean with two great big comfy beds. There were two regular sinks, one in the bathroom and one outside and one sink near the microwave and fridge. The bathroom was quite small but had everything you need the shower was powerful and fresh shampoo and conditioner was always supplied. We never got to use the pool so I canâ€™t comment on this area. The staffs in all areas were courteous and very helpful. We would absolutely stay here again when we go back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “great location and very nice "renovated" rooms”
Reviews.Author: 3kidsmama
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Embassy for 3 nights, during a college tour trip for my oldest son We booked the Cars Stay Free Parking rate, as although not "free" it was cheaper than booking room and parking separately. Our room was at the 8th floor, and thanks to the recent renovation, it looked very modern and trendy, and it smelled "new"! The bathroom was a decent size also, and we liked the fact that a second sink + vanity is available in the bedroom. What the bathroom lacked, though, was a proper ventilation system (although this is not the 1st Hilton chain hotel where we encounter this problem). Just one short shower was enough to completely fog the bathroom, and we had to run the hair dryer and/or slightly open the window in the bedroom to get rid of some of the humidity. Basically, bathroom ventilation system doesn't work. With a family of 5, we often stay at Embassy thanks to the size of their rooms, the usual friendliness of their staff, the pool, the complimentary breakfast, and the manager reception. The business center is also a plus when, like in this case, we needed to print some documents. As HH gold, we had free internet in the room, but for non gold members they charge a fee. Breakfast was good, with plenty of hot items, and the chefs were attentive and quick. Although lines were long, they did move pretty fast. Manager's reception was also very nice, and pleasant to enjoy after a day of touring Chicago. This Embassy has a great location, at walking distance from Michigan Av. Many restaurants and grocery stores are one to two blocks away. Pizzeria Uno, Pizzeria Due, Weber Grill, Trader Joe's are all within a very short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cliff2026
Reviews.Content: Rooms were large & clean. A great continental breakfast. No complaints, friendly staff. I had a short stay but it was great. Alot better than most places I normally stay on business.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect play to stay when your furnace dies”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoF
Reviews.Content: We live in Chicago, and don't know all that much about local hotels. Anyway, when our furnace died on a 5 degree day, I surfed around for a hotel and came upon the positive reviews here on TripAdvisor. I really liked this hotel as well -- skip the expensive valet and parking lot -- you can park kitty corner from the hotel in a surface lot for much less. Other than that, everything was stellar. Immaculate room, good-smelling toiletries, comfortable beds. I really appreciated the fact that our room was divided into two separate rooms, with a TV in each so we could watch as the kids slumbered. The pool area was well-maintained and the free breakfast was pretty sumptuous -- full hot buffet, omelettes to order, plus the usual cereal, fruit, juice, coffee options. The kids swam for 3 hours and had the time of their lives.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality and location at a good price”
Reviews.Author: pcwilson9
Reviews.Content: We always enjoy staying at Embassy Suites. The free breakfasts are amazing and include almost every breakfast item that you can think of. In the evening there is a free Manager's Reception with snacks (no hot snacks- just chips and dips) and drinks (beer, wine, and rail drinks). The lines for both of these were very very long. Get to both early! The location was great- a few short blocks to all the sites on Michigan Ave, a half block from the Weber Grill restaurant, and a few steps to Starbucks. The pool and hot tub were very small and constantly filled with kids, so we didn't swim. The rooms were recently renovated and beautiful. We had a nice sitting area with TV separated from the bedroom with another TV. The double beds were a bit small to share and the bathroom was quite small as well. All staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. We did unfortunately have some issues with loud neighbors- the walls are not very sound proof. When the neighbors flushed their toilet it would wake us all up! All things said we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean large rooms”
Reviews.Author: jordace
Reviews.Content: My 3 friends and I stayed at the Embassy Suites Feb 9th-12th. I booked this room for the size and so glad that i did. With 4 women staying in one room it was nice to have two regular sinks, one in bathroom and one outside and one sink near the microwave and frig. I liked that you could close the bedroom door if someone wanted to sleep and still be able to stay up and watch tv in the other room. Large living room with pullout couch, chair and desk. Very nice huge included breakfast buffet every morning. You are close to the navy pier, millineum park. You are about 4-5 blocks away from the subway, Grand Red. It wasn't too bad walking. very nice subway system. gets you anywhere you need to go. We defintley stay here again if I came back to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for a Chicago family vacation”
Reviews.Author: MamaGab
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of its ideal location, suites and pool. My family and I walked to Michigan Ave (5 minutes), Navy Pier (30 minutes on foot; 10 minutes by bus); Water Tower (15 minutes with children), and was a 5 minute bus ride from the loop. The suite was jsut the right size for our family of 4, although we would have liked slightly larger beds (they were true doubles). The breaksfast was generous, although crowded, and the kids loved the cookies and cider in the lobby. The pool was clean. The staff was courteous and helpful. We did not get a chance to see the renovated rooms, but our non-renovated room was fine, so I'm sure the renovated ones are very nice. I appreciated the lack of noise even though it was clear that renovations were occuring on the upper floors. We will absolutely stay here again for another family 'staycation'

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic - would go back again”
Reviews.Author: Birdyc3
Reviews.Content: Visited from the UK for Christmas and the New Year and the hotel really exceeded our expectations. Breakfast was great, busy if you left it to late but not a huge problem. Could not believe how good the manager's reception was! Room was extremely clean with a great big comfy bed. Shower was powerful and fresh shampoo and conditioner was always supplied. BUT, I had bought a new pair of pyjamas for my trip and they disappeared - I asked at reception three times (I thought they might have been taken when the bed sheets were changed by mistake), they rang housekeeping but each time I was just told 'nothing was found' - not a sorry! Overall, apart from the missing pjs - a great hotel, would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVE Staying here every Christmas!”
Reviews.Author: AbbyWarm
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at this Embassy Suites every Christmas {visit family/shop} for at least the last 20 years. I am now married with two young children and we still continue to come for Christmas. We love the room setup, the fabulous breakfast, the staff--everything about the Embassy Suites is great! One year we tried a different downtown hotel--that was the first and LAST time we strayed! The restaurant is fantastic and SO convenient with young kids--if one melts down, the room is right upstairs! Our kids love the waterfall/fountain in the lobby. So much so that we now put rolls of pennies in their Christmas stockings to ensure they have plenty of coins to toss in. I hope we continue this family tradition for many years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Nice property-good location-wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Flsais11
Reviews.Content: My family stayed for three nights. We had a recently renovated room which was quite nice. I recommend requesting a room away from the elevators if anyone will be sleeping in the front living section, as it can be quite loud from noise from the atrium and hallways. The bedroom is quiet and comfortable. The staff was very accommodating, professional and pleasant. The breakfast is really good - made to order omelets (with the price of the room!). We used the subway stop that was a block away. A very good family hotel. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - but not all rooms are suites!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: This was our third time staying at Embassy Suites in downtown Chicago. We used the Priceline "Name Your Own Price" feature and got the room for $54 a night. The going rate at the time was about $129. The hotel is undergoing renovation, starting with the 11th floor. They are working on the 9th floor currently. We were first assigned to room 1129 and we were surprised to find that it wasn't a suite. In fact, it wasn't even a large room. It was terrible in so many ways. There was no place to plug in the computer at the desk, so we had to kneel in front of the night stand to use it. The bathroom sink stopper was broken in the closed position, so we couldn't get water out of the sink. The bathroom fan ran constantly and blew cold air INTO the room. It was hard to heat the room, even with the thermostat set to 78. There was only ONE place to sit - at the desk. Anyone else was forced to sit on the bed, which isn't usually comfortable. Room 1129 was the first room we DIDN'T like at the Embassy Suites! We were able to move into Room 1039 (which happens to be a wheelchair accessable room) for our remaining three nights and it was heavenly! This recently renovated room even smelled 'new'. The furnishings were comfortable and attractive. I did a bed bug check and found none. We LOVE staying at the Embassy Suites because the location is perfect for us (we need to use the Red Line and it is a short block away), the complimentary breakfast is awesome, the Jewel grocery store is next door and the suites are large. The renovated rooms are WAY nicer than the not-yet-renovated ones, mostly because the living room furniture is 100% better.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: linna68
Reviews.Content: We checked in on Xmas eve, staying 2 nights. What a great stay! Check in was a breeze, the front desk staff was excellent, very friendly. The breakfast was great since it was included in the price - the made to order omelets were great, as was the chef cooking them (quite friendly)- wished they had waffles, the pancakes and french toast were a bit undesirable. The pool was a bit green and the spa foamy, both definately needed to be shocked... the pool was open til MIDNIGHT and opened at 5am (for those who didn't mind the imbalance of chemicals). Our room was OUTSTANDING - newly renovated. I didn't like the pillows, however, and had a hard time sleeping (too soft for me). Overall, all 4 of us raved about the hotel and the staff just put it over the top for us!

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Spot!”
Reviews.Author: Midwestravelers
Reviews.Content: The main purpose of our trip was to go to the Christkindle Market on Daly Plaza. The Embassy Suites was perfect, the location is very convenient to find by car from the Interstate and was within easy walking distance not only to the Christmas Market, but to Macy's, the Theatre District, Michigan Avenue and more -- the weather was rainy so our walking was limited but there is alot more to walk to near this hotel. This is a very typical Embassy Suites - which is a GOOD thing....rooms are very spacious, full cooked to order breakfast and manager's cocktail reception is included. The cocktail reception is even located adjacent to the pool so the kids could swim while we enjoyed a few rounds with snacks. There were some reports of bedbugs, but we did not have any trouble at all with that -- the kids even slept on the pull out sofa sleeper with no issues. Hotel valet parking was a little pricey - $44 per day, but there is a covered parking ramp adjacent which only charges $35 per day (with no in/out priviliges, though). We will definitely stay at the Embassy Suites next time we go to Chicago for a weekend, all the amenities plus the location make it the perfect spot!

Reviews.Title: “Great Upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: Annette7256
Reviews.Content: At checkin, we were able to upgrade to a city view and were very pleased with the room. A lot of remodeling has been done and it shows, especially in the bathrooms. Doormen were friendly and helpful, breakfast and nightly manager's specials were good. Location is very convenient to red line and many attractions are within walking or bus-riding distance. We will certainly consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Why pay more?”
Reviews.Author: berkonabike
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the marathon weekend, chose the hotel based on reviews on this site and price and was not dissapointed. Given such a busy weekend, the hotel did not at any time seem over-crowded. The complimentary breakfast, being american buffet style far seeded expectations, opening earlier on marathon day was a great touch and very much appreciated. Great location for the metro, bus to Navy Pier, a few minutes walk to Michicagan Avenue, as well as a short walk to the river/Loop. Good standard of cleanliness throughout, although room service was a little erratict, but this at no point detracted from the quality of the stay. Overall, the hotel exceeded my expectations and would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,friendly and ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Jambo1998
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights from November 6th. I got a fantastic rate of Â£222($355) for the full stay. Check in was quick although a deposit of $75 is required for incidentals. The room i was allocated was spotless,spacious and with a very comfortable bed. I didnt hear any outside noise on any night during my stay and slept well. I got to the complimentary breakfast early and had delicious cooked to order ommlette and cereal. The supply was plentiful although i noticed it gets very busy after 8am. Managers reception drinks from 5.30pm to 8.30 pm are great and a good way to relax with complimentary drinks before heading out for the evening. The hotel is in a great location and i managed to walk to most attractions easily enough though it was very mild weather! I wouldnt hesitate to recommend this hotel and will stay here on future visits to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and value”
Reviews.Author: ctflyer51
Reviews.Content: Spent one night this past week at this property. Was my 2nd or 3rd time staying there. Pure room was clean and comfortable. Front desk staff was friendly. Location is very close to shopping (2 blocks) and reasonably walkable to other parts of the city. Would recommend for anyone staying in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great except Bed Bugs”
Reviews.Author: jenny9049
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about this hotel. Location was central, walking distance to Magnificent Mile, one block from subway. The staff was very nice and hospitable. And of course as most reviewers have noted, who can complain about their big american breakfast and made-to-order-omlettes? Even when we got there at 9:30am, they still kindly took our orders (not that you should do that :p). We also took advantage of the complementary open bar that runs from 4:30-7:30pm i believe. We usually grabbed a drink before heading out for dinner. There was munchies, nachos and meat balls on some days too. The cab ride to Midway airport from the hotel was only $36 including tips and i split that between 3 ppl. It was great! The only thing i have to complain about is that there were bed bugs. On the third night, my friend found a bug crawling on her bed. Without realizing what it really was, she squeezed it and the blood was bright red. we didn't think too much about it at the time. The next night, my other friend got bitten on her forearm. We suspected it was bed bugs at that point but we didn't want to file a complaint until we were 100% sure. When we came home, my friend's arm got itchier. A quick google image search revealed that the bug my friend killed was indeed a bed bug. I have emailed the hotel and waiting for them to get back to me. I hope they will take this seriously. Then again, me and my friends got the deal on priceline.com for $90 per night. i'm not asking for any compensation since we already left, but i just want them to address this situation so no other guests would have to encounter these bed bugs. Afterall, it is a really decent hotel that is worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a family getaway to explore downtown Chicago with kids!!!”
Reviews.Author: diamondmom99
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites was wonderful!! It met our needs perfectly! It was close enough to walk to shopping and dining. The morning breakfast was a fantastic way to get our day started and had something for everyone of the picky eaters in my family. The pool was great for the kids to burn off some energy while the parents could enjoy the managers reception. We will definetely go back again!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: doctorbobster
Reviews.Content: From the surprisingly spacious entry area to the incredibly spacious courtyard, this is a very comfortable hotel that is nicely situated. There are many places to eat and shop within a short walk. And, if you are inclined, it is a short run to the shoreline for a run along Lake Michigan. the breakfast buffet, with eggs cooked to order, was very good. The rate was a little pricey, but, hey...it's downtown Chicago. I would not hesitate, however, to stay here again. Free high-speed internet would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Celebrating Kelli's 16th”
Reviews.Author: tmws
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great place to stay with the bedroom and living area. With 3 female teenagers and 3 women the hotel was set up so even though there were so many of us the sink area in the bedroom, the bathroom and even the sink are in the kitchen made it easy for us to get ready. No one was waiting to get in to brush our teeth or wash up. Once we figured out shower schedules it was great. The chef's in the morning buffet always make you feel welcome. The two who prepared the omellets were so pleasant and cheerful. Nice to see that in customer service. Actually, everyone from the desk clerks, concierge, and especially the bell men were so accomodating. Can't beat the location, so close to everything...we walked each evening asn were very comfortable walking at 11:30pm. Coming from Detroit that is such a treat. The workout room was nicely equipped and the teens enjoyed the pool and hot tub. One of my favorite places to stay in Chicago. Only downfall is the cost...split between 3 it was a good price but a bit price for 3 days if it were just me.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for a vacation”
Reviews.Author: avivaleah
Reviews.Content: I had a girls' weekend with my daughter and three other family members. This hotel was perfect for our needs. We were within walking distance to almost everywhere we went. If you don't want to walk and don't want to drive, there are bus stops a few blocks up at Michigan Avenue. Also, there is a subway stop on the next block. There are a lot of excellent restaurants in the area as well. The hotel was clean and met our needs, except that there wasn't a hair dryer in the room. The complimentary breakfast buffet is very convenient and good. I am disappointed that there is a charge for internet connection unless you are a frequent Hilton guest. There is no reason for this in this day and age. My only other complaint is that we called for bell service at checkout and were told 15 minutes. Over 30 minutes later, no one came and we ended up hauling a ton of luggage and bags down to our car ourselves. I understand that the hotel was very busy with checkouts, but we should have received a call about the delay.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Fall Break, Chicago Style”
Reviews.Author: maconMouse
Reviews.Content: Outstanding hotel in a great location to hit up all the key sites of Chicago. If you're looking for a great weekend getaway, I recommend this hotel highly. I can't say enough about the friendly service at from the staff of this hotel. Very helpful with all our questions, and always available. Room was spotless at check-in, and housekeeping did an outstanding job each day. Bed was comfortable. We were on top floor, and had great skyline views of city. Can easily walk to grocery store, numerous restaurants, theater district, and fine shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Right in Center of the Action”
Reviews.Author: boboakville
Reviews.Content: I attended a conference held at another hotel. It was fully booked and I booked with this Embassy Suites. A very good choice for me. It's right in the center of the action - a short few blocks from the Magnificent Mile shopping district and walking distance to lots of restaurants. I had not stayed in an Embassy Suites hotel for quite a while, but the room was perfect for my needs, especially with the work area separate from the sleeping area. The room was quiet despite any noise in the atrium. I had a good night's rest. The breakfast was very good - especially the made to order omelet. Lots of choices for other types of food. The staff were helpful for any requests. I'd stay with family on return trip to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but dirty rooms. Good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: zhousmom
Reviews.Content: Not as good a hotel as I expected from Hilton and Embassy Suites. Big, nasty bugger on bed skirt, something chunky and brown on curtain, mold under sink rim. Had to make a special trip to front desk just to get sheets changed. Good service from Concierge--direction and maps. Good breakfast with friendly staff. Upgrade of room for view which cost money changed from view of parking lost to view of buildins across he street. Pool is small and only three feet deep. Expected more for paying over $200/night.

Reviews.Title: “Always an excellent hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ardengood
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites on State Street during a trip to Chicago. The room was smaller than at some of the other Embassy Suites I have stayed in, but was adequate and clean. The only complaints with the room, were that the coffee maker didn't work, the handle on the toilet kept falling off, and the TV remote didn't channel down. We didn't know about the coffee maker and remote until the end of our stay, but the toilet handle was reported and not fixed. The manager's reception was wonderful - good food choices, and quickly moving lines. The breakfast selection was great - omelets, eggs, pancakes, french toast, bacon, etc. The desk staff and bellmen were very helpful. The hotel location is fantastic. It is within walking distance to many tourist locations, shopping, and the trains.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, everything you need”
Reviews.Author: arora1977
Reviews.Content: My friends and I chose the Embassy Suites for a 10-year reunion in Chicago. We reserved a block of rooms. The suite setup, which includes sitting area, bath and separate bedroom, easily accommodated two to three to a room. The beds were cushy and comfortable and even the fold-out sofa offered a restful night's sleep. Like many city hotels, the rooms in this hotel are a bit dark on cloudy days. The breakfast buffet and evening cocktail hours provided everything you need for a quick bite. The morning breakfast is located in the hotel atrium and offers many choices for hot or continental breakfast. The atrium architecture creates acts as a vacuum for noise, which you can hear clearly in all the rooms, so late-morning sleep-ins are pretty much not possible once breakfast starts. By the way, there's a fabulous pizza/pasta restaurant in the hotel that offers great wine/food pairings at good prices.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: larrchar
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites at 600 State Street in Chicago is in the heart of where you want to go downtown. It's a short walk to theatres, Lake Michigan, the riverwalk, Chicago Tribune Bldg, Magnificant Mile and Nordstrom. the staff is fabulous; everyone was friendly; , from the front doormen, to the desk staff and the conceirge. The rooms were large and the beds were great. They plan a redecorating of rooms which will make this an even nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great - nothing disappointing from first step out of cab”
Reviews.Author: nancysvab
Reviews.Content: This was my first 3 day stay in Chicago and cant wait to go back..... I was travelling with my sister, my daughter, my niece and my cousin to celebrate my sisters birthday.....From the time we stepped out of our cab and were greeted by Roberto(our doorman),we knew we had come to the right place..OVer the course of the next 3 days we were greeted by his friendly smile.Whether we needed to snow the best place to eat, shop or just get a cab he was always there and always had an answer......Embassy Suites dont ever get rid of him..... Our room was very spacious, especially for 5 females.....2 separate rooms.... I was the only one with a complaint and that was just because i am a lite sleeper... The ambulances and firetrucks were pretty load especially in the middle of the night.I I would still go back and just ask for a room higher up..... Their breakfast buffet was great... Something for everyone.....The cleaning staff and the staff at the desk were also very friendly.. We also enjoyed(free) a couple of drinks and appetizers every day between 530 and 730.....AGain the staff was very helpful and very friendly..

Reviews.Title: “Not dissapointed!”
Reviews.Author: cocoario
Reviews.Content: This Hotel met every expectation. We are "country" coming to a big city but the employees made my wife and I feel at home. We were close to everything around downtown Chicago. This is a GREAT place to stay and as usual, Embassy Suites was a 1st class place to stay. Thanks you employees; we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for price, location, quality”
Reviews.Author: garlandk77
Reviews.Content: This was my first time staying at an Embassy Suites. Compared to other Chicago hotels I have stayed at, there are five things I particularly liked: 1) Unlike many hotels where the room's "minibar" is stuffed with pricey drinks and has sensors that add a fee to your bill even if you just move an item, the refrigerator in my room here was empty, giving me plenty of room for my own things. A small store in the lobby sells bottled drinks and snacks if you want them. 2) Unlike some hotels whose "free breakfast" consists of just coffee and donuts or a $10 coupon for a nearby diner, the free breakfast here is a full meal served buffet style in a spacious area and includes scrambled eggs, pancakes, french toast, fresh fruit (oranges, bananas, cantaloupe), bacon, sausage, potatoes & onions, hot oatmeal, cold cereals, toast, juice, coffee, and milk. In addition, you can get omelets and eggs cooked to order in any style. I asked for "3 eggs over medium" each day and they were cooked perfectly. 3) The business center is available free and includes four computers with internet access. I could check my email each day and printed my boarding pass at no charge. The previous Chicago hotel I stayed at charged $15 per day for access to their business center plus $1 per page for printing. 4) Unlike some hotels where the "suites" are just slightly larger than normal hotel rooms with a sofa, the suites here are two separate, full-sized rooms. The living room has a sofa, large flat screen TV, dining table with four chairs, and a kitchenette with refrig, microwave, and sink. The bedroom has a door that can be closed off from the living room, a dresser, and a second TV. 5) Although this hotel opened almost 20 years ago, the room I stayed in appeared to be newly renovated and was in excellent condition. Given the above points plus the moderate price and the highly convenient and desirable location, I would rate this the best value Chicago hotel I have ever stayed in. Here are some tips: To get both the best view and to minimize potential traffic noise, when checking in ask for "a high floor room facing east." Don't confuse this State Street hotel with the "Lakefront" Embassy Suites located 8 blocks away on the east side of Michigan Avenue. Although the Lakefront hotel is closer to Navy Pier if that's important to you, for all other purposes the State Street hotel is probably a better location for most visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ohio53
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. Great breakfast buffet and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: oceans226
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in the best location and it is beautiful. But the best part was the bell hop/doorman service along with the concierge. They were all so personable and helpful. They helped us make our plans for the day and gave great directions, The housekeeping staff kept our rooms very clean--the sheets and towels always fresh. Great food for the complimentary breakfast. The only complaint--the front desk staff could be a little more friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased”
Reviews.Author: parsonofarson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here (family of 5) on our recent vacation and were completely pleased. Handy walking distance, helpful staff. No complaints about any part of our stay. Would definitley stay here next time..

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: familygirl83
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here last week with our three children. The hotel was okay, and the suite seemed fine. One our third morning there we discovered three bedbugs. I'm not sure if my husband or I were bitten, but my children each had one or two bites. Management was very responsive and took all of our clothing and the kids stuffed animals to be dry cleaned, moved us into another room, and didn't charge us for that one night, but we couldn't stay after that experience. We've been home 6 day now and I still can't sleep or eat for fear we brought these things home with us. They did say a "pest control" agency inspected the room and found nothing, but after researching this we are very positive of what we saw. A long awaited family vacation was ruined as we left early, and I don't know if I'll ever be able to stay in any hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: Gottatravel12
Reviews.Content: I recently visited this hotel. Wow, I was impressed! The staff were some of the nicest people I've seen in a hotel. From the moment we arrived we were helped and assisted with everything we needed. The continental breakfast in the morning was great, it helped us all get out of bed and get our day started. They had everything you could think of for breakfast, it was a great value. The rooms were also very spacious and well laid-out. With our room package, we also got free parking for our stay, which saved us a great deal of money. We ended up staying 2 extra nights here, and the hotel staff was happy to accommodate us, even putting us in the same room. The pool is fun for kids and was enjoyable for all. Definitely spring for the city view, we had a great view of State Street. The location was great, nearby Michigan Avenue and great restaurants, and a short walk or taxi ride from everything else. I will definitely stay here again!
