Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: nbkoritz
Reviews.Content: I've been traveling to Chicago for years and always stayed at The Drake. Because they were full, I decided to try the Embassy Suites. Wow, what a great experience! The rooms were spacious, clean and comfortable. Our kids loved using the pool. The free breakfast was also quite good. This hotel has a fabulous location and is a very good value. Great Choice.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location! Will stay here whenever we visit Chicago.”
Reviews.Author: Luv2read68
Reviews.Content: Really the only downer was finding out about the $75 fee for incidentals when checking into our room. This was news to us and so we paid cash and had it returned when checking out the last day. It would have been nice to have a "heads up" on this in light of planning and not wanting to use our credit cards. Okay on to the good stuff. Traveled with our two boys, ages 8 and 6. 4-day vacation with the City Pass in hand. The hotel and rooms are clean and beautiful. Fantastic breakfast with a big variety. We always arrived 7ish so as to avoid the long lines after 8. Loved the cooked-to-order omelettes! Location was ideal-local grocery chain and Trader Joe's around the corner, red line subway, and close to bus stops. Great restaurants, extremely helpful Concierge, walking distance to Michigan Ave, Lego store, etc. etc. Manager's Reception-snacks and free beverages. Don't plan on making this your meal though. Pool is tiny and got a bit crowded with all the kids in it. Rooms are spacious. We requested a City View room and would do that again. It was the same price as the other rooms in the Park and Stay package. Our suite had a small fridge so we bought sandwich stuff and made lunch every day to take to the museums. That saved us a ton of money, plus it was more healthy. Staff were all very friendly from the bellhops to the valet parking attendants to the front desk. It was so nice to leave our car in the garage and not worry about it. Took CTA everywhere we went. Recommend the CTA pass for ease of use. Also, in Park and Stay they let you park your car before you check in. This allowed us to visit the Willis Tower before our room was ready. The Pizzeria Via Stato which is attached to the hotel is delicious, especially if you don't like Chicago-style pizza.There is no need to stay anywhere else in Chicago, this hotel and its ideal location had all we needed and more. Thanks Embassy Suites for an awesome getaway before school starts!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Sunday Evening”
Reviews.Author: pmpcap
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently had to drop off our daughter for a week stay at one of the local Universities. As a result, we decided to spend the night in Downtown Chicago at the Embassy Suites Hotel. We spent the aftenoon walking up and down Michigan Ave and shopping. Later that evening, the concierge suggested a fantastic local Italian restraunt that we could walk too. We loved the food and outdoor atmosphere. The front desk then recommended a fabulous local bar to go for a night cap. Finally, we relaxed in our spectacular room overlooking a fantastic city view. What a FANTASTIC SUNDAY EVENING we spent in Chicago. Thank you Embassy Suites - Chicaga for a worderful memory! Matt .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Staff ; Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Artie123456
Reviews.Content: Location is ideal - walking distance to many of Chicago's top destinations and public transportation. The RedLine to Wrigley is one block away. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. Rooms were recently refurbished and very clean. Complimentary, cooked to order breakfast was delicious. Would highly recommend this hotel for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect housing for a family getaway to the windy city”
Reviews.Author: thegirlsandaguy
Reviews.Content: Price was lower than other comparable hotels. Have stayed at the Marriott on Michigan and paid much more for much less satisfactory accomodations. Beautiful atrium in the center, FANTASTIC COMPLEMENTARY full service breakfast, great location just 3 blocks from Mag Mile and easy walk to Water Tower Place/American Girl. Quieter than staying on the main drag. Also, a supermarket right across the street so you don't have to pay high hotel prices if you forgot something. Saw the Courtyard and Comfort and was so happy we paid a little more and stayed here instead. Clock was set to wrong hour (1 hour fast) w/ no apparent way to reset and parking was pricey.

Reviews.Title: “spatious and confortable”
Reviews.Author: drfruenk
Reviews.Content: I've stayed twice at the Embassy Suites Hotel Chicago Downtown. The best thing about this hotel is the size of the rooms/suites. They are really spatious and confortable. Appart from that, the rest is more or less what you expect from a hotel in this price range: correct staff, clean rooms, good breakfast, a tiny swimmingpool and an adequate fitness studio. The inner hall, with a water fountain gives the hotel a nice touch. On the negative side, on my second visit, I got a room with a wonderful view of the parking building next to the hotel. If you can, ask for a room on the East (front) side of the hotel! All in all, I would recomend this hotel to families with children, or people staying in the city for a long period but who can't be bothered to get an apartment. It's very well located, and the rooms are so spatious that you won't feel packed and anxious to leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love to stay at Embassy Suites.”
Reviews.Author: katebike
Reviews.Content: Everything was 5 star. The reception desk, breakfast, and atmosphere. You can never go wrong. I still have to be around once to get that managers special. We are always too busy to come back. Thank you Embassy on State

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Embassy Suites Predictability”
Reviews.Author: fwrunner
Reviews.Content: If you've stayed at Embassy Suites before, you'll know what to expect. You pay a premium for the downtown location, but you can't beat the convenience to Michigan Avenue, the theatre district and Navy Pier. Room was very clean and up to date. Valet parking and bell staff were friendly and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Going to Chicago? Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: TrlVacation
Reviews.Content: My family and I went to Chicago last month as our annual summer vacation. We had a pretty hectic time trying to find a place to stay, at first. There were so many hotels, and so little time! Finally, we decided to stay at the Lombard Embassy Suites, about 20 minutes from Downtown Chicago. However, when we found that this hotel was right in the middle of Downtown, we switched our reservations right away. We couldn't have had a better trip. Seriously folks, this is the place to stay in Chicago. Everything was very clean when we stayed. The beds were nicely made and the sheets were clean and soft, which many hotels have troubles with. You could tell that the carpet had been cleaned and vaccumed. The bathroom didn't shine, but it was clean as well. You could tell that the hotel tried hard to put its best foot forward as far as cleanliness goes. The lobby and atrium were spick-and-span. The staff was the nicest hotel staff I've ever encountered. Everyone was all smiles all the time. By the end of our 4-day trip the staff knew our names and always greeted us on our visits to the parking garage. The parking is convienient as well, but costly ($44 a day). The location was the best part of our stay, and what makes the hotel most convienient. We walked most everywhere in Chicago, and this hotel is right smack-dab in the middle of downtown, only about a block and a half away from Michigan Avenue. We felt extremely safe and comfortable walking everywhere downtown, and the hotel was easily accessed when we forgot a water bottle or were caught in the rain. In addition, the hotel has a pool for kids. The pool is small, but is enough for 6-7 people to play comfortably. There is also a business lounge, which was a savior for checking e-mail and Facebook. Access to the lounge and pool is free with reservations. Also, hot breakfast is served every morning, and there is something down there to suit everyone. They have cereal, fruit, coffee, milk, hashbrowns, eggs, sausage, bacon, and custom-made omelets, plus other things. Every night there's a Manager's Reception that offers free appetizers to guests (while we were there, they had fried vegetables and salsa chips). I personally did not use the fitness center, but from what I could see, it was large enough.

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites Downtown - Just what we expected”
Reviews.Author: BucketAustin
Reviews.Content: 5 couples stayed here July 22-25th. I have stayed at this hotel many times over the past few years, and it is what you would expect from an Embassy Suites. Nice large 2 room suite, has refrig/microwave, 2 TV's, etc. This particular hotel is in a great location in Chicago. It is 1 block from the Redline subway station, which will take you to downtown or Wrigley Field. There are tons of restaurants within 2-3 blocks, and Rush street is within easy walking distance. Michigan Ave is 3 blocks away. Buses and cabs are easy to get. The breakfast is better than any other hotel where I have stayed that offers free breakfast (except Homewood Suites) and the free Happy Hour can save you a lot of money in Chicago. Lines can be long for the breakfast and drinks, so plan accordingly. The elevators are full during breakfast on the weekends, and there are typically a lot of kids. Parking is very expensive, use a nearby public garage and save money. The only glitch we had this time was no hot water after a big thunderstorm the night before. Management could have done a better job of explaining the situation to guests. One of our friends room on the 11th floor got flooded, then they were given keys to a room that was occupied - not good. I also had to try my key repeatedly before it worked, which was a real pain. But, overall, I would not hesitate to stay here again, and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice of Hotel When Chicago”
Reviews.Author: jeffster
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown Chicago on business from July 11- 14, 2010, The location is awesome. The hotel was spotless and the rooms quite a nice size for being in the heart of a downtown major city. The hotel is within easy walking distance to the Miracle Mile and great places to eat. There is a major supermarket directly across the street and a Trader Joe's nearby if you want to stock up on your own food items. My favorite destination for food was Portillo's where the Italian Beef sandwiches were fantastic. The cooked to order breakfast included in the price was also very good. All in all, you can't go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awsome 4th of July experience”
Reviews.Author: thedivaherself1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suite Downtown Chicago for this past 4th of July holiday. My experience was wonderful! The manager's reception was great filled with a variety of cocktails and even a specialty drink was offered for the 4th of July! The cook to order breakfast was very good.... This is not my first time staying at the Embassy Suites but rather my first choice! Whenever I travel I like to do it in style! I am looking forward to returning to the Embassy property real soon! Tiffany Smith (Chicago IL)

Reviews.Title: “We Live Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Allms
Reviews.Content: I thought the Embassy on State Street was and excellent location for anything you wanted to do in the Windy City. The room was clean and just the right size. My party had 2 women and 3 girls 15,11, and 9 we all fit perfect couldn't have ask for better. We did not make it to the Managers reception but did have breakfast and it was very good. Everyone was very helpful in helping with directions to different places in the city and buses to take. I will for sure choose the Embassy Suites Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: Metdiva
Reviews.Content: This is my first time staying in a hotel since moving from Downtown Chicago. For the price it was great! The location is perfect! It is close to everthing a tourist (which I am not) would want to see. The room was a bit run down, but we were only there to sleep so that was not that big of an issue. We feel the best part of the visit had to be the free cocktails and apps in the evening and the full breakfast in the moring. What a wonderful deal for a family. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: foxboxcolo
Reviews.Content: We weren't exactly sure how the hotel would turn out, but it ended up better than we expected. It was fairly crowded with teens and their families for some sort of school-related event in the area. Didn't notice it too much until breakfast time, and then it was hard to get in/out of the dining area and find a table. The kids seemed to love going up and down in the elevators in the atrium and running up and down the hallways on the floors. Aside from this, we enjoyed the hotel. The room was cozy and the bed was comfy. We ordered room service and it was very prompt. Figuring out the parking was a trial. We had to drive around the hotel several times before we finally found the valet entrance. There's a lot of traffic, and it's hard to turn into the entrance. The hotel was also not too convenient to downtown Chicago sites (from a walking perspective). Overall all, though, our stay was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel superb value would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: bowseywowsey
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights in June and the hotel was amazing, very clean great location everything within walking distance and the free breakfast was brilliant. The pool could do with a bit of a clean but the gym was free and the facilities were great. The staff are very helpful and friendly I would definitely stay here again and would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and very clean room!”
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Embassy Suites at 600 North State Street in Chicago, Illinois. The hotel is clean, the staff very friendly, and location was great. Our room was also very clean, and very roomy. There is a complementary breakfast each morning, which saves you a considerable amount of money, since the restaurants are a little pricy sometimes. Lots of restaurants within a few blocks, and the Rock and Roll McDonalds is about 2 blocks in back of the hotel. Michigan is only a 5 minute walk, with lots of shopping. We parked on Ontario about 1/2 block away and saved a little money there too. Its a self park garage. Whole Foods is about 2 blocks north and is a great grocery store. LOVE CHICAGO TOO!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location...”
Reviews.Author: Love2travelVT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Embassy Suites for 5 days following a wedding in Chicagoland for a mini vacation. We enjoyed the location. It is walking distance to the Magnificent mile and close to an CTA stop. The room was spacious and the cook to order breakfast was tasty and well stocked---except for first day. The staff was amazing and helpful. The elevators were amazingly fast. We seldom waited more than 10 seconds. The business center was up to the volume and had all necessary tools to do away from home business. Valet parking is pricy, but we did not bring a car. The property is looking a bit worn (mildew in tub), but there is a complete renovation in the works for this year. Great value

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Home”
Reviews.Author: cekleinert
Reviews.Content: The staff made this like home. I guess that is their slogan, "Welcome Home" We came to Chicago for my daughter's gratuation from the "Chicago School." We were very excited along with the locals for the Blackhawks to win!! That was incredible. My niece was celebrating her birthday as well and they gave her a complimentary bottle of wine. We received free passes to the "piano bar" called "Howl with the Moon" or something similar and was estactic to find musicians so brave and talented. It was a short but truly eventful trip. Center local to everything. I walked to the Merchandise Mart to meet my daughter for luch.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Kawi475
Reviews.Content: The rooms are incredibly spacious, staff are courteous, and the location is perfect. What more could you ask? The rooms have not only your standard bedroom but also a living room area with sofa, table, flat-screen TV, microwave, fridge, and toaster.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad - could have been a little better”
Reviews.Author: psychtobe
Reviews.Content: Overall, this is not a bad place. The location is really great - literally a 5-10 minute walk to almost everything in River North, on many major bus/El/train routes. The lobby was nice, we were greeted personally, the service was good but seemed to be more indifferent after the first day. No worries, we are not big service-seekers. The hotel is set up so the rooms surround an interior atrium. This is good and bad, a little odd. It feels like 'outside' but is actually inside - and a bit noisy. We had one night where a wedding was being held and the noise was really unbearable in the room. I don't think ES should host weddings in their atrium, especially at night - it is very disruptive to the guests. The room was pretty standard ES - not as nice as some others, a tiny bit worn in places, and the bathroom in particular nothing too fancy. The room was clean. I love ES because their rooms are 2 legitimate rooms - inside a king bed, outside the bathroom and a sofa bed. With a family of 4 we made full use of the space. The bed was very comfortable. Even the sofa bed wasn't too bad. There are 2 flat screen TVs in the rooms. The AC worked great. The window opens about 12 inches, which I appreciate in order to get some fresh air. There is internet in the room but it is not free. The housekeeping was about average. Twice our room hadn't been made up by 1 pm, but they were responsive to any requests. The breakfast could have been improved. It didn't feel that 'nice' with a tiled floor and trays, plates, and silverware stacked up like a college dorm cafeteria. I wish they would have varied the items a little more - pancakes and french toast, for example - instead it was the same thing every day, although they did vary between formed hash browns, tater tots, and homestyle hash browns. The food is pretty standard, I like that they'll make an egg white omelet for you every day, with fresh veggies. Overall this place was fine/pretty good. Not as nice as some other ES's, but not bad in any way. Considering the 2 room suite and free cooked breakfast I think it's a good value, especially for families. It could have been a little 'nicer' especially with regards to room upkeep and the breakfast area, but these weren't a big deal to us. The staff was fine but it seems like they forgot about us after the first day or so. I debated giving this 3 or 4 stars when I really wanted to give it 3.5 stars. In the end I chose 3 stars but that's probably a little low. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hospitable Hotel with Spacious Room and Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: EAW504
Reviews.Content: Staff is very friendly. The two room suite size is spacious for a downtown hotel. Room on upper lever was surprisingly quiet with a comfortable bed. The breakfast is outstanding with lots of food choices.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Denise089
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites in downtown Chicago is a great hotel for any kind of traveller. The hotel is sophisticated and staff are accommodating. I would definitely return to this hotel and recommend it to other travellers.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT, JUST PLAIN GREAT”
Reviews.Author: Skipper25
Reviews.Content: The location, the front desk, the breakfast buffet, the happy hour...Everything and everybody involved with this hotel is great AND don't forget to ask the Greeter Mike D, where to eat. He knows everything about every type cuisine and every good restaurant in Chiago. In fact he'll tell you your final tab if you want.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and location”
Reviews.Author: cymonster
Reviews.Content: Had never been to Embassy Suites before (anywhere). The service was outstanding from every employee we encountered. The suite-style room was awesome--separate room and living area--we would come back with our kids sometime because of it. The location is perfect. Easy walking distance to Navy Pier, Michigan Avenue, and the parks area (Millenium, etc.). Just talked with a friend of ours after visiting who said he's been there a dozen times and will continue to go back. So will we.

Reviews.Title: “Value in the City”
Reviews.Author: Katieorange
Reviews.Content: Embassy suites Chicago isnâ€™t the most upgraded hotel with the most amenities, but it is more spacious than most Chicago Hotels, it is decently priced and within the hotel rate there is an included breakfast and happy hour from 5:50 to 8:00 PM. The location is great right on State and Ohioâ€”which is close to most Tourist attractions. Hotel is clean and staff is friendly, but I did notice there was always a line for check in. Recommended for families for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Downtown Chicago”
Reviews.Author: visitor1010
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Hotel Downtown Chicago is awesome. Prices are reasonable, facility is beautifully maintained and all the folks there are outstanding! Centrally located, easy walking distance to nearly everything the city has to offfer. Close to the lake too! From the rooms to the pool, the exercise facilities and even a free breakfasts featuring made to order items everything they offer is a class act.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, as expected”
Reviews.Author: malawimike
Reviews.Content: If you have stayed at Embassy Suites in the past (anywhere), you know exactly what to expect. Came here for a one night business meeting. Hotel is nice and clean. Manager's reception was enjoyable. Great setting in the atrium -- check out photos from other postings. Breakfast was plentiful -- you won't leave hungry. The bed, sofa, room, TV, etc. was as expected. Bathroom clean and adequate. Fitness room was average or maybe even a step above average (equipment is in good working order, clean and functional). Only complaint -- stairs to upper floors are not inviting and discourage healthy behaviors of using stairs rather than elevators. stairs between floors 2 & 3, and stairs down to the lobby are very nice. Lastly, this hotel is about 2 blocks from the red line Grand Station. Take public transportation from the airports -- it could not get any easier (or cheaper -- only $2.25!!). Call the hotel in advance and they will tell you exactly how to get from the station to the hotel. Safe neighborhood -- no worries about that either. Overall, you should not be disappointed. Great staff, great hotel as always. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Room with Great Service”
Reviews.Author: michtraveler1969
Reviews.Content: While the room and ameneties were very good with this Embassy Suites what really made my visit special was the great staff encountered at every turn. Check in was fast and friendly. The ameneties were all explained and we were placed in a suite on the 8th floor. The public areas were nice and the entire place had a "nice but not overly stuffy attitude". The hallways were all clean and nicely updated with new wallpaper and carpet. The room was also recently updated with newer clean furniture, carpet and an extremely comfortable bed. The in-room fridge and microwave both worked very well. In my review of each area seperately I gave four stars instead of five simply because of the old style Phillips TV's. Nice flat screens in the bedroom and living room would easily lift the room into five star territory. What was the most impressive aspect of my visit was the kitchen staff. My travelling partner became sick during our visit and really didn't want to leave the bed. When i asked the kitchen staff if i might be able to take a tray up they were extremely understanding and helpful. They even notified the front desk who gave us a call to see if there was anything they could do to help and notified us of the nearest pharmacy and doctors offices. The quality of the breakfast also was typical for Embassy Suites which is great. When you take a newly updated, fresh, huge Embassy Suites room, combine that with great service and competetive prices in an amazing location you have a complete and total winner of a property.

Reviews.Title: “Would do it all over again!”
Reviews.Author: PattiChicago
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay at the Embassy Suites on State. Everybody was very friendly and helpful. It was also very clean. The only problem we had was the noise level at night. The room walls are very thin and also a lot of rude people allowing their kids to run around late at night. Other than that I would do it all over again.

Reviews.Title: “A good value in a great location with only minor flaws.”
Reviews.Author: novelideasbooks
Reviews.Content: Downtown Chicago is not a cheap place to stay but we felt that Embassy Suites provided a good value -- we had a nice room, parking, and included full breakfast for about $170 per night. The bathroom was on the small side but there was an additional makeup sink and mirror in the bedroom. The bedroom also was a bit crowded in the two full bed arrangement -- not so bad with a king. Everything in the room was clean and fresh. We had a problem with a phone and it was corrected immediately by the staff. The hotel was hosting an event that attracted a lot of young children for the week and provided a challenge to the facilities and staff -- everyone kept their cool and positive atmosphere. The pool was crowded and water quality somewhat questionable due to the number of children although the pool area was clean and bright. The included breakfast was hardly 5 star and got a bit boring after five days but was still a good start to the day for those not wanting to pay $2 for a glass of juice in nearby restaurants. The hotel advises guests to try early breakfast to avoid crowds -- good advice. Although it is not mentioned in online booking, there is a potential cost difference in rooms with and without a "view." It doesn't hurt to inquire on this. My biggest complaint was the "nominal fee" for internet connection -- $10 per day. I survived without it as it seemed an insult.

Reviews.Title: “Spring Break 2010”
Reviews.Author: lsl2
Reviews.Content: This was our family's first stay at Embassy Suites and we LOVED it!!. The hotel was not only beautiful but extremely clean and well maintained. Each and every staff member we encountered was friendly and pleasant. Everyone was continously trying to make our stay more enjoyable. Even my teenagers frequently commented on how nice everyone was. The breakfast and manager's reception were fabulous....Both are WONDERFUL amenities. We will definitely stay here again. We highly recommend this hotel to anyone coming to Chicago. It's a GREAT place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: RuthGWausau_WI
Reviews.Content: In our recent spring break trip, we opted to stay downtown Chicago - to experience "The City" all the way around. Our choice to stay at the Embassy Suites on North State State Street turned out to be a super choice. Rooms are clean, staff is very courteous, we opted for the inclusive parking option, (allowed our vehicle to be parked in a secured, undergound parking lot - perfect when traveling with kids). The breakfast program was great. For the hotel being right downtown, the rooms were extremely quiet - considering the traffic/noise etc outside. The rooms are really sound proof. We had the CITY VIEW, and it was certainly worth the extra few bucks. Morning or night we could get a pulse for what was happening outside very quickly. We loved the LOCATION of the hotel, if we went to the west two blocks we had great restaurants, including Hard Rock Cafe, and the Rainforest, ( and BTW there is a SUPER McDonalds was just a block further to the west.) If we ventured to the east 2 blocks we hit the ESPNZone (make sure you get your coupon at explorechicago.org). The Magnificent Mile is less than 3 blocks away to the east, and shops are in abundance. For the price, we paid to have the hotel, parking and cook to order breakfast - we found it to be a GREAT place to stay. We did eat one evening at the restaurant connected to the hotel - it was OK, probably would not eat there again on any future stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, great location, good breakfast - horrible access to computer”
Reviews.Author: visitor213
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a stay at the Embassy suites in Chicago. Overall nice hotel in a great location - easy access to restaurants, shopping, sites. Breakfast was good. The staff was excellent. My only complaint was access to computers. Access in the rooms was extremely costly and althougth they had a computer room - the access to the internet was INCREDIBLY SLOW. I haven't seen such bad internet speeds in about 10 years. Thankfully, there was a starbucks in the same building with excellent access. My comments to the managment - wake up - its 2010 and you really should offer fast access to the internet.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Embassy Suites in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: LyndaMN
Reviews.Content: We have a daughter who lives in Chicago so we visit there many times a year and our recent trip was our 3rd time staying at the Embassy Suites Downtown. We love this hotel! I don't want to repeat what everyone else has already said so I will just say - - STAY HERE and you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “I had a grate time at Embassy Suites!”
Reviews.Author: JayTC
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two nights. After a delayed flight and all the chaos at O'Hare, I finally arrived at a hotel. Front desk staff was friendly and helpful. I got a room on 6th floor toward state st. It was a nice, well-maintained room. I love that they have complimentary breakfast and manager's special in the evening. Location is also another good thing of this hotel. It's very close to Grand station redline. Jewel-Osco is across the street [you can also purchase CTA pass here.] And 2-3 blocks to N.Michigan or Magnificent mile. All in all, Embassy Suites downtown chicago is perfect for anyone [business traveler, tourists, solo traveler ect.] Only complaint I would have is the Internet fee. It would be best if it's free : )

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family”
Reviews.Author: my_trip_review2010
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a short 2 night family trip to Chicago and we stayed at this hotel while there. The location of this hotel was perfect for us. It was within close walking distance to the red line train and to the bus stop. There were a number of restaurants that were nearby as well. The hotel had a package where we could get our car anytime we wanted without paying for in/out fees each time. Although we didn't need our car during our stay, the extra cost of the room per night ($20/night) with this package was still worth it because it was still cheaper to pay this than to pay for each night to park the car ($44/night). Since having children (ages 2 and 5), we've always stayed in hotels with suites. The suite and hotel were fine - typical of an Embassy Suite. The breakfast was great - hot, ready to eat, and a good selection. The only not so positive reviews I would give is that our room faced the street and so each night we were woken up at least once by sirens in the area. I also thought that the hotel cost was a bit pricey (but I tend to be frugal) but to consider its location in the middle of the city, it worked out for us. Overall, however, we were satisfied with the hotel and it served our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Downtown Stay”
Reviews.Author: singletraveler014
Reviews.Content: my stay was very enjoyable. the hotel was centrally located. the staff and service provided was excellent. the complimentary full service breakfast was delicious. the cook prepared a delicious omelet.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Hotel made for Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: rentsellbuy
Reviews.Content: Flight got to Chicago at 7:00 AM, got to Hotel at 7:30. Held bgs and had room ready by 11:00! On the back end, they allowed late check out (so we could squeeze in some extra sight-seeing) and held bags on back side. EVERYONE, from front desk, conceirge, bellmen to other employees were as nice as they could be. Mike Y-front Desk Mgr. was especially helpful! The sixe of the room (as a suite) was ample. Having a microwave (heat up left-overs from Chinatown) was great and a mini-fridge that actually kept things cool was appreciated. I got the 3 Day Day CTA pass, and the Conceirges were great about giving directions. Even though we generally got in around 2 AM, the breakfasts were so inviting that we had to awaken for the specials (and then go back to bed) and we really liked the receptions in the evening to get a start on the night!! Great Location, great deal. I'll defintiely stay again when in Chi town. Additionally, I was so impressed with the hotel, I'm really going to focus on the Embassy Suite brand when I travel to other places!

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN-DIRTY FILTHY POOL-THIN WALLS -SHOCKING”
Reviews.Author: drifter442
Reviews.Content: After debating between hotels in Chicago we decided that this was the place for us based on past reviews. However, the experience was one of the worst stays we have ever had. We have young children who after a long day of sightseeing would like to take a swim. PLEASE DO NOT GO SWIMMING IN THIER POOL. The first night the pool was noticeably dirty and cloudy. We gave it the benefit of the doubt and returned the next couple nights as well hoping someone would have the time to clean it. Needless to say nobody ever did and after a few minutes of pulling bunches of hair from our baby's mouth and hands we escaped the pool. I thought I would at least put my feet in the hot tub but again the bubbles were filled with gunk and filth. I picked up a few of my kids' water toys from around the edges of the pool area and also noticed that the pool was not the only place that need some attention. The entire rooms perimeter was caked with dirt and crud. There are not enough adjectives to describe this experience. After mentioning this to the manager they proceeded to tell us that they would send an engineer to the pool the next day to "shock" the water. I think that is exactly why the area is the way it is. Shocking the water is not going to magically clean up the pool. Someone needs to physically sweep and scrim the water and while they are at it maybe mop the floors. Other issues inlcude: thin walls, poor concierge service, poor breakfast, moldy bathrooms, mandatory bell hops when using luggage racks Highlights: location Conclusion: If you want to act like a 5-star hotel you need to start with the basics. MAKE SURE ITS CLEAN

Reviews.Title: “Everything was just perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: creatingmemories
Reviews.Content: We took the train into Chicago for a weekend of fun and found our accomodations to be absolutely wonderful! We walked from Millenium Park train station to the hotel and found it to surpass our expectations. The Embassy Suites is 2 blocks from the center of activity on Michigan Avenue~The Magnificent Mile! The hotel is nicely centered with many eateries, shops etc nearby. The room was large and very clean, the complimentary breakfast was outstanding, including made to order omlets! The breakfast was a great way to start the busy day and the Managers Cocktail get together was a relaxing opportunity around 6pm before heading back out for dinner! All of the staff members were very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed every minute of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and helpful staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: mcqsha
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location is within walking distance to Michigan Avenue and many restaurants. Smiles greet you from the doorman and the hotel staff. The complimentary breakfast is good and the suites are roomy and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: MIGia
Reviews.Content: My daughter & I bring her children to Chicago every year over winter break. There is never a question as to where we are going to stay. The Embassy Suites staff is always friendly & helpful, the hotel comon areas & rooms are kept very clean, the location is ideal - close to Navy Pier, Millenium Park, the waterfront, the museum complex, shopping (Lego Store), great restaurants, & parking is very handy. The two-room suites have a refrigerator & microwave in the kitchen area - ideal for families with children who like to snack. I think it's a great deal for what you get. We live in Michigan & many friends travel to Chicago for a holiday. I always recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay with grandchildren”
Reviews.Author: travelinggrandma186
Reviews.Content: Welcoming, comfortable and perfect for a family stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Location in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Cubsfan70
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the ideal location, keeping you close to all of the shopping and restaurants. No need to grab a cab as you can walk anywhere. The rooms are updated and provide a lot of space. Cooked-to-order breakfast is great and the service is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't get any better than this!”
Reviews.Author: rebe1977
Reviews.Content: I booked my room directly on the Embassy website. The parking is extra, but there are packages available that include parking, I would recomend booking the parking with the room, it appeared to be cheaper. The hotel could not be in a better location. Within walking distance to The Magnificent Mile and a few of my favorite restaurants, Gino's East and Ed Debevics(just four blocks from the hotel) The parking attendant was a DOLL!! Check in was easy and fast. The managers reception wasn't busy at all which includes free cocktails. Breakfast was fabulous as usual. The beds were more than comfortable. We stayed at the Embassy last month in Peoria,IL, and we got the same great treatment. Kudos to you Embassy Suites and your employees, they need a pat on the back for the superb job they do.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: ltpage123
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and efficient! Room was clean! Bar had a great atmosphere, and the drinks were strong! :) Most defiently will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant from the time we walked in”
Reviews.Author: Stealth7
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Embassy Suites hotel was a great experience. From the time I walked in, I felt welcome and there seemed to be among the staff eagerness to help. The room was clean and worth the price. The subway was convenient which made getting around more economical.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Bang For Your Buck!!!”
Reviews.Author: csayavong
Reviews.Content: My family and I are loyal to Embassy Suites Hotels. The wonderful cook to order breakfast, spacious rooms, and home-like atmosphere are always great. This was our first trip to Chicago and this hotel couldn't have been more perfect. The location of the hotel is amazing. It is in walking distance of Michigan Ave shopping, the Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, The Chop House, and Navy Pier. For those places a little too far to walk it is only 2 blocks from the subway "Red Line". There is always a wonderful grocery store right across the street which definitely came in handy for the late night munchies my 3 kids had. The staff was simply amazing. We arrived early and had not problem checking in early. The concierge was very helpful in giving us directions to everywhere we wanted to go, and the doorman greeted us each time we came and went with a heart-felt "welcome home family". All of this for only $99.00 per night!!! The only downfall was the parking which is $44.00 per day, but it is downtown Chicago so that was to be expected. Even the parking staff was wonderful. On our last day there we checked out at 12pm but we were able to leave our car in the parking garage until 3pm which allowed us to get some last minute shopping and dining. If you are looking for a great hotel, with great staff, perks, and a great locale, this hotel is the best bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “My winter weekend in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: dojotito
Reviews.Content: Room was a little cool in the evening with no way to control temp. On arrival, there was a disposable gum brush balanced on the edge of the bedroom vanity top. It was not a problem disposing of this, but it did indicate that the vanity top had not been cleaned. It was difficult to use personal items in the bathroom as there was not a vanity top and the sink had sloping corners which caused items to slide off and fall in the sink. We did move a wobbly wire rack over to the sink, but this had shelves that would allow items to easily slide off and fall on the floor. These were minor inconveniences and our stay in general and the breakfasts in particular was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, a Great Location, and an Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: HappyFeet054
Reviews.Content: I stayed here recently with my husband and daughter for two nights. I am very enthusiastic about this hotel. The facility itself is in great shape. The suite is very clean and comfortable. The bed and linens are excellent. What really tips the scale, however, is the staff. Every single staff person whom I encountered was cheerful and friendly. I was greeted with genuine smiles. It was great. The Manager's Reception provided guests with a nice way to unwind at the end of a busy day, and the breakfast made-to-order omelets are delicious. Thank you, Embassy Suites Downtown Chicago, for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: gallodlg
Reviews.Content: I really liked my stay at the Embassy Suits Chicago. The location in perfect! A few blocks from all the business and pleasure action, with a grocery store right across the street, and wonderful restaurants all around it. Unlike other hotels in Chicago, the ES rooms are SPACIOUS! Perfect for business travelers! And the lobby is awesome too! Old school Chicago elegance. Oh, and the breakfast....yumm!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel and the staff were wonderful”
Reviews.Author: sealed
Reviews.Content: The front desk, concierge and the bellman were always very friendly and helpful. My room was very clean and comfortable and since I travel frequently, it was the next best thing to being home. I loved the location of the hotel since it had many wonderful restaurants within walking distance and of course there was Miracle Mile just steps away. It can't get any better than that!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suite is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: callentigers6
Reviews.Content: We love how friendly the door man are when we enter. The manager's reception at night is a great way to start the evening. I love the breakfast they offer in the morning in the beautiful atrium.

Reviews.Title: “wouldn't stay anywhere else in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: Pattvtme
Reviews.Content: I stay at embassy suites in general because I can count on a good value and a standard of quality that I require. What sets this Embassy Suites apart is the level of service and the culture of hospitality in every department. My recent trip was during a huge snowstorm. My arrival was late but check in took no time at all.The front desk staff took my coat and bag so that I could go right to the restaurant without going to my room first. When my departure was delayed and delayed my stay was extended with ease and empathy for my situation. As I had checked out before I knew that my train was cancelled, the front desk called house keeping who cleaned my room immediately. The staff made a real difference for me and their cheerful assistance was appreciated!

Reviews.Title: “Embassy Suites is our Chicago home.”
Reviews.Author: MJP1959
Reviews.Content: Every January, several girlfriends go to Chicago for a weekend of shopping, dining, theater, and fun. We have known each other for 54 years, and have been coming to Embassy Suites, Downtown Chicago for the last 16 years. Roberto, the doorman recognizes us each year, and gives us a warm welcome each time. The staff is always friendly, accomodating and efficient. Richard, the Concierge was very helpful this year, obtaining our boarding passes for our trip home, and last year secured us seats at the last minute for Jersey Boys. We love this hotel, and would recommend it to everyone we know that wants a home away from home when they travel to Chicago. The location is perfect, the breakfasts are wonderful, the suites clean and spacious. Great place!!! MJ Phillips Farmington Hills, MI

Reviews.Title: “Great trip after the holidays”
Reviews.Author: inahrtbeat
Reviews.Content: I stayed downtown Chicago at Embassy suites..As always this hotel chain was fantastic. The spacious rooms along with the open lobby and of course the manager's reception were fantastic. I almost fogot the greta free breakfast is just what makes staying at Embassy suites the best overall value. Greta central location to the miricle mile and Rush street.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great time @ Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: miller311
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the downtown Chicago Embassy Suites quite a few times and always have a great time. The hotel is in a great location to enjoy everything, from shopping, dining, enjoying The Magnificient Mile, etc. The hotel has everything you could ask for, spacious suite, complimentary cocktail reception, breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: darren71
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel two weekends back to back. We were in town for some weekend fun and this hotel puts you right in the middle of it all. The staff at the hotel is great. We arrived early and they allowed us to check in early and even got a great room close to our friends. Happy our drinks and free hot breakfest is a nice touch. Would definitely stay here in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for our "stay"cation. We had a great time and what a great deal!”
Reviews.Author: smalldeleu
Reviews.Content: My husband and I actually live in Chicago and decided to have a little "getaway" without kids. This hotel was perfect for us. We are locals and we thought the location was great, easy to walk anywhere. The hotel and room were very clean, spacious and comfortable. And you can't beat the price! Free drinks at the manager's reception and free breakfast, we can't wait to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel in the absolute dream location!”
Reviews.Author: StangGT909
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Embassy Suites downtown Chicago over New Years 2009. We got an incredible price on the Hiltonhonors website by pre-paying for the stay. Check-in was great and they let us keep our car parked outside the hotel while we carried our bags to our room. The room itself was very spacious and comfortable. I had seen pictures from other travelers and was concerned the finishings would be dated but to my surprise everything felt fairly new and extremely clean. The bathroom was absolutely immaculate! As all Embassy Suites, they provided free drinks in the evening and a free breakfast. I would have enjoyed a larger beer selection but they did a great job making mixed drinks and wine and you can never beat free! If you're reading this and aren't familiar with the location... I'm telling you it can't be better. If you're going to shop on Michigan Ave., this hotel is just a couple blocks to the west. I would choose this location than to be right on Michigan because of all the restaurant choices that are right next door. I recommend Joe's for crab and steak just a few blocks over on Grand. Full tuxedo wait staff with crumb scrapers and the food is great. The hotel is also right next door to the red line subway stop which (by connecting to other lines) can take you pretty much anywhere including the airports. I highly recommend this hotel and will stay there again during my next visit this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!! Perfect!!”
Reviews.Author: bremarv
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Chicago with my 17 year old daughter for a "girls" getaway. Stayed 4 nights at the Embassy Suites and absolutely loved it! Location was absolutely perfect for us; we walked EVERYWHERE and never took our car out of the parking garage. You can find cheaper parking ($25 a day) within a few blocks but probably not as convenient as parking at the hotel. All staff was efficient and friendly (except for one female bartender at happy hour; she was very unfriendly and out of a line of 50 people only asked ME to see my room key. We were dressed nicely to go out to dinner that evening; didn't we look like hotel guests?). This hotel's location is perfect for shopping, dining and everything else. We didn't use public transportation but cabs are very abundent and easy to flag when you need one. There is a Jewel Osco grocery right next door for drinks, snacks or anything else you might need. There also is a Walgreens right down the street across from the Hard Rock Cafe (our fave place-got to have Ficker as your waiter!! A great time :) Michigan Ave is a few short blocks away and it's shopping heaven!! Breakfast is superb and included (don't find that too often; especially the cooked to order omelet station). Happy Hour is really busy and the snacks could be better (maybe some nuts or small appetizers in addition to the chips and crackers) but it's included too so I'm not complaining! There was a wedding reception at the hotel on the Saturday night that we were there and it got a bit loud after midnight but hey, it's their special day; hope they had a great time!! The suite is great; nice and roomy and the beds are soooo comfy. Microwave and fridge and extra sink/mirror in the bedroom area; nice! The only thing that would be nice would be to have free internet access included in the rate. We did use the business center but there are only three computers available to use. Overall the hotel was fantastic; it would be hard for us to stay anywhere else when visiting downtown Chicago. We loved it so much we've already booked a room here for Spring Break '10!!

Reviews.Title: “Love Embassy Suites and this one doesn't disapoint”
Reviews.Author: przybylski1
Reviews.Content: Great location in downtown Chicago for shopping and nightlife. Breakfast was excellent as were nighttime refreshments. Even the doorman was very friendly! Rooms were updated and well appointed Downsides to this hotel... onsite parking expensive (typical of Chicago) and no free wifi

Reviews.Title: “Great value, but . . .”
Reviews.Author: chailover
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Embassy Suites and give high marks for almost everything. Really would have liked to have had a DVD player in the room for movies brought from home (buying movies in the room was $14.99!) and were surprised that there wasn't free internet access in the rooms or at least free wireless in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: psoupWaterford
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband, my brother and his girlfriend, and my Dad and his wife. 2 of our rooms were available an hour before check in, but one was not. At check in time my dad went to get into his room and it was still not available so they comped us the parking for 2 days ($44/night). The room was available just about 15 minutes later. My parents also got 1 night comped to them as well because when we returned to the hotel after touring the town at 5pm - the maids were still cleaning it!! They were very nice and apologized about the inconvenience and gave them a free night. It was awesome!! The hotel itself was extremely clean, the King suites were very roomy and quiet, and the free drinks and appetizers from 5:30 - 7:30 each night were awesome!! The free continental breakfast wasn't a continental breakfast at all - it was a full blown buffet if you ask me!! They had omelettes to order, eggs, fruit, sausage, bacon, toast, every kind of juice you could want, and the list goes on!! This was truly an amazing hotel and we will DEFINITELY stay there again!! The concierge service was a bit slow for questions or getting tour bus tickets, but we can overlook that!! All in all - great experience and very nice hotel for the money!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: luvtraveling25
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I double dated with another couple in Chicago this past weekend. We stayed Friday through Sunday, and the hotel didn't seem too busy at all (relative to the size of the hotel). I beleive the service was sub par for Embassy Suites standards. Checking in took to long, as I had two rooms under the same reservation but the young lady could only find one. She swiped my credit card atleast 20 times, and was slightly unsure how the process worked. When we used the pool on Friday night, is was not busy at all. It was only the four of us, a mother and daughter, and a group of about 10 children all under the age of 12. The children were RUNNING around, screaming, jumping, just pure chaos. This made it very uncomfortable for everyone else in the facility. I am all for children have a great time, but there was no adult supervision at all and that is a safety hazard. We called the Front Desk from the pool area and notfied them of the situaiton, and they told us security would be on the way. However, no security ever showed up, but the" father" came into the pool area and said that the staff had called him and said that we thought his kids were out of control. He continued to stare at us and say unpleasant comments to us, and told he kids to continue doing whatever they wanted. First off, the Front Desk should never tell someone that someone else complained on them, and secondly, they should never lie to the guest like they did. They had no intention on calling security and did not care about our time at the pool. The young ladies at the Managers Reception were very friendly and helpful. However, on Saturday night they only had about 20 tables available for guests to sit at while at the reception, and they only offer chip and salsa. Every one was just standing up against walls and sitting on the floors. Not very welcoming. All other Embassy Suites offer much larger sitting accomodations, I beleive this one is falling below standard. Breakfast was great, however due to limited seating and the tables not being cleaned very quickly, it was hard to locate a seat. The older concierge in the evenings wasn't as friendly as the one in the morning/afternoon. So I would recommend that you get all your questions asked early in the day. GREAT location to everything in the city, and very easy to walk from to everything. Rooms were great, and very clean. All the staff, other than front desk, was very helpful and prompt with service!

Reviews.Title: “Good, but the Columbus Drive Embassy Suites a better choice”
Reviews.Author: IgoPlaces
Reviews.Content: This property is not as inviting many Embassy Suites. Check in always seems to take long here than elsewhere. The morning buffets are far, far less organized than at other ES properties with plates and food sitting about waiting to be returned or disposed. Rooms are typical ES rooms and well-kept. The walking location is fantastic to many things. The upshot is that this hotel does not work as efficiently or smoothly as most ES properties. I am unsure if it is understaffed or simply underperforming.

Reviews.Title: “Chicago”
Reviews.Author: ldydove
Reviews.Content: Parking was good, it was under the hotel, food, breakfast was all very good, the service was excellent and they were able to give us suggestions where to go for dinners.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: sjakeway
Reviews.Content: loved it! It was great!@ Rooms were large and had a ball!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome view and location”
Reviews.Author: JuleneV
Reviews.Content: Moms and Daughters weekend...city view is great! 4 out of the 6 of us had never been to Chicago and they loved the view. A few blocks from the Magnificent Mile and great restaurants all around. Was able to leave our car in the garage until 3pm of the day we checked out which was a great help in not having to repark and pay a daily parking rate. You can't beat the breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a fantastic free breakfast buffet.”
Reviews.Author: dbash
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice hotel. It has a separate bedroom area and a microwave and coffee maker. It had free drinks and snacks in the evening and a fantastic breakfast buffet in the morning. This hotel is well situated to the attractions of the city. We were very happy with our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down!”
Reviews.Author: rc218
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Embassy Suites for a long weekend. It was located within a mile of michigan ave. so great for shopping but we would definately look to stay somewhere else the next time we go to Chicago. The managers reception was really disappointing. Spinach dip and stale pita bread. The breakfast in the morning was a real bummer as well. The eggs were cold and the french toast soggy. The pull out bed was broken. I called to the front desk 2 different times, after a half hour wait I finally got fed up and went down to the front desk. They gave us a different room. Nothing like having to move all your stuff at 11:00 at night. The pull out bed in the new room worked but you could feel the springs in the mattress. My daughter woke up with a sore back the next morning. Overall, a very disappointing stay. We will definately be looking to stay somewhere else the next time we visit the windy city!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and easy access to places.”
Reviews.Author: megrodneym
Reviews.Content: I love the suite because you get the additional room. TVs in both the living room and bedroom, not that we used them so much, but nice to have. The complimentary buffet makes the morning so easy. The food was good and there was a good variety. The doorman and concierge were great help!

Reviews.Title: “A Great, Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Alyrica
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Embassy Suites just in time for the 4th of July festivities. My daughter (spoiled due to excess hotel stays) was actually impressed with the layout and cleanliness of the hotel. We were invited to the Manager's reception each evening for free cocktails and snacks. A nice touch!! The concierge was also exceptional. We were constantly asking questions and he was always friendly and helpful. We checked out and stayed at the Hyatt Regency for the last two days of our trip. My daughter said, although it was luxurious, it was super busy and impersonal. Next time I stay in Chicago, I'm staying at the Embassy Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel will go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mrswolverine
Reviews.Content: My hubby and i stayed at hotel wed 9/30-10/4/9. We absolutely enjoyed a=our stay. my hubby had a business meeting, I went to shop and sight see. I don't know where to start. The room was great no complaints great comfy bed ( to be a hotel). Granite countertops in bathroom they tried to make it feel like home I guess you could say. Hubby say meeting rooms adaquate. Business center was great especially if you did not buy the internet in your room (which we did which is 9.95 plus they tax that) The front desk staff was very nice with smiling faces everytime you went down always willing to help. The conciege, Phillip is the best. He told me everything I wanted to know. Go on the Chicago Trolley for a tour one day or three. I went three. It was awsome. You hop on and off as you wish. You just have to get back on by 5pm or you can take a taxi which can get really expensive. Did not take the el which is the train or any buses. Paid for a taxi so we could get there. Hold on the taxi people drive fast. You will also hear a lot of horn blowing. I met Richard once, hes's nice too. Navy pier does a fre trolley to the pier on Fri, sat, and sun. Don't really drink but they had free drinks from 530-730pm. they made me a sex in the beach and it tasted like koolaid. Also they give you snacks to like pretzals, spinach dip and crackers,and cheese. Don't look for this to get you full it's a nice evening snack. I read previous reviews and i think people were trying to get full and that not what it's for. There is a great hotdog place called Portillos one block over. THIS IS A MUST. There is a rain forest cafe, hard rock cafe, Mcdonalds, ESPN, all one block over. Overall the hotel is great. The next time I go to Chicago will differnlt stay here. Mag mile as the call it (magnifient mile) is 3 blocks. You can walk, have plenty of money to shop. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Value??, Parking??”
Reviews.Author: BillF
Reviews.Content: I usually stay at the Hilton by Grant Park. This hotel is more expensive, north of the river, a few blocks off of Michigan Avenue. Plenty of eating options in the area. I usually pay $40 less to stay at the Hilton, and the parking is $40 at either place. Rooms are clean and quiet. Free breakfeast is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: oldtriangle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites for 3 nights and found the Hotel excellent. The Rooms or Suites clean and a good size. The bathroom was on the average size and there wasn't an extractor fan, which was needed. The service was friendly and the concierge was first class. An Ideal location to view and explore Chicago. Included in your stay is a fine breakfast, you can have an omelette freshly made and other food available. Then in the evening between 5:30- 7pm a free bar I hope one day to return to Chicago and would be more than happy to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “great choice for a central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: auburnbarb
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel while on a sightseeing trip to Chicago from the west coast. It was the perfect spot. The staff was helpful from the beginning. Richard, the concierge, gave us tips of things to see and directions for how to get around. He helped us get tickets to the House of Blues Sunday brunch- a super experience! Three senior citizens who travel together frequently couldn't have been more pleased with our stay. Thank you Embassy Suites. Barb from Seattle

Reviews.Title: “Good but could be better”
Reviews.Author: travelbabyKent
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 days from 7 Sept. Things we loved about the room - spacious with separate bedroom, clean and beds were comfortable. Things we loved about the hotel facilities - free breakfast with lots of variety, pool and jacuzzi, manager's reception in the evenings.Things that could have been better - friendliness of front of house staff, availability of concierge and pool was quite green and doesn't appear to have been cleaned regularly. Even though it's a great idea for the manager's reception and great to have free drinks and nibbles but expected better quality nibbles (I guess may be too much to ask since its free??). Overall it was excellent value for the rates we paid and location was great.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome....stay here!”
Reviews.Author: peng1111
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the door....no, from the moment we approached the parking entrance and a passing employee stopped to offer instruction for parking and good wishes for our stay, the service in this hotel was first rate. I admit it....I'm a bit of a hotel pig. This hotel did NOT leave me wanting. From the fabulous free breakfast featuring an omelet maker to needing to get a duplicate valet ticket because I lost mine, EACH and EVERY member of the staff went out of their way to make me feel welcome and to be helpful. The purpose of our trip was our daughter's Sweet 16 birthday. We took her and 3 of her friends for a shopping weekend and they all absolutely loved it. I tip well generally because I think it's the right thing to do, but I don't mind telling you to bring extra cash because you'll tip more than usual! After the service, the location of the hotel is great for walking to Water Tower Place/Hancock center and, if you really like to walk, to Navy Pier. Cab rides of about 15 blocks or so ran around $10 plus tip, so not too bad. I would not hesitate to stay in this hotel again. Oh, and one more thing. My stay was FREE as I was using HHonors reward points, and IT DIDN"T MATTER....the service was the same.

Reviews.Title: “nice location but is it really worth the money???”
Reviews.Author: mamarooda
Reviews.Content: if you're loaded and looking to spend your cash on a hotel, this would be the place to go. don't get me wrong, the hotel is beautiful and located on State Street in downtown Chicago, but honestly, $300 a night is a bit too much for me. And parking within the hotel is an additional $44 per day. The lobby and atrium are gorgeous, as to be expected for this area but the rooms, well i guess it's location, location, location. Around the corner is the Hard Rock Cafe, Rainforest Cafe, Red Head Piano Bar and other various attractions. The Embassy offers a full breakfast which honestly wasn't the best i've ever had. As for the room, we had a living room with flat screen tv and work table, mini fridge and microwave, decent sized bathroom, make-up mirror with sink - separate from the bathroom, and king sized bed. The a/c didn't seem to work very well if at all, the toilet acted close to overflowing, outside window only opens a few inches with the opening blocked by the heavy curtains. Alarm clock in the room does have the option to plug in your ipod/mp3 player but the volume didn't seem to work either. This is a non-smoking hotel so you have to go out to the front in order to do so. There is a restaurant/bar located inside the Embassy also.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, service and facilities...”
Reviews.Author: SKinBhamAL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is one well oiled machine. While we were there, the place seemed to be at 100% occupancy. There was a large family reunion, a large wedding in the ballroom and party afterwards in the atrium. All the while, in another area, cranking out cocktails effortlessly for the usual manager's reception. The staff was courteous yet unobtrusive and quick to respond to your needs. Our rollway popped a rivet which caused it not to close. No problem. A phone call and maintenance is there in five minutes. Rooms are kept in tip top shape. Excellent concierge service. The location can't be beat. One block to the Red Line CTA. Three blocks to Michigan Avenue and the bus lines. Surrounded by good restaurants, chains and indigenous ones alike. The breakfast buffet is icing on the cake, especially for a family. Excellent omelets and lots of other items to choose from. I am a usually pretty harsh judge, but can't think of a more suitable hotel in Chicago for a family vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great Chicago stay”
Reviews.Author: cabo23
Reviews.Content: This Embassy Suites appeared to be better than other Embassy Suites hotels that we have stayed at. Upon arrival at about 10:30 AM, the room was ready. Front desk staff was helpful. The room was spacious, the sink in the bedroom was very convenient with 4 people. The pool was a great plus in a large city. It was a great refresher. The fitness center was much larger and better than other Embassy Suites hotels that we have stayed at. The concierge (Phillip) was very helpful with all of our needs.The only downside to this hotel was the GIGANTIC breakfast line. In other Embassy Suites hotels, the line is much shorter. Overall, this hotel has great rooms, a great location, and great amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, staff, service and location”
Reviews.Author: Dinkmaster
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this Embassy more than once and have never had a bad experience. The staff has always been friendly and helpful. No problems with the accomodations and the rooms are surprisingly quiet on the State St. side, considering the volume of traffic. The hotel is very close to just about everything downtown including great restaurants, entertainment, museums, night clubs etc. Oh, and only 3 blocks from Michigan Ave. The concierge's are quite knowledgeable and anxious to help. Be sure to make use of them for help with your trip and take advantage of the free breakfast and Managers happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Tourists, But Know about the Extra Charges”
Reviews.Author: msm
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 8 nights for a trade show. The hotel met my expectations--location is great; everything was clean; breakfast was the typical Embassy buffet;the nightly manager's reception was better than most. The hotel was generally crowded with lots of families but not excessively so. Wedding receptions can be noisy here so ask for a room on the upper floors. The pool is small, but that wasn't a concern to me. I would definitely stay again. I would suggest that you review is the list of charges when deciding where to stay. Parking was expensive at $44 per night, but that's true of all Chicago hotels (see below). The surprising extra charge was the $9.95 Internet charge per day--per computer, which adds up over a week when you have 2 computers for business. My husband and I both need to work from the computer so we each take a laptop. When he was gone with his computer during the day for business, I had to pay to connect with my laptop. The system recognizes the different computers and charges for each. Many chains provide free wi-fi and don't charge for multiple computers so I was surprised. However, this is probably a concern for only a small fraction of people. You can use the computers in the business center for free (including printing) but you can't work from there all day, obviously. The Italian restaurant at the hotel (Osteria on State) is excellent. We had late night pizza twice and had a fixed price multi-course dinner another night. Dinner began with small plates, then a salad, then pasta, then the meat and potatoes. Also in walking distance was the Chicago Chop House, Rainforest Cafe, the famous McDonalds, Volare's, Weber's and many more. You can walk to most of the desired shopping (Magnificent Mile and State Street) areas. The neighborhood seemed safe and was very active. For parking discounts, use one of the public lots within two blocks. I got a much better rate by using GTAhotels.com (no, I don't work for/with them) than I could get with the hotel or my Hilton Honors. ES wouldn't match their rate even though I asked.

Reviews.Title: “Good location for family trip”
Reviews.Author: TexasTravelerAustin
Reviews.Content: This property is a good choice if you are traveling with children. We were able to walk to the subway, the bus, shopping, dining, sightseeing. The staff was very helpful (especially Roberto who helped us with our luggage) and the suites were well appointed, with plenty of room and privacy for parents and kids. The bathroom was a bit narrow, as is often the case in Embassy Suites, but the extra sink in the bedroom helps with the traffic flow when your whole family is trying to get ready at the same time! There is no view to speak of, and it sometimes got a bit noisy, but overall this did not bother me. One surprise is that the complementary manager's reception serves a full bar, not just beer and wine. The breakfast got ridiculously crowded, though, and the location of the breakfast buffet in relation to the elevators makes it worse. Another complaint is that the parking is very very expensive, but I am sure that is competitive with other properties in the area. Overall, not perfect, but a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: lmcmom
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from a short vacation (2 days) to the Windy City. I have stayed in a couple of downtown Chicago hotels, and this hotel by far had the best staff and service of any of them. From the parking attendant to the bellhop, the front desk clerk to the concierge...everyone was wonderful. The location was close to Michigan Avenue as well as to the Navy Pier trolley. This hotel is also close to ESPN Zone, Rainforest Cafe, Rock N Roll McDonalds, Portillos and many other great places to eat. A taxi ride to the Shedd was only $11. I thought the complimentary breakfast was fantastic! Yes-it was a little busy...but the lines moved fast and luckily, our 3 little ones waited very patiently! The pool was busy and a little crowded but our kids didn't seem to mind. I didn't feel that the hotel was noisy at all. We were up on the 9th floor which may have helped. (We also came prepared with a noisemaker to help drown out the noise) Our view was that of a parking garage but that was ok...we weren't in our room much. If you are on the fence about where to stay, jump over to this hotel. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Definite Recommend for Families with Children”
Reviews.Author: mariaalexis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked the Embassy Suites for a long vacation weekend with our 20 month old son. This was our first trip with our son, so we were very concerned about how he would sleep in a new environment. The hotel was very accommodating, especially with regard to our need for a crib. They originally gave us a Pak&Play, but send housekeeping up immediately with a 'real' crib when we called the front desk. The last night was a Saturday and there were older kids from dance teams yelling and playing in the Atrium as late as 10:45 pm, keeping our baby awake. My husband had to call the front desk twice to complain, but ultimately the manager on duty resolved the problem and gave us that night free. Despite the noise issue that night, we were very impressed with how the hotel handled customer service issues, and with the general 'can do' attitude of everyone from the front desk staff to valets to maids and doormen. The hotel is brimming with families with children, and the free breakfast buffet is a particular family mob scene. Understandable, because the suite arrangement and perfect location downtown make it the ideal place to stay with children. If I were in town without kids or on business, however, I would run screaming in the other direction. In other words, it's a great place to stay with kids, but if you don't have kids, there are way too many kids! Location is perfect. Just a couple blocks off Michigan, near the Grand train stop, walking distance to Navy Pier, and short drive to Lincoln Park. In and out parking privileges made travel around town a breeze. Biggest pluses were LOCATION, customer service, friendly doormen, great maid service, fun atrium atmosphere, and breakfast. Oh, AND the workout room is great. Not big, but just right for the relative few guests that seem to use it and the cardio equipment is the best I've used in a long time, having visited lots of gyms. Biggest minuses: Chaotic lobby, always packed swimming pool, and crazy loud kids (other than mine, of course).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Embassy Suites in Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: joan3boys
Reviews.Content: I too think this Embassy Suites should be in top ten of Chicago Hotels. It is in the most perfect location being usually within 3-5 blocks of excellent restaurants and shopping. We loved employee Michael and Phillip was excellent with all of our many questions. The breakfast was typical Embassy Suites and done well and efficiently. The manager's reception was better than most with a hot item each day. The rooms were not luxurious by all means, but clean and well appointed. We stayed here for 6 nights and were very happy the entire time.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Chicago!”
Reviews.Author: UpN0rthMN
Reviews.Content: Stayed several nights in Chicago to take in the sights and attend a MN Twins/Cubs game at Wrigley field. The location of the hotel was awesome. We walked nearly everywhere and is only a couple of blocks from the Red Line/CTA so getting to Wrigley was a snap. Room was clean and staff was super helpful. Breakfast was perfect for my husband and myself but nothing crazy. Only compliant is Chicago is a noisy city to try and sleep in - sirens go off all night so bring earplugs if light sleeper. Price was on the high end but was expected from location and Embassy Suites. When we bring the kids we would consider staying closer to the Navy Pier but perfect for a couple. We had an appetizer and pizza at their restaurant which was good. The pool only reaches 4 feet which would make it nice for families with small children - hot tub/fitness area are tiny. We were super happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not the "elite" hotel it claims it is”
Reviews.Author: Sappipaper
Reviews.Content: I stayed in room 538, a handicapped room. I'm 5'10. The shower was not only too short, but the sliding pole the shower head is attached to was broken. I had a meeting at 7am Wednesday morning. My hairdryer started smoking after 5 minutes of use, putting me behind. The front desk kindly sent maintenence up to give me another one. However, when I came back to my room that night after it had been cleaned, I found the old smokey one still attached to the wall and the new one just sitting there on the sink!??? We're not talking regualr handheld hair dryers. These are the dryers with a large base that is supposed to be attached to the wall. To top it off, I went to make coffee preparations for the morning and discovered housekeeping didn't bother to refill the coffee or creamer/sugar. It's close to midnight and instead of going to sleep like I wanted to a half hour ago, I'm sitting here waiting for housekeeping to refill the coffee service. I wouldn't suggest this hotel for business travelers. They need better oversight..

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy your stay but with some caution”
Reviews.Author: JulesfromIowa
Reviews.Content: I stay at a lot of Hilton properties in Chicago-- good value for th $$ and most hotels are well reviewed. Hilton owns quite a few properties in Chicago and while I normally stay at either the Homewood Suites or Hilton Garden, this Embassy Suites had a better price and an extra bedroom. Check in was a breeze. Frontline staff very personal and helpful, even our valet parking assistant was great. Our room was ready and it appeared clean in the surface. All's well so far. Out the front door and on to the shopping! Hotels in this area are perfectly located. We returned well into the evening after a great meal believe or not at the California Pizza Kitchen down the road (PF Changs also around the corner). We took stocked of our plans and decided to extend our stay by a day. Again, front staff handled our request with precision and a smile. Went to bed and slept well. Breakfast time!!! I am not at a 5star and don't expect it to be but, why can't the Embassy Suites do something different with their breakfast bar? Don't offer it if you cannot get it right. Worse food I have had in a long time! The place was packed with little ones carrying their dolls (so cute) so it was a bit noisy but that 's okay. They were fun to watch. The omlet was not good.
