The buffet had cold eggs and bacon and I refused to let my elderly mother eat their cold eggs for fear of bacteria. Coffee cups held maybe a half a cup. Cereal was stale. Thank goodness my mini muffin & fruit were edible. Let's go back to my room for a minute. While I said it was clean, I suggest to Hilton that it is time to change the furniture. The armchair and couch in 622 are badly worn. Isn't this just a cost of doing business, to recover or replace worn furniture? This is the bad. Now for the ugly. Day one I used the main restroom outside of the pool. Filthy! Toilets dirty. Floor had not been mopped in a couple of days or so it seemed. Just get me out and back to the room. Day two, certainly the staff has had time to catch up after a busy Easter weekend full of messy children. I watch the cleaning staff come out of the bathroom with hope. No such luck. Just as bad. Not sure anything had been done! This is the Embassy Suite for crying out loud, not Motel sick! I did register my comments as I am not afraid to speak out for the good and the bad. Come on managment. Don't worry so much about the front fountain and look at what the cleaning team is not up to. And then go eat breakfast in your kitchen. I'll bet you make some quick changes. Sure I will be back because as I said it's good value for $$$. I just wish someone way way up in Embassy Suites would take note and change the food. In my business we either do it right, don't do it, or change the way it's done so it is right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with perfect service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: OhioParadise
Reviews.Content: With a 5 and 8 year old; on a quick spring break. What a delightful hotel! An awesome breakfast every morning and cocktails and snacks every evening in the atrium are included in the price of your room! The rooms are clean and large; the staff was wonderful; great location for downtown Chicago! And fantastic restaurant! This is a great place for business or families! Thanks to everyone at Embassy Suites!

Reviews.Title: “The positive reviews are right, this place is great!”
Reviews.Author: buk_I_traveler
Reviews.Content: Great location within walking distance to most area attractions. Clean, spacious rooms, comfy beds, and the best service! From the nice woman who made fresh coffee for me even though they were almost ready to close down breakfast, the friendly bar staff at reception hour, the great service at the concierge desk (Phillip tried hard to get Oprah tickets - when unsuccessful he made good on his promise to find other fun things for us to do) and so much more. My kids loved the greeting each time we returned to the hotel-"we're so glad you're back". They felt like little celebrities. We will return to this hotel each time we're in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great Miracle Mile Location/Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Slamar
Reviews.Content: Whenever I'm in Chicago, I try to stay at this location. The staff is very friendly. The breakfast is always fresh and hot. The location is convenient to the best shopping and restaurants. Traveling alone as a female, I always feel safe walking in the area at night. The rooms are typical for Embassy Suites - 2 rooms, nice bedding and bathrooms with plenty of light. My favorite thing about staying here is the restaurant that is attached to the hotel - Osterio via Stratta. Awesome food, great service at the bar - Micki is a great bartender/server and always remembers me! The hotel has packages for the American Girl store also. Even when I can get into more upscale boutique hotels, this is a trusted can't go wrong option.

Reviews.Title: “Such a beautiful hotel inside and out”
Reviews.Author: aprilcstarkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with my sister and niece during the Gospel Music Channel's "Gospel Dream" auditions. I was actually trying out. We had a blast. The hotel was so beautiful. It was like walking through a garden, yet you were inside. From the fountains to the lit up trees to the walk ways and bridges you have built inside this hotel...its so beautiful! Our room was very nice! We were happy with the little living and dining room area and our beds were comfy! We loved our view of downtown Chicago! The breakfast was AMAZING for a hotel! Cooked up omelets or whatever you wanted! Overall, great place! Staff was friendly and everything about this place was just wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “OPRAH FANS - this is the place to stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ClaireTravels
Reviews.Content: If you are, like me, a huge OPRAH fan, this is the hotel for you!!! We had excellent service from the hotel even before checking in!!! I reviewed the hotel on this site and saw so many wonderful comments, so my girlfriend and I booked a room here. I contacted the Concierge in advance of arrival about possibly getting tickets to Oprah since I was unable to get them in advance of the trip. The Concierge actually returned my call saying there is no guarantee, but that they would surely try to get us tickets once we arrived. That blew me away - I've left messages for Concierges before in other hotels/cities and never received a call back!!! My girlfriend and I arrived at the hotel by taxi and were greeted by Mike, the Bellman. We had lots of bags and were very tired so he was a site for sore eyes! And what a friendly guy! We checked in easily (if you prepay the room, you get a WONDERFUL price so look into that for a steal of a deal!) and received exactly as we requested - upper floor away from the elevator. The hotel has 11 floors and we were put on the 10th floor! The hotel is ATRIUM styled with fountain in the lobby so sound does carry up. It has an open-air feeling to it. Lots of greenery makes it really beautiful! The elevators are fast and there are 4!!!! (I've been in hotels of the same size that had only 2 very slow elevators so this was a real bonus to me!) The Embassy Rooms are so large and roomy compared to other hotels! The flat-screened TV in the living room totally impressed me. But there is also a large TV in the bedroom as well. The beds are VERY comfy! The room was immaculate and having a refrigerator and microwave in the room is nice and convenient. I went to the Concierge desk and talked to Richard, who is so very professional and kind. I asked about Oprah tickets and he explained what their process is. He left a note for the morning Concierge to call the show and request tickets on our behalf. There are no promises but they do make a great effort which is should be acknowledged. The FREE breakfast is amazing! Hot, made to order omelets, pancakes, hash browns, cold cereals, bagels/toast/muffins, fresh fruit, juice, coffee - it's all there. And the cold items are cold as they should be as well as the hot items are hot! The staff clears the tables quickly - leave a little tip on the table for them cause they are very helpful and efficient. When we returned to the hotel in the afternoon, Philip, another Concierge, had left a message saying they requested the tickets from Oprah and would let us know if they heard from them. Philip had gotten the note from Richard and actually FOLLOWED THROUGH! Another WOW! After returning from shopping, Richard was back at the Concierge desk so we stopped to find out if he had heard from Oprah staff yet and he said no. We took the elevator up and by time we got in our room Richard had called and said that the Oprah staff called as soon as we walked away from the desk! We were put on Standby for the next dayâ€™s early morning taping. We were elated! In one hour we were told that we were upgraded to CONFIRMED! Richard even re-confirmed the time we were supposed to be there - then called us back with specific instructions for when to arrive, when we needed to leave the hotel by, and other necessary guidelines we needed to follow. This was totally a dream come true for me - to be able to see a taping of the Oprah Show! We gave Richard a BIG tip for his help! And also tipped Philip for his help too! During the remaining part of our stay, Richard was also very helpful in guiding us for meals. And Philip gave us info about Late Nite Catechism, which was playing at the Royal George Theater. What a hilarious show this is! Catch it if you can - only $30 at the door. Front desk staff was also very cordial. This hotel rates as FIVE STAR service! It is so very convenient to Magnificent Mile. There is a great grocery store across the street and, of course, a Starbucks on the corner. We did not dine in the restaurant or take advantage of the evening reception but both looked very popular with other guests. Overall this hotel rated 5 stars out of 5 on my survey card!!! Primo indeed! I also find it awesome that the management team acknowledges the reviews on this website with their thanks. How spectacular!

Reviews.Title: “Chicago's Best”
Reviews.Author: thesandmanboxer
Reviews.Content: From the time we stepped on to the curb in front of the Embassy Suites on State street we were treated like Royalty. The doorman opened our taxi doors and carried our bags inside to the desk. He was very funny and carryed a politeness that is not normally seen in a city the size of Chicago. The staff was very polite and helpful. Our room was immaculate!!! The free happy hour every night was exceleent as weel as the daily free breakfast. The Concierge was very informative and helpful. He made recommendations to dinner the first night and gave us passes to a very good night spot. The second night he helped us with reservations to a very nice restaurant. All in all this was a great time and experince at an awesome hotel.

Reviews.Title: “hotel was fine, restaurant put it over the top!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeanmarieOK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fine - a nice, typical Embassy Suites. The italian restaurant was killer good, and I ate there all three nights. I've put this on my 'must stay' list for Chicago, particularly when I am traveling alone, and don't want to walk alone at night for dinner. The restaurant is no compromise, I promise you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Embassy Suites -Downtown”
Reviews.Author: sumi16
Reviews.Content: My family stayed here for 2 nights in Dec. We booked this hotel after reading reviews and lot of research. Since we wanted to celebrate our Anniversary in Chicago, we were looking for an elegant hotel and this hotel lived upto our expectations. It is a great hotel for families. Rooms are big and clean. It is good for family of 4-5. I liked their complementary breakfast and managers reception. They would serve all those items when we think of break fast. You just name a dish and it is there for B/F It was wintertime. We could walk down to Magnificent Mile and near by restaurants. We all would definitely stay there next time

Reviews.Title: “Love the Downtown Embassy”
Reviews.Author: ryno26
Reviews.Content: Stayed for New Year's Eve at this Embassy as well as 2-3 other times over the last two years. I can honestly say this is the hotel my family ALWAYS requests. Reasons: - Location is great (as are other hotels in area I know) - Bathroon is BETWEEN bedroom and Livng room with sofabed (may seem insignificant but this is important to parents in that compared with Homewood or other hotels with suites that have the bathroom IN the bedroom area) - Have never encountered one rude service staff member (whatever their position they are ALWAYS pleasant) -The breakfast can be made to order as you wish and is INCLUDED in the price (omelettes and other brakfast items aren't rocket science and for a family of four this service alone adds $40-50 to any breakfast in the city). I must say I really am surprised this hotel is ranked #50. I have stayed at half of the top 20 "most popular" hotels in Chicago and although Sofitel, Park Hyatt, etc. are nicer (best for couples only IMO) , the $2-300.00 price difference doesn't justify the expense. I think this hotel should at least be in the top 15 for value, convienience, cleanliness, and service.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: MaxineTC
Reviews.Content: Accompanied spouse on a business trip. The location was terrific as it was close to attractions and restaurants/entertainment. The rooms are very spacious. The breakfast was included but was just standard fare. A short wine/cheese offering is included around 5 pm.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: firsedge
Reviews.Content: I often stay in Hilton chain hotels in Chicago but had never stayed at this one so thought I would give it a try. Can honestly say it was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in anywhere. From the moment at check-in to checking out 4 days later there was not one problem. All the staff were friendly and helpful, the conciege desk was brilliant, the rooms were spacious and cleaned well daily and the wifi actually worked! The managers reception was quite busy so we only went one day, but the breakfasts (cooked to order omlettes - pick you time carefully when you go) were superb. The location is perfect for shopping, just one block from the Mag Mile. Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent”
Reviews.Author: SwayAway
Reviews.Content: A magnificent hotel in structure, location and service. The door man at the time of our stay (Michael) was the greatest assistant/tour advisor/watchful eye for my friends and I when we would get seperated and wander in and out from our shopping frenzy. The happy hour was great fun, the front desk were brilliant however their cleaning/room service staff were desperately lacking in English completely which made requests (such as where the laundrette was and whether they could come back later to service the room) very difficult. Hard Rock cafe is not far around the corner and I highly recommend it! The mini convenience store inside the hotel is a rip off - avoid if possible.

Reviews.Title: “great family hotel”
Reviews.Author: spexs
Reviews.Content: we have just returned from a trip to chicago staying at the embassy suites 600 north state street. from the moment of arrival we were treated magnificently. the door men were so friendly and helpful. we were travelling with 4 small children and the rooms were ideal for us. they were spacious with very comfortable beds. the breakfast was great . the omlettes were mouthwatering. i would recommend this hotel to anyone. it is especially good for families with small children

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a little noisy”
Reviews.Author: bcsystems
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located close to Michigan Ave and the many other downtown attractions. You can hop on the free trolley close to the hotel and get to the further destinations for free. The breakfast is excellent though you best get there before 8:30-9am. Lines can be long. My only complaint is the overall noise of the place. The walls seem to have no insulation and I can hear the rooms around me. Also since I went with my family, I slept on the sleeper sofa. I can heard the outside waterfall and people walking the hallways all night. I was tempted to give it only a three star but I guess you can't control your room neighbors.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't recommend for Extended Stay”
Reviews.Author: mixerfsg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks for business training. The hotel was in a convienent location near the Magnificent Mile and bus/train stops. The hotel was nice looking. The beds were comfortable. The manager's reception (happy hour) with alcoholic drinks and a few snacks was good when I remembered it. The hot breakfast everyday was great, but don't be fooled by the cooked to order. That only means omlets and nothing else cooked to order. The concierge was very helpful getting reservations and giving directions, but there was only one for all guests so be prepared to wait until the person in front of you has been handled. My complaints: The price for internet daily is 10 dollars or you could use there business center which only has three computers and are always busy. The walls are paper thin in the rooms and you can hear those right outside your door if they are talking in a normal voices. I was almost able to hear full conversations through the vents from the guests near me. You can hear when the guests next door have the water running because the pipes are loud. The noise from the atrium will filter up to the rooms also. There is only one washer and two dryers for all guests that may wash there own laundry. It is inconvienent to be able to get change and laundry detergent at the front desk, but they are willing to give you change and let you buy single laundry detergent. I wouldn't recommend using the laundry service they have because the price is per item (ie. your underwear cost 6 dollars a piece to wash). I would recommend the dry cleaning at the hotel or the dry cleaners about four blocks south of the hotel on the right. The hotel and the travel agency I used didn't get everything straight with the corporate credit card I was suppose to have on file until I checked out on the 12th day and by that time they had already charged my personal credit card for the first week and some days. The hotel did fix this within the next few days, but it temporarily maxed my card out for those few days waiting for them to refund it. All in all, an okay time with a few minor bumps. I don't recommend for extended stays, but do make sure the hotel has everything correct on your reservation once you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Service and Comfort”
Reviews.Author: jberger
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown Chicago for 5 nights, and was very happy with the property. The included breakfast/ 6:30-9:30am was excellent (eating before 8am is best, as it gets busy later). There is so many great restaurants (Grand Luxe Cafe is one of my favorites) and stores closeby, and it feels very safe to walk about even after dark. I felt it was a safe hotel for a woman traveling alone. Internet access in the hotel is fast, however not free! $9.95 per day. Even if you only use it for an hour in the evening, after midnight you get a 2nd for the next day's useage. The 2 room suite was well appointed with a large comfortable bed, microwave, safe, coffee maker, sofa table and chairs. 2 TV's one a flat screen in the living area. Because there is no desk, the table is your computer work area, and the chairs at the table are hard and uncomfortable. The living room area furniture was hard as rocks and kind of worn in the suite I occupied. I beleive the sofa in the living room was a fold out bed. Other pluses, a pool and work out area that looked beautiful and clean, Manager's reception at 5pm offered free drinks, and snacks. It looked crowded, and one evening I stopped by at 6pm, and there were no snacks left. It is attractive and has a great front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “Stuck in a smoking room by this hotel”
Reviews.Author: caverbw
Reviews.Content: Got stuck in a smoking room. I was told upon checkin that while the hotel was fully booked, but not everyone had yet checked in. I asked for a non-smoking room and was told that "we sold all of our smoking rooms to Priceline." I know that as a Priceline customer one is second-class immediately, but there was NO hope of me bidding on this hotel and getting a non-smoking room. Terrible experience. Bidders beware of getting stuck here in a room that reeks of smoke!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great base for touring, families”
Reviews.Author: cliff_rock
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night over Labor Day weekend in conjunction w/ a special event in Chicago (two DB two room suite). This hotel will not knock your socks off with luxury, but it was clean and in pretty good condition. Bed room had a vanity sink w/ door that closed to living area w/ pull-out sofa. Lobby and common areas quite nice. Room pretty average for this type of property. Not the best mattress or linens, but pretty good towels, fixtures, etc. Small fridge and microwave were nice for the family. There are two grocery stores within a block of this hotel. Easy to stock up. Hotel is also on free trolley line (summer only), and short walk to CTA red line, mag mile shopping (with CTA bus services to museums, etc.). Just a great location with a lot of bustle where you can base your city visit. I missed the evening reception but family enjoyed it. Breakfast in the morning was great. Hotel provided guidance on when it gets busy; we avoided the rush and had a pleasant meal. Pool area was a bit tired, and they seemed to have used all available chlorine. Gym appears newly refinished, with pretty good equipment.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: BLT95
Reviews.Content: Got a great package deal through their website. Clean rooms and safe location. Staff was pleasant. The breakfast was good...plenty to choose from, but a bit chaotic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biz_TravelerMaryland
Reviews.Content: Summary PROS- location, breakfast, friendly staff CONS- very busy, small pool, long line for breakfast and manager's reception We stayed the week of 4th of July to enjoy the Chicago fireworks and celebration. The hotel was very convient to the local bus system and within walking distance to various attractions and food establishments. There is a grocery store across the street with a Starbucks. The hotel has a great breakfast and an OK manager's reception. The hotel's pool is a bit small for the number of kids that stayed that week and the fitness center was crowded. However, the fitness center had new Precor equipment. We left a portrait of ourselves from a dinner cruise in our room when we checked out. The cleaning staff and security personnel mailed our photo back to us which was very courteous and customer oriented. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy at the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: sanfranciscochloe13
Reviews.Content: We travel quite a bit and are HH members so we always try to stay in Hiltons when we can. We also travel with our two young children, so whenever we can, we book suites. We needed to spend 9 days in Chicago and after a lot of research settled on this hotel and have been very happy. PROS: Can't beat the location. great restaurants and shopping all around you and only 3 blocks to Magnificent Mile. We easily walked to Millenium Park and Oak Beach (up by the Drake Hotel off of Michigan Avenue) - my kids did fine with the walk. Easy to get taxis in this location as well. Hotel very clean, well organized, fairly consistent housekeeping. they honored all requests that we made. Great made to order breakfast in the morning Extremely comfortable beds - LOVE the beds Awesome and easy for families. CONS: The lobby is unusually and freakishly cold - beware. It is a madhouse at breakfast time between 7 and 9:30. Just be prepared and steel yourself. Pool is small. Completely fine, just small and gets crowded easily. If you don't want to be around kids, this isn't a good hotel for you. The only laundry facilities are on the 11th floor; there is only 1 washer and 2 dryers so be prepared to wait unless you go at an off time. There is street noise. Keep your windows closed at night and perhaps use a noise machine to block out noise. We were on the 6th floor and stayed on the Ontario Street side - it was quite noisy at times. All in all a perfectly good Embassy Suites and we'd probably stay here again. You will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakfast, great room, what more can you want!”
Reviews.Author: vetinari
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites for one night. Check in was a breeze. The suite itself comprised of a living room and bed room. There was a flat screen tv in the living room and a conventional one in the bedroom for those that care :) As it was a reward night, room service delivered free bottles of water to the room. A nice touch. The bed was luxurious and very hard to get out of in the morning! Ah breakfast! Other people have mentioned it but a free cooked breakfast is fantastic. I ate two omelets they were that good. Location wise, it was a 10 - 15 minute walk to Navy Pier and shopping and a subway stop were very close by. Overall, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “nice location”
Reviews.Author: psychocherub
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is totally ideal for those who wish to shop at mag mile since it's just 3 blocks away. Furthermore, the stop for the free trolley to navy pier is just a stone's throw away, making it pretty convenient for tourists. i love the overall design of the hotel, which appeals mainly to families. There is a little fountain wall in which kids can wade in and enjoy themselves. Nonetheless, the size of the bedroom itself is smaller than what you would expect from an average hotel with the same rating. Morever, this is more than compensated for by the adjourned living room with a tv set of its own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel overall, a Few Minor Problems”
Reviews.Author: jansonlygirl
Reviews.Content: Over all this was a very nice hotel, super friendly staff, especially the bell boys, they are there for any of your needs, be it luggage help, or even running an errand if you need something you have forgotten to bring! We stayed in a 2 room suite, we had the get away special for 249.00, which included a free bottle of champagne and strawberries, a $25 gift certificate to the Osteria downstairs, and a 1pm checkout. The strawberries and champagne were not in the room as promised but was resolved within a few hours, the gift certificate was only good in the Osteria, (this was unknown too us) we actually ate in the Pizzeria, we showed the hostess our gift card and she told us it was fine only to find out when the bill came it was only good in the Osteria, so we had no choice but to pay the bill in full, we used the certificate towards the least expensive wine for in the room, which still cost us $15.00 after the gift certificate, with surcharges, tax and %18 gratuity! The fold out sofa bed had no pillows anywhere in the suite, and no blanket! Staff was good and brought pillows, luckily my daughter had brought her own blanket. The phone in the master bedroom was broken, but the one in the living area was fine. Had a very small fridge, can't fit much, a family would be hard pressed to get a whole lot in there, microwave was fine, and all the standard things such as coffee etc. were there. The king size bed was VERY soft and had 6 pillows, which were also VERY nice, it was quiet, but the view was awful, we were in room 1117 on the top floor and faced a very ugly parking garage, I would have preferred to see the goings on in the streets. All in all I would say you could probably do better for a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Brightfeather1
Reviews.Content: Excellent Location, Friendly and Helpful Staff. The only complaint i have is the doors to other suites, they slam loud. Other then that it was a great hotel. Busy week there in downtown Chicago during the Fourth of July!!! If you can ,take advantage of the car stays free package because Valet parking is expensive. I would definately stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: ptgt20
Reviews.Content: The Chicago Embassy Suites is all about location. Its in the heart of the city, easily accessible to almost anything you could want to do. If you want to go to a baseball game, it's a block away from the Red Line which is how you get to both Wrigley and Commiskey. If it's food you're looking for, it's right across the street from the Webber Grill, right down the street from amazing restaurants like Quartino and Big Bowl and a few blocks from Pizzeria Uno and Pizzeria Due if it's Chicago deep dish pizza you are looking for. However, of course with the location you are going to get a few negatives. It seems everything you have with a normal Embassy Suites was just a little worse. It lacked the little touches. We were there for a long weekend in June, which must be prime tourist season, but there were some negatives. A highlight of all Embassy Suites is the decor inside. While this one did have nice waterfalls running through the hotel, it lacked the huge goldfish that typically fill these pools. The happy hour always had a line, sometimes a very long one. What made this even worse was there was a limit of one drink per person, so everyone you were with had to go up to bar rather than you getting a drink for both yourself and your companion. Seating around the bar quickly filled up and so you could not simply point to the person. Getting a drink meant saving your seat, or worse, if one of you was getting ready, waiting for the other to go down to get a drink. At breakfast there was the same issue. There was a line every morning, and finding seating was actually difficult on some mornings. They include a guide on when breakfast is the busiest in the room. On the last day we were there it took 10 minutes to get an elevator from the 2nd floor up to our room. Then, when we were leaving it took another 10 to get an elevator back down, and we subsequently stopped at every floor. However, almost all of these are the result of the hotel being in such a great location. And you get what you traditionally get with an Embassy Suites: giant rooms and very good service. Overall, if you want location and the quality of an Embassy Suites with just a few downsides, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: cardtraveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a short business trip. A 2 room suite with 2 TV's, free breakfast and cocktails, comfortable bed and convenient location was under $240. And if needed, the room also had a small refrigerator, microwave and coffee maker. A vanity sink was in both the bedroom and bathroom, and a bar type sink was in the galley. Only problem were the bathroom drains--- they seemed sluggish and probably needed a bit of maintenance. Otherwise, an AOK stay. Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “pretty nice place”
Reviews.Author: n6877
Reviews.Content: hotel is above average in service and quality not the best place I have stayed however on a 1-10 scale would be 8.5!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Habs01
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great. the staff is very friendly. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are very spacious with a great view. If you drive, be aware that parking is about $60 per day. Also they have a sky lobby. So you have to take an elevator from the parking garage to the main lobby. Then another elevator from the main lobby to the sky lobby and then another elevator from the sky lobby to the guest rooms. At the busiest times of day, be prepared to wait for the elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for visiting Chicago”
Reviews.Author: d0gwalker
Reviews.Content: Large, clean, quiet, well designed rooms. Good breakfast and complimentary drinks at the bar early evening. A great base in the city for a first-time visitor.

Reviews.Title: “pretty good deal”
Reviews.Author: funfor4
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel to be a great value for the money. The room was quite large, we have stayed at many suites in downtown chicago and I think this may be one of the best. Separate living room with sofa bed, microwave and fridge, then large bedroom with own sink in there. Clean lobby and rooms, staff friendly enough on check-in. Huge hotel but had plenty of elevators and had no problem going up or down. Didn't try the pool or cocktail hour, but breakfast was edible, the made-to-order eggs looked the best but I don't like eggs. The location also great, seconds away from Michigan ave. Absolutly no view from room, right into parking garage and was a little loud at night, but that never bothers me. Overall will probably stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorit Hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: LilMM3
Reviews.Content: Our family prefers this hotel to any other (including staying with family members in the city). It is conveniently located to everything we want to do. The staff is so friendly, they always remember us and it is like coming home each time we stay. We find the staff helpful when trying to locate things we are unfamiliar with, and their suggestions on places or servces we want to find are always perfect choices for us. The rooms allow us the comforts of home from the fridge and microwave to the 2 rooms with TVs and the extra sink helps accomodate all of us! We have stayed her since our child was a baby and each and every time they make him feel like a king! Whether it was a crib with a cozy blanket, or a fold out bed made to look like a throne, parents and children are always made to feel comfortable. We like to convenience to the supermarket (on the next corner) to stock up on supplies while in town and everything we need is in walking distance - great restaurants or shopping. We like the fact that we can use the indoor pool and love the hot breakfast with everything we would need to start the day of right.

Reviews.Title: “This is our favorite hotel in Chicago”
Reviews.Author: pjbogosian
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is extra friendly and makes our family feel at home every time we are there. From the time we check in, and all through our stay their friendly and expedient service makes us want to return over and over again. The best value in town and the best location for seeing the city. Being frequent visitor, we appreciate the fresh renovations to the property. As a family traveling together, the rooms are perfect for us with everything we need to make our stay complete. No request seems to be unreasonable and is handled very promptly. Our family loves the hot breakfast in the morning, which gives us more than the standard cold contental that others offers ( a great way to start the day). This is our home away from home in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “Unfriendly staff, overrated breakfast”
Reviews.Author: 57businesstraveler
Reviews.Content: Hospitality defined by apathetic and unfriendly staff is what you may experience at your stay here. I was in Chicago for a week, and my husband booked this place, b/c they have a separate living room and bedroom, as well as a microwave. We regretted the decision the day we walked in, where we were greeted rather unkindly by the front desk staff who could not crack a smile. Anytime we contacted the front desk, we had to call back numerous times, as they took forever to answer, although February was no big busy month for hotels in Chicago. The few times they actually got the phone, they were by no means courteous and hospitable. I don't think that guests should be made uncomfortable for asking for basic services or simple questions at a hotel. Part of the fee is for such services usually b/c the traveler is in a new place they don't know much about. I will never visit this hotel again, and highly discourage anyone from staying at Embassy Suites in downtown Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Love the hotel but hate the over priced parking! Big time gouge!”
Reviews.Author: A-snowbird
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a superb facility located in the middle of anything you could want to do, even walking in sub zero temps! There is a good grocery store 1/2 block away just to the right once you leave the front of the hotel (not Trader Joe's overpriced snob crap which is also close by). The room was very nice and the beds are sooooo comfortable. We enjoyed the cocktail hour, although the bartenders seemed to be working on a major slow down cue. Lines formed for the duration of the cocktail hour even when simply pouring a glass of beer. My only real beef is with the hotel parking. I read a previous poster who said take the hotel parking as it was such a deal. Well, think twice, it's more complicated than that if you watch your money. If you just want to park and walk, choose the public ramp within feet of the front door on Ontario St. for $12 a day (no in and out service, once out you pay). On the other hand, if you want in and out service, of course a tip each time your car is brought up, then go for the $40 per day. I will go back to this hotel gladly, but will not park in their lot. Lawry's Prime Rib on Ontario is soooo worth going to!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great breakfast”
Reviews.Author: wander_wonderland
Reviews.Content: Hotel was centrally located just north of the Chicago River, perfect for the Mag Mile and Hancock Tower and just a few blocks from the Loop. Subway stop within 100 metre walk. Rooms were large, comfortable and well equipped, though being English, the tea was awful, but you learn to live with that!! Pool was pretty tiny for a hotel of this size but it's location makes it more a base for sight seeing than a spa break. The complimentary breakfast was very good with a wide selection which set us up for the rest of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: AZTrainer
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights on business. The hot breakfast every morning was great. The manager reception at night offers 2 hours of free drinks and hot dogs. There is also wireless and wired internet in the rooms. I used a shuttle to get from O'Hare to the hotel but they advised against using one on the return trip. They can sometimes be late and if you are not waiting at the door they may leave without you. I used a taxi instead and it was about $40.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: caneshockey31
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on State St. It is nearby to a number of fine restaurants and attractions. All of the major attractions are either within a taxi ride or walk. The hotel is nice, the main lobby is not as extensive as you would expect for a regular Embassy Suites but the restaurant area and pool & fitness center are very nice. Our room was on the 11th floor and we had a view of the downtown area. Pros: Location Views Accessibility Pool & Fitness Center Cons: Restuarant (No high chairs visible) Basic Room Features This hotel is a very good hotel if you want to be close to the attractions and the such.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but nothing special”
Reviews.Author: b2buck
Reviews.Content: We had a group of 8 in 4 rooms for 3 nights. Hotel is in a very convenient location close to Michigan Ave. and all shopping with tons of great restaurants close by. Check in experience was very slow due to front desk personnel- both shortage and lack of ability. Rooms were clean but the bathroom had the weirdest swinging door on it that was a big hassle if you were coming in or out. I have stayed at a lot of Embassy Suites but never seen a door like this one. The bed had been updated but was nothing but a standard Embassy Suites room. Breakfast was very good but the logistics of how they had this one laid out caused a lot of confusion by guests and traffic issues. Cocktail hour was good. We ate one night in the hotel restaurant since we were wiped out from a long day of shopping. Food was ok but would not eat there again. There are too many great places close by for the same money.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandi_7
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our weekend trip to Chicago. The hotel was was really nice. Check in was fast and we even got to check in four hours early. The rooms were large and very nice. I think the one thing that I liked the best was the wonderful free breakfast buffett. They also had on the spot cooking stations if you wanted your eggs cooked special. Everything was hot and very fresh. The hotel is within walking distance to everything downtown. *A must do if you have never been to Chicago. Go to the 96 floor Bar in the John Hancock building about an hour or so before sunset. There is usually a wait to get on the elevator so go early. The sunset is awesome. Also the view of the city is just breathtaking. If you can't get a table, just go into the ladies bathroom and you can see it from there.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jo0501
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights in october on floor 17.If you have young children or suffer from vertigo stay lower down!The hallways overlook an atrium but the walls are glass..made me feel peculiar!The suites are well fitted out but i would say suitable for 4 max.Free breakfast good quality no waiting and have a much as you like.Happy hour in evening a little souless but hey its free.Location is great and in an area where we all felt completely safe.Well stocked supermarket just across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time!”
Reviews.Author: Midlander105
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us. I looked at some of the reviews once I'd booked and had some reservations about staying there as some of the reviews were grim. We had a wonderful time right from the moment we were met by the doorman till we got in the taxi to head back to the airport. The room/s were lovely, well apponted, well maintained, clean and had everything we needed for our three night stay. Yes the hotel is more expensive than others but you get what you pay for. The manager reception each evening was busy but you could have whatever (and as many as you wanted) you wanted to drink along with the snacks that were available too. Breakfast was great and hardly any waiting around to get served. There did appear to be some queues later on (after 8.30am) but given the size of the hotel it could have been a nightmare. The cook to order omelettes were delicious, I'd highly recommend them. Only gripe was that there was no changing area for the pool so you had to go down in your costume and go back to your room to get dressed. Robes would have been nice for this. The location is ideal, just a couple of blocks from the main shopping area and certainly in walking distance to Navy Pier and the Hancock Tower. Should we be back in Chicago we wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: carusdeb
Reviews.Content: I loved the Embassy Suites... Great location, near the Magnificant mile and lots of primo restaurants. The room was great. If your staying a few days having a microwave and frig right in the room is perfect. Along with internet and flat screen TV? A huge buffet breakfast was included in the stay. You could eat and skip lunch!.. Also, where else can you get happy hour these days with just about any type of drink free?

Reviews.Title: “Met Our Needs”
Reviews.Author: DeziMN
Reviews.Content: My family (husband, 14 yo & 12 yo) stayed here for 3 nights. Definitely in the heart of the city. Fairly quiet for being downtown. Extremely helpful and friendly staff. Free happy hour from 5:30-7:30 nightly. Very hearty breakfast. Clean room. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Meet all Expectations and then sum!”
Reviews.Author: artieboy
Reviews.Content: Was in town for a city wide convention. Service and staff were great. Rooms clean and well kept. Had trouble hailing a cab in the busy morning crunch time to get to McCormick Place. Walked over to the Marriott and it wasn't any better we waited over 45mins in line to get a cab that day. No fault of the Doorman/bellman just the location of the hotels. I did have much better luck the next few days by walking around the corner to Dearborn and hailed a cab within 2 mins.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: kaibacorp
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here in late August for five nights. The room was good sized for big city hotel rooms, and having two rooms means that everyone isn't on top of each other all time. Yes the walls are thin, and you will hear city noise, but what do you expect ? You're not in Kansas. The breakfast was fine, eggs, cereals, yogurt, fruit and breads. No it's not elegant dining but considering what hotels charge for breakfast, it's a significant savings to have a free breakfast when travelling with children. The staff, parking, cleanliness were all good. The location is central for visiting Chicago. And the neighborhood is safe with people out and about at all hours. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Even better Than Expected”
Reviews.Author: mrseiselburger
Reviews.Content: I'd heard glowing reviews of Embassy Suites but the photos on the Web site looked just average. I was pleasantly surprised when I met three friends at the lakefront location on Columbus Drive. We had a room with two double beds and a pull-out couch in the living room for two nights. The room was spacious as Chicago hotels go, and well appointed. The beds were luxurious and comfy, with a view of the lakefront a bonus, and the living room and kitchenette very pleasant. The only negative was a feeling of "being in the joint" as we stepped off the elevator and inched our way along the catwalk some sixteen floors up above the atrium lobby. It really is very prison like! Breakfast and the manager's reception were a nice add ons. Though we only subjected ourselves to the evening experience one night as the crowd awaiting service at the manager's reception looked thirsty and threatening. The thunderous rush to the bar at 5:30 sharp was a bit off-putting. We chatted and waited at our table and watched the chaos for 20 minutes and did eventually get a glass of wine, but the overall experience was hordish. The full breakfast was not so bad, but the hotel did use elevator postings to warn of red and green light times for breakfast. So take heed.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep”
Reviews.Author: Shopgirl2
Reviews.Content: Room was facing State Street and traffic kept us up all night long along with the noisy people in the next room. Water pipes are loud and you can hear water running all the time. Not a good night's sleep when you have to run a marathon the next day. Requested safety pins from housekeeping, never got them. Will not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “No, no and then again no”
Reviews.Author: Jwolu
Reviews.Content: I paid 359 USD per night for a room. Stayed here with two children. This hotel depressed us all so much that we tried to find another but it was too late to do so, as anything better was booked. The first thing you notice is the crowd of people in the lobby, then in the lifts (elevators), milling around on the floors. There are people everywhere. You can't get away from them. Saw teen boys making osbcense gyrating movements with their hips to others. The rooms are located around the atruim or quadrangle, so you can look down from the corridor before you enter your room. A bit like subsidised housing. This means that you never get away from people and have to be careful to keep your curtains drawn. The room is not a "suite". It is shabby beyond description.The sofabed sags in the middle and you have to careful about the windows/curtains which also let in light and noise from all the people coming and going all night long. On top of it, they host events in the restaurant for non-guests til late at night. So forget about a good night's sleep. Oh and if you are on the end of the building which does not face the street, your view from the back window is their multi-storey car-park which is about ten feet away from the room. People parking can see you clearly and you them. Breakfast is a sad crowded affair with plastic trays, lines and more lines and styrofoam/stryene cups. Obviously mass-catering here- plates have that gritty feeling of not being properly washed. What more can I say- we hated this place so much.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Expect Too Much”
Reviews.Author: albrauner
Reviews.Content: Maybe I've come to expect too much, but I have to say I was pretty disappointed with our four night stay at the Embassy. My first impression when we walked into the hotel was that it was dirty. There was stuff all over the lobby floor and no one seemed the least bit concerned. The room we requested, a suite with two double beds, was sold out so they gave us a room with a king instead, knocking off $100/night. Ok, that was nice! The room itself was satisfactory. It was a litlle stuffy and the airconditioner didn't seem to work that well. I found the bed hard and very uncomfortable, and the sheets were really, really scratchy. The plasma t.v. was a hit with the kids, though. Several times I tried to call the front desk or guest services for additional pillows and blankets, and no one answered. When I got through, I was told they didn't have any extra pillows. The breakfast was ok, although we've had better at a Country Inn & Suites. There were scrambled eggs, bacon, sausage, pancakes, some yogurt and bakery goods. Made to order omlets are also available, but we didn't have any. On the weekend, there can be a lot of traffic for breakfast, but the management did a great job of keeping everything moving. There is also a Starbucks in the building. The concierge was knowledgable about the subway and gave us great directions to the red line, which is a short walk away. We walked almost everywhere, except to the Cubs game. Overall, when we pay this much for a hotel room, I expect quite a bit. Next time, we'll forego the "separate bedroom" and book a standard room in one of the nicer hotels in Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Kids”
Reviews.Author: lisa222
Reviews.Content: This Embassy suites is perfect for families with kids, although I'd choose a boutique hotel if I didn't have kids. The hotel honored my request for 4 rooms in a row for my family and brothers' families. The teens loved being able to go down to breakfast or the evening snack hour without parents (although with the atrium architecture, we could see tham at all times.) The atrium brings a certain amount of noise into the living room of the suite, especially during a Saturday night wedding (thankfully, it ended by the time we returned from the free fireworks at navy Pier.) The breakfast service on weekends was crowded, but the management worked hard to keep things moving with extra serving stations and written advisories about the busy times. Happy hour lines could be lengthy, but moved fairly quickly. I felt the mgt. was on top of the situation, and was very responsive. Richard, the weekend concierge was very knowledgeable about restaurants, which busses to use, and church services. I asked for quiet rooms, which meant we were in the back overlooking the parking garage (but no street noise.) My parents are hard of hearing, and loved their view of State St. at night. Be sure to consider which is more important to you. The hotel was pricey, but the location and service was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for families”
Reviews.Author: KrisGGainesville
Reviews.Content: Stayed during family trip to Chicago. Great experience! Clean and comfortable. Location is unbeatable, we walked nearly everywhere. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: applestrudel
Reviews.Content: Good value hotel in an excellent location only a short walk from Michigan Avenue with many excellent bars and restaurants on your doorstep, as well as easy access to the FREE Navy Pier trolley and the Gangster tour only a couple of blocks away. The bedrooms themselves were clean and spacious and I have to say the bed was one of the most comfortable I have slept in. The only downside to the bedrooms I thought was not having free wireless internet which this day in age is usually pretty standard. I was very impressed with the evening free drinks reception and the breakfast was far better than expected with a good variety to suit all tastes. I will certainly be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel! Just watch the noise...”
Reviews.Author: Jakey450
Reviews.Content: This hotel is almost perfect. The proximity to the Magnificent Mile, along with the loop make it great for walking. It's also great for public transporation. The evening reception was nice, with a little food and free drinks. The breakfast was also good enough to get you going in the morning! My only complaint is the noise level from the atruim. As all of the rooms have a door facing the atrium, if you are utilizing the bed in the living room, light-sleepers will probably not sleep. However, I heard absolutely no inside noise in the bedroom. Overall, this is a GREAT hotel for the price!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: jdsFlanders
Reviews.Content: Terrific location; walk to most attractions; took a tour with the Chicago Trolley Company - 1 block from hotel; stops at 13 different location; 2 blocks from Michigan Ave; took architectural tour - beautiful! Great room; typical indoor pool - a bit warm/chlorinated - but not there for pool; Great front-door service - greeted immediately upon arrival by Michael who was so pleasant to us all weekend; breakfast was great - nice seating area; happy hour - nuts, pretzels - nothing real special. Very nice rooms and bathrooms w/marble sinks, etc. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, One Room Suite”
Reviews.Author: UniversityLad
Reviews.Content: I was attending a conference in Chicago over a weekend and had to divide my stay between two hotels. I pricelined a room for Saturday night only and won the Embassy Suites Downtown. It was a slightly interesting experience. I had thought all Embassy Suites' rooms were two bedroom suites. Apparently one room on each floor is listed a "King Parlor Suite"--that means that the firestairwell is where the living room would normally be and you just a long hallway to the bedroom in back. I was changing hotels midway and called ahead to ask if I could check in early. They said they had a King Parlor Suite available if I wanted that. It was fine as I was there only one night, bur I was a little surprised when I walked into the room and found it was only one room. The bathroom was also small with only a standup shower stall rather than a bathtub. The toiletries were actually very nice (herb scented) and nice than those provided at the Westin I had stayed at the night before. The room was very clean and well kept and the bedding of high quality, but having stayed at the Westin the night before, it was obviously of a lower star quality with laminated particle board type furniture. That said, it is a solid three star hotel--clean and well kept.. There were one or two weddings going on that night and the noise from the atrium was noticably audible in the room well after midnight. It might be better in the two room suites where you could close the door to the bedroom. Valet parking is conviently located right under the hotel--I think around 37 dollars per night. The parking guys did not lift a finger to help me with getting luggage into or out of my car--maybe it's not their job. Location is convieniently located in River North near the Weber Grill restaurant. The Italian restaurant located off the lobby looked pretty good.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our trip”
Reviews.Author: FloridaMember
Reviews.Content: It's all you would expect from an Embassy Suites Hotel. Location was great as well as the breakfast and happy hour. My only complaints were that the fitness room was very warm and there was not a safe in the room. We loved it though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: workslikethat
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I spent two nights and had a pleasurable stay. Hotel is close to Michigan Ave and 1 block to the L red line. We arrived at the hotel early on our check in day and the staff allowed us to check in. Staff was pleasent and helpful. Room was very clean. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Trip - Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: snwarf01
Reviews.Content: Mom, sis and I met in Chicago for a girl's weekend to celebrate my mother's birthday. We arrived at the hotel at 8:45 AM on Friday morning. I was able to preregister at the desk and the employee told me I could check back earlier than 3 since my room would probably be ready. The extremely friendly bellman took my luggage and teased me that "it was so sad we had to go shopping!" Security was also very helpful and locked my laptop in their security area rather than the general luggage hold. We came back at 2 and the room was ready. 10th floor, corner room, 2 doubles. Complimentary bottled water was waiting for us as a HH member. The room was very clean and extremely quiet. Beds/pillows were extremely comfortable. The pullout bed was a no-go as it was just too flimsy. Sis and mom ended up sharing a bed :) I lucked out on that one!! The breakfast bar each day was not crowded, but we were there around 8 am each day. Choices were the normal breads, meats, eggs. The hot foods were slightly cold and the bread a little stale the first day. The next day we got cooked to order eggs which were MUCH better. Overall not bad especially since included in the room rate. We were always gone during the manager's reception so no review on it. The hotel offers free internet in the business center which I used two days to check email and get boarding passes. The room did not have an ethernet cable (I forgot mine) so my laptop was of no use. The location is awesome with just a few blocks from Michigan Ave. We had restaurants all around and walked everywhere. We walked to the Oriental Theater Saturday night and did not feel unbearingly unsafe on the walk back - we speed walked back and made it in about 12 minutes :) Overall, nice clean hotel, great staff and comfy beds. Great location!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location on budget”
Reviews.Author: LizzyW
Reviews.Content: We have a family of 4 so to get a room that would accommodate 6 was superb value for money. The breakfast in the morning is more than adequate and the managers free drinks in the evening was a bonus. The staff were very friendly and helpful, I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the city on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “great location, mediocre hotel”
Reviews.Author: mplsmama
Reviews.Content: Booked too far in advance and was stuck with a pricey, inflexible reservation. Lovely view of a parking ramp. Note that the luggage carts can only be used by bellmen. There's a lot of nickel and diming at the facility, which isn't very family-friendly. Breakfast buffet is largely inedible.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, decent suite.”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights here on business for a conference at the McCormick Convention Center. The location is excellent with respect to tourist locations in Chicago, but poor for getting to the convention center. The hotel staff was nice and gladly let me switch rooms the first evening due to problems with a neighbor. The hotel was a little noisy with tourist traffic (i.e. kids running around), but evenings were quiet. The rooms were large suites, which was a little overkill. The kitchenette area was in need of some renovation. In both rooms, the cabinetry was warping and there were stains on the floor near the minifridge. Everything else was average. Breakfast was included, and consisted for the standard bagels and muffins, in addition to hot items like an omelet bar, bacon, sausage, eggs, hasbrowns, etc. While the room wasn't as nice as I had anticipated, the overall experience was satisfactory and I would consider staying here again if other options were booked.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Staff Are Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: busymomIndianapolis
Reviews.Content: Spent this past weekend with my husband @ the Embassy Suites Downtown and had a fantastic time. We were very impressed with the hotel and all of the "extras" (fabulous breakfast, Manager's evening reception). We were equally impressed by how friendly and helpful the staff of the hotel were. We will definately stay there again on our next visit to Chicago.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in the middle of Downtown”
Reviews.Author: LinAnnBish
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a convention that I attended. What a great place. They have a free cooked to order breakfast daily and in the evening they have a Managers Complimentary snacks and cocktails from 5-7 nightly. Lobby area is actully a floor above from the ground level which makes it a nice place to sit and relax. This is also where the breakfast area is. The rooms are mini suites and are very comfortable. The hotel is close to all of downtown and within walking distance from the Navy Pier. The city of Chicago is a great town. Other members that attended the convention were staying at the Sheraton and the Ritz across the street from us and were disappointed. They had to pay for everything including the newspaper. Our was delivered free daily to your room. There were a lot of families there also so I would recommned this hotel for families. Overall great place and very convienent. I would stay there again for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service...Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: thebee
Reviews.Content: I have not stayed at this particular property in about 5 years, moved to the Lakefront Embassy for awhile. There has been a renovation done and it is great. Service is fabulous as I expected, rooms roomy and comfortable and well decorated. Breakfasts are the BEST...cooked to order or yogurt or doughnuts...etc. This hotel is close to all shopping, theatres and nightlife. I enjoyed the valet parking free "deal" offered by Hilton. It was nice to pull into the heated car lot, have someone park my car and take the elevator up to checkin. Loved the doorman, very kind and friendly and the evening hospitality included hot dogs, free drink and munchies. My 16 year old daughter and I took in the show "Wicked" and it was a great walk there and back. We love Chicago and all it has to offer and we love Hilton Hotels in Chicago!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: mbeaj
Reviews.Content: Great location! Girlfriend w/e....adjoining suites. Nice size living room area in suite,clean, good showers, lot of towels,empty refrig, microwave, hair dryer, drapes make rooms really dark. Entire staff was extremely friendly & helplful. Walking distance to Water Tower Place, the "bean", restauants. Includes full buffet breakfast (hot/cold foods) with lots of seating; also manager reception in evening. Nice lobby. Would HIGHLY RECOMMEND!

Reviews.Title: “Very happy with the Embassy Suites”
Reviews.Author: taz29
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 5 night stay at the hotel with my husband. The location is perfect. You are two blocks from Michigan Avenue, and one block from the Grand Subway station. There is also a Starbucks right beside the hotel and small grocery store right across the street. The breakfast at the hotel is the normal stuff at breakfast buffets, omlettes were nice. The nightly reception was also great. It was very crowded over the weekend, but we never waited more than a few minutes in line for breakfast or for a drink a night. The room service was so-so, over priced, had it one night for dinner. The room looked like it had been redone recently. Linens were nice. There was a little bit of street noise at night, but we were so exhausted every night from walking around that I hardly noticed it. The workout room was great, had 3 treadmills, 2 elipticals, and 2 bikes, plus free weights. We did most of the tourisist stuff and really enjoyed ourselves in Chicago. I highly recommend going to see Wicked at the Oriental theater. Outstanding performance and enjoyed the venue. Also check out restaurant.com before you go, as there is many restaurants in the downtown area. We had an amazing dinner at the Chestnut Grill on Chestnut Street near the Hancock building. I bought a gift certificate on restaurant.com for $10 which we used.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing cold pool!”
Reviews.Author: traveling_with_tots
Reviews.Content: My husband, 4 year-old daughter and I stayed at this property December 30 - Januray 2nd. Overall, the hotel was clean, staff were friendly and the location was great. Unfortunately, we had a few problems. Our room, upon arrival, was very cold and the cable was broken. A custodian came to fix both problems and was successful after several hours of work. My biggest complaint was the pool. The tile appeared dirty and the temperature of the water was very cold. We complained the first day and the staff admitted the heater had been turned down (why?) and that they would increase the temp by the following day. The next day, although it was a bit warmer, it was still too cold for us to swim. Since the pool is my daughter's favorite thing at any hotel, the cold temp really dimished our enjoyment. We will not return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “2 Stays - Both Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: toomuchtravel
Reviews.Content: Family and I stayed two nights at the beginning of the week and one night at the end of the week. I'm sure there are other great places to stay in Chicago, but it would be hard for any of them to beat the Embassy Suites Downtown. The staff - from the doorman to the bellhops to the front desk to the breakfast and evening hospitality crews - are all first class. Any request was met with a smile and "sure we can" attitude. None of the nights were sold out, so evening and breakfast crowds were not too bad. On the Friday night stay, there were definitely more families with more children. This was most noticeable in the pool and business center (the hotel should ban under 18 from the business center). We got an incredible Internet rate through the Hilton web site, but this place would have been worth a higher price. The place is modern and everything was in great working order. The breakfast line is very efficient as the get the omelettes started and add the ingredients as requested - it helps keep the line moving. Was always able to find plenty to eat and places to sit. There is a grocery store right across the street and plenty of restaurants within easy (and very safe) walking distance. The grocery even has a good deli counter with hot food. If going to Navy Pier, the free trolley is fine, but not as frequent as the bus (a bargain at $2 per adult and older child). Someone told me their family took a cab - $10, including tip. The Chicago Childrens Museum is really loads of fun - check your local museum for reciprocal membership privelages. I will definitely try to stay here on any return trip, especially at a great rate.

Reviews.Title: “nice, but i overpaid”
Reviews.Author: bamcrewmom
Reviews.Content: Booked in mid nov at the embassy web site and got an internet rate of $249. Thought it was a deal, until I checked again a week before i left and see I could have saved about $75 a night. Do not ever book any internet rate. Booked $249 for a king, asked if they could accomdate a double when I got there, they said no, since I had a pre-paid room. Almost $1000.00. Sad thing was the hotel was only half booked and I could have had a double if they really wanted to give me one, and I am a Hilton Member too. Breakfast was good, evening reception was good, loved Chicago, but next time will stay in a cheaper hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great experience at embassy suites”
Reviews.Author: dwalters
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the embassy suites over the thanksgiving holiday. check in was very easy and fast. our room was very nice and clean. after we arrived in our room, a maid came by and brought us ice and terry robes to use during our stay. the evening reception was very nice also. the bartenders were very friendly, even though we had to wait in line for our drinks. (the hotel was booked full) . breakfast omlets were very good also, my only complaint would be that the buffet food could have been hotter. But overall we were very satified with our stay, and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Location”
Reviews.Author: NeednSun
Reviews.Content: The Embassy Suites Downtown is located in the middle of everything. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. We loved the complementary breakfast and the free drinks they serve from 5-7. There's a Starbuck's and ColdStone Creamery in the same building, which we loved. It's almost impossible to find hotels this spacious at this price!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value”
Reviews.Author: Lucyspoileddog
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Embassy Suites Downtown for 5 nights to attend a business conference. The location is fantastic, with no need to rent a car if you can make it to the hotel without one (take the airport shuttle or taxi). Everything is in walking distance, great restaurants close by, and in a safe area. The front desk managed to find a free King suite upon my request at check in, since I had been reserved a double by mistake. Rooms kept clean, the bed was very comfortable, absolutely no problems with the room. The extra value is in the daily breakfast and manager's reception. Even if the line seems long at breakfast, it moves quickly, and there are always tables available by the time you need one. The nightly happy hour is a nice change from the 12 dollar drinks you will pay at area restaurants, so take advantage of it if you're so inclined. Not premium brands, but hey, it's free. It was also very nice to be greeted upon returning from to the hotel each evening with a friendly, "Welcome Home!" by the porter. They seem to make an effort to be friendly and warm. I would use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Liked staying in this area”
Reviews.Author: smingebrig
Reviews.Content: Found this property to be a decent value and a great neighborhood. I have an emotional attachment to the Palmer House, but this was cheaper, and, of course, there is free breakfast, free drinks and plenty of space. Everything was pretty well managed and maintained. I really liked staying in this part of town...it feels a little scary in parts of the loop after dark, but it felt safer walking around in this area. The selection of restaurants was better, too.
